hence inclusion of  18 as  21812188 was at the discretion of the editor cross reference douglass center board  2226 et seq  cemeteries ch 9  parks and recreation ch 23 created there is hereby created pursuant to ksa 121914 a combined parks and recreation department for the city of manhattan kansas  121581 appointment of director officers and employees the city manager is hereby authorized to appoint such officers and employees as may be necessary for the proper operation of the parks and recreation department including the appointment of a director of the parks and recreation department  121581 director responsible to city manager the parks and recreation department shall be under the direction and control of the director of parks and recreation who shall be responsible to the city manager for the functions described below and such other functions as assigned by the city manager  121581 organization the parks and recreation department shall be composed of the following a divisions 1 parks and facilities division a parks b cemetery c forestry d facilities maintenance 2 recreation division a sports activities b arts and crafts b special activities 1 douglass center 2 zoo  121581 parks and facilities division the parks and facilities division shall plan supervise and maintain the parks cemetery and forestry of the city as well as all facilities located within the department with the exception of those located within the aforementioned special activities  121581 recreation division the recreation division shall plan and supervise all recreation programs within the city with the exception of those located at the aforementioned special activities  121581 director of douglass center the director of douglass center shall be responsible for all facilities located at the center as well as all recreation activities and community programs that take place there the director of douglass center is hereby specifically directed to cooperate with the superintendent of the parks and facilities division as well as the superintendent of the recreation division for functions that overlap with those divisions the director of douglass center shall report directly to the director of parks and recreation  121581 curator of the zoo the curator of the zoo shall be responsible for all facilities located at the zoo as well as all recreation activities that take place there the curator of the zoo is hereby specifically directed to cooperate with the superintendent of the parks and facilities division as well as the superintendent of the recreation division for functions that overlap with those divisions the curator of the zoo shall report directly to the director of parks and recreation  121581 secs 2189 2190  reserved boards agencies and commissions footnotes  9  cross reference airport advisory board  711 et seq  building board of appeals  811 et seq  electricians board of examiners  876  plumbers examining board  8116  cemetery board  946 et seq  human relations board  1021 et seq  public housing advisory board  1111 et seq  riley countymanhattan board of health  1711 et seq  library board  1811 et seq  advisory park board  2316 et seq  urban area planning board  2616 et seq  big lakes regional planning commission  2629 et seq division 1  generally governing body to assume duties of urban renewal agency board a pursuant to the constitution and laws of the state the governing body does hereby and herein assume all powers formerly exercised by the urban renewal agency board b this assumption of powers and duties of the urban renewal agency board by the governing body shall include all past present and future activities relating to urban renewal including the exercise of the power of eminent domain substitution of parties in any and all pending litigation and any future litigation the ownership of and power to convey full title to all property both real and personal of the urban renewal agency and any and all other powers and duties created by operation of law  state law reference urban renewal law ksa 174742 et seq secs 21922205  reserved division 2  city environmental board created there is hereby created in and for the city a group to be known as the city environmental board  purposes it shall be the purpose of the city environmental board to conduct investigations hold public meetings undertake comprehensive studies and do and perform those things necessary in order to ascertain whether or not there exists in this community environmental conditions which are in fact detrimental to the health safety or welfare of the residents of the city generally it is recommended to said board that they inquire into and endeavor to ascertain whether or not air water sight or noise pollution is existing or whether other conditions prevail all of which are dangerous to or otherwise inimical to the well being of the city and its occupants  composition the city environmental board shall be composed of nine members  appointment the members of the city environmental board shall be appointed by the governing body  terms of the members first appointed to the city environmental board three shall be appointed for a term of one year  three shall be appointed for a term of two years and three shall be appointed for a term of three years on the expiration of the term of each board member he or his successor shall be appointed for a term of three years  filling vacancies any vacancy occurring in the membership of the city environmental board shall be filled by appointment of the governing body for the unexpired term  officers the members of the city environmental board shall elect a chairman vicechairman and secretary from among their numbers a the chairman shall preside at all meetings and otherwise serve as the official head of such board b the vicechairman shall act in the absence of the chairman c the secretary shall record the proceedings of the board and otherwise maintain a written record of their deliberations and activities this will include a permanent file of minutes in the city clerks office    21974 meetings the city environmental board shall hold meetings within their requirements whether on call andor on work schedule as necessary and a regular public meeting to be held each quarter at a time and place established by the board itself  provided however that the chairman will cause publication notice of the date time and place of each regular meeting to be had in the official city newspaper at least two days in advance of the meeting    21974 make recommendations it shall be the purpose of the city environmental board after ascertaining the true facts about the conditions existing in the community to thereafter make recommendations to the body as to policies which may be adopted or a specific course of action which may be pursued by the governing body in order to terminate abate or nullify said detrimental condition further the board shall make recommendations to the governing body of positive programs designed to improve the health safety welfare and attractiveness of the city and the conservation and wise use of the resources of this community  liaisons appointed the city environmental board will work closely with the city planning board and the city park board in pursuance of these goals and the board shall appoint one of its members to act as liaison with the city planning board and one of its members to act as liaison with the city park board furthermore these three city boards will exchange minutes of their respective meetings with each other  annual report the city environmental board will make an annual report in writing to the governing body on its activities accomplishments and needs which report will be submitted in january of each year  secs 22172225  reserved division 3  douglass center board footnotes  10  cross reference organizations of parks and recreation department  2184  director of douglass centers  2187 created there is hereby created in and for the city an advisory board to be known as the douglass center board  purposes the douglass center board shall recommend administration policy to the governing body for the operation of the douglass center in the city  composition the personnel of the douglass center board shall consist of seven members four of the members shall be residents of either ward 1 or ward 4 precinct 1 of the city the remaining three members may be residents of any part of the city a reasonable and good faith effort shall be made to appoint two persons to the board who are under the age of 18 if the mayor after reasonable and good faith effort is unable to find enough qualified persons under 18 who are willing to serve on the douglass center board the mayor shall notify the board of that situation upon such notification the board shall have 45 days to recommend qualified persons to fill the vacancy or vacancies in such instance the board may recommend any qualified person regardless of age the mayor upon receiving such recommendation from the board may choose to appoint the persons recommended or may appoint persons of hisher own choosing    11299   121801   51507 appointment the members of the douglass center board shall be appointed by the mayor with the advice and consent of the governing body    12098 terms a each member of the douglass center board shall serve for a period of three years except initially three for one year three for two years and three for three years if a petition is submitted to the governing body signed by 20 percent or more of those qualified and registered to vote and who further reside in the specified geographical area as set forth in section 2228 then and in that event the governing body may authorize an election to elect the five members of the board to come from the specified geographical area the rules and regulations for conducting the election shall be determined by the governing body the douglass center board shall be responsible for the conduct of the election pursuant to the rules and regulations as promulgated by the governing body b the members of the board while appointed for a term for the convenience of the city shall serve in that term at the pleasure of the governing body    12098 reserved editors note of adopted jan 20 199 repealed  2231 which pertained to removal from the douglass center board and derived from  1703 of the 1973   filling vacancies in the event of a vacancy in the membership of the douglass center board the same shall be filled by the governing body for the unexpired term  ex officio member the human relations board shall appoint one of its members who will serve as ex officio member of the douglass center board such ex officio member may participate in the deliberations of the douglass center board but shall not be entitled to vote  meetings the douglass center board shall hold regular monthly public meetings at a time and place to be specified by the board the douglass center board may hold additional public meetings upon the call of the chairman or upon written request from four or more members of the board  uses of center the governing body does hereby declare that the douglass center is open to all persons of this community regardless of race color creed age sex or national origin further it shall be one of the purposes of the douglass center board to determine and suggest to the governing body certain specific policies which will encourage and enhance the fullest and wisest use of douglass center  advisory powers the governing body does hereby specifically state that the douglass center board shall have advisory powers in the following areas to wit 1 board shall advise the governing body on the scope and content of programs to be initiated at douglass center the governing body does specifically instruct board to be mindful of the fact that said programs should be designed to serve the interest and needs of the community and provide for all groups in the community without restriction to race religion age sex or national origin the board is further authorized to employ all public resources available in order to insure effective implementation of programs once commenced 2 the board shall prepare an annual budget for the operation of the douglass center and shall recommend the adoption of the same to the governing body 3 the board shall advise and counsel with the city manager and the governing body on the size and quality of the staff both volunteers and professionals who may be needed to work with the director of douglass center in order to implement the programs of the center the board shall formulate a job description and specify qualifications desired for director of the center or other staff positions 4 the board shall aid in the solicitation of applications for all staff members in the case of director and supervisor notice of openings or vacancies in either or both of these positions shall be advertised in the official city newspaper for not less than five consecutive days and by whatever other means the board may deem necessary the board will assist in determining the contents of the advertising for these positions but the city manager will be responsible for its publication and distribution after examining the applications for director supervisor or any other potential staff member the board shall make effective recommendations in writing to the city manager who shall then be charged with the responsibility for filling these positions 5 the board shall submit to the governing body written monthly and annual reports covering all aspects of the operations of the douglass center  utilization of resources the governing body recognizing the contribution now made at douglass center by the recreation commission and other groups in the community does instruct the douglass center board to continue to utilize the resources of the recreation commission and such other groups in the planning scheduling and implementation of activities and programs at the center the governing body does further direct that the douglass center board be constantly alert to initiate measures designed to stimulate enjoyment and creativity in the use of leisure time strengthen family life encourage interest in learning and try to stimulate pride and accomplishment to the members of our community the governing body does further direct the douglass center board to initiate measures incorporating philosophies of integration in all areas of community life in this city  bylaws  quorum the douglass center board shall adopt bylaws as necessary for the conduct of the board subject to approval by the governing body the bylaws shall establish that four members of the board shall constitute a quorum and be necessary for the transaction of business  12098 division 4  public building commission footnotes  11  editors note  2 adopted feb 2 198 being not specifically amendatory of this has been included as  2239 2240 at the discretion of the editor treated as superseding former  22392244 which pertained to similar subject matter and derived from  adopted apr 20 1982 creation  membership  term there is hereby created a public building commission which shall be a municipal corporation the governing body of which shall consist of five members all of whom shall be the duly elected or appointed city commissioners of the city of manhattan kansas each such elected or appointed city commissioner of the city of manhattan kansas shall automatically become and be a member of the governing body of the public building commission and shall so serve during the entire time but only so long as he or she shall continue as a duly elected or appointed city commissioner of said city  2288 purposes functions and powers the public building commission is hereby created for the following purposes and shall be and is hereby authorized to exercise the following functions and powers to wit a to acquire a site or sites for and construct reconstruct equip and furnish a building or buildings or other facilities of a revenueproducing character including parking facilities or purchase or otherwise acquire such building or buildings or facilities and such building or buildings or facilities shall be maintained and operated for the housing and accommodation of city offices county courthouses jails or correctional facilities offices for school districts or offices for state or federal agencies or such other purposes as are commonly carried on in connection with such facilities b to acquire land and facilities including leasehold interest therein adjacent to or near kansas state university and constructing reconstructing equipping and furnishing such facilities on such land and the leasing or subleasing of such land and facilities to any board of trustees of kansas state university or to the official governing body of said university c to rent all or any part of its buildings or other facilities to any federal state or county governmental agency or any municipal corporation quasi municipal corporation political subdivision or body politic or agency thereof doing business maintaining an office or rendering a public service within the city of manhattan or within riley or pottawatomie counties further to rent any space as may be needed by such governmental agencies for such service facilities as the public building commission may determine will primarily service the comfort and convenience of the occupants of its buildings or other facilities d if the city of manhattan kansas is a tenant of any building or facility owned by the public building commission the commission shall have the power to allow the city to sublease all or any portion of such building or facility to any other governmental agency or to any private entity however if the city of manhattan kansas chooses to lease all or any part of such building to a private entity the governing body of the city shall determine that the portion so leased to a private entity is not needed for any public purpose of the city e to issue revenue bonds of the public building commission to provide funds for the purposes set forth herein and to pay all costs and expenses incident thereto or to refund its outstanding bonds f to establish and fix rates rentals fees and charges for the use of any and all buildings or space therein or other facilities owned and operated by the commission sufficient at all times to pay maintenance and operation costs of such buildings or facilities as well as the principle of an interest on all bonds issued by the commission when the same shall become due and payable and to make all payments to any accounts created by any bond resolution g to acquire the fee simple title to real property or a leasehold interest in real property including easements and reversionary interests in the streets alleys and other public places and personal property required for its purposes by purchase gift devise or by exercise of the power of eminent domain of the state and title thereto shall be taken in the corporate name of the commission h to enter into written leases with tenants of its buildings or facilities under such terms and conditions as it shall deem appropriate not inconsistent with the provisions of this division the laws of the state of kansas and charter of the city of manhattan kansas i to convey title to real estate it shall hold title to and sell assign transfer trade any of its interest in personal property j to do all things necessary and incidental to the purpose of constructing or acquiring or enlarging furnishing and equipping and operating and maintaining buildings to be made available for use pursuant to this division together with all powers afforded it by the provisions of ksa 121757 et seq and charter  2288 secs 22412245  reserved note see the editors note to art vi div 4 finance division 1  generally secs 22462250  reserved division 2  investment of idle funds background the city receives and disburses substantial amounts of money while certain requirements relating to the handling of public monies are set forth in state law a written statement of policies and procedures governing the management and investment of monies under the custody of the city is advisable to provide direction to all officers and employees and to inform the general public and concerned financial institutions as to the policies and practices of the city  6380 purposes and goals it is the purpose of this division to set forth the public policies of the city relating to the investment of public monies and to establish procedural requirements as to investment management practices the objectives of the investment policy and program of the city shall be as follows 1 the safeguarding of all public monies shall be of the highest priority public money shall not be invested or managed in any manner which would jeopardize the safety of the principal 2 consistent with the requirements of safety the objective of the investment program shall be to aggressively manage and invest all public monies to maximize net earnings consistent with the cost of administering the investment program the city has a public responsibility to secure the maximum safe investment return possible from monies assigned to its stewardship to relieve demands on the property tax and to otherwise reduce the cost of public services 3 the investment program shall be conducted in a businesslike manner and without preferential treatment of any person  6380 general investment programs the public funds of the city shall be managed according to the following categories 1 investment of special fund monies  2 investment of temporary inactive monies  and 3 management of active funds as hereinafter described  6380 investment of special fund monies monies in special funds such as bond funds housing authority funds and cemetery perpetual care funds the investment of which is governed by state law shall be invested only in accordance with the provisions of such law namely ksa 10131 ksa 172345 and ksa 171319 respectively  6380 investment of inactive monies a public monies which are not immediately required by the city for the purpose for which the monies were collected or received shall be invested in 1 temporary notes  2 time deposit open accounts or certificates of deposit  3 united states treasury bills or notes  and 4 share or savings deposits of state or federally chartered savings and loan associations  5 in repurchase agreements of less than 30 days duration with commercial banks or trust companies b all of the above types of investments shall be made in accordance with the provisions of ksa 121675 and ksa 175002  6380 management of active funds active funds or monies may be maintained or invested as follows 1 in checking accounts in any bank which has been designated as a public depository of the city  2 in savings accounts in any bank which is providing checking account services for the city the transfer of monies between checking accounts and savings accounts shall be in conformity with any applicable state or federal laws or regulations the finance directortreasurer or city clerk may authorize such transfers in the name of the city by notification in writing in person or by telephone  3 in repurchase agreements with any state or national bank  4 in such other investments as may be authorized by the governing body  6380 investment procedures the finance directortreasurer shall develop and implement a cash management and investment program in accordance with the provisions of this division and shall report in writing monthly to the city manager and at least quarterly to the governing body as to the progress and interest earnings of the program a cash flow analysis shall be maintained by such officer to assure that the maximum feasible amount is invested or deposited in savings accounts at all times notwithstanding the provisions of ksa 121671 the liquidity and maturity of all invested monies shall be such as to permit the prompt payment of all financial obligations of the city  6380 care of securities securities purchased pursuant to the provisions of this division shall be under the joint care and custody of the finance directortreasurer and the city clerk or shall be held in the custody of a state or national bank or trust company securities in original or receipt form shall be held in the name of the city and their redemption transfer or withdrawal shall be permitted by authorization in person of either the finance directortreasurer or the city clerk and by endorsement of the security or receipt form when required if there are any negotiable securities entrusted to the city such securities shall be deposited in a safety deposit box of a bank or trust company access to which shall be permitted only in the personal presence and under the signature of at least two officials from the following offices city treasurer city clerk assistant city manager and city manager  6380 transfer or sale of securities if in order to maintain sufficient monies on demand deposit in any fund it becomes necessary to transfer or sell any securities invested pursuant to this division the finance directortreasurer or city clerk may transfer such securities to any other fund or funds in which there are temporary inactive monies or may sell such securities and for such purposes the finance directortreasurer or city clerk shall have authority to make any necessary written directions endorsements or assignments for and on behalf of the city  6380 crediting and use of earnings all interest or other earnings received from investments made pursuant to this division shall be credited to the fund from which monies are invested with the exception of interest earned on transfer accounts passbook savings in banks and repurchase agreements wherein such interest earned shall be prorated monthly to the general revenue sharing fund water fund and sewage fund with the balance to be credited to the general operating fund  6380 records and reports required the finance directortreasurer shall maintain a complete and detailed record at all times of all investments made pursuant to this division and shall keep such other schedules and prepare such reports as may be necessary or as requested by the governing body or the city manager  6380 advertising footnotes  1  cross reference advertisements at airports  756  loudspeakers amplifiers for advertising  22552 state law reference highway advertising control act ksa 682231 et seq in general billposting in streets no person shall attach place paint write stamp or paste any sign advertisement or any other matter upon any signpost electric light railway telegraph or telephone pole shade tree fire hydrant  or on any bridge pavement sidewalk or crosswalk public building or any property or thing belonging to the city or on any article or thing within any park public officers posting any notice required or permitted by law shall be excepted from the provisions of this section billposting in private places no person shall attach place paint write stamp or paste any sign advertisement or other matter upon any house wall fence gate post tree without first having obtained the permission of the owner or occupants of the premises and having complied with all provisions of this thereto secs 33315  reserved distribution of handbills definitions for the purposes of this article the following words and phrases shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them handbill any printed or written matter any sample or device dodger circular leaflet pamphlet paper booklet or any other printed or otherwise reproduced original or copies of any matter of literature newspaper any newspaper of general circulation as defined by general law any newspaper duly entered with the post office department of the united states in accordance with federal statute or regulation and any newspaper filed and recorded with any recording officer as provided by general law  and in addition thereto shall mean and include any periodical or current magazine regularly published with not less than four issues per year and sold to the public and shall mean and include any other copyrighted material vehicle every device in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a highway including devices used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq exemption for mail and newspapers the provisions of this article shall not apply to the distribution of mail by the united states nor to newspapers except that newspapers shall be placed on private property in such a manner as to prevent their being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street sidewalk or other public place or upon private property inhabited private premises no person shall throw deposit or distribute any handbill in or upon private premises which are inhabited except by handling or transmitting any such handbill directly to the owner occupant or other person then present in or upon such private premises provided however that in case of inhabited private premises which are not posted such person unless requested by anyone upon such premises not to do so may place or deposit any such handbill in or upon such premises if such handbill is so placed or deposited as to secure or prevent such handbill from being blown or drifted about such premises or sidewalks streets or other public places and except that mailboxes may not be so used when so prohibited by federal postal law or regulation protection of lawns it shall be unlawful for any person engaged in the distribution of handbills to cut across or walk upon any lawn front yard or court yard except upon sidewalks where sidewalks are provided or upon regularly established paths where no sidewalks have been provided to the house or building prohibited where properly posted no person shall throw deposit or distribute any handbill upon any private premises if requested by anyone thereon not to do so or if there is placed on such premises a sign bearing the words no trespassing no peddlers or agents no advertisement or any similar notice indicating in any manner that the occupants of such premises do not wish to have their right of privacy disturbed or to have any handbills left upon such premises cross reference similar provisions for peddlers  244 depositing on uninhabited or vacant premises it shall be unlawful for any person to throw or deposit any handbill in or upon any private premises which is uninhabited or vacant restricted in public places it shall be unlawful for any person to hand out or distribute or sell any handbill in any public place  except that a handbill may be personally delivered to any person willing to accept the same cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 placing on automobiles it shall be unlawful for any person as principal or agent to place or cause to be placed any handbills in or hang the same upon any part of any motor vehicle while such motor vehicle is in use upon the streets or standing parked upon the streets or in public off street parking areas of the city  provided that this section shall not be construed to prevent the officers or employees of the city from so doing for any municipal purposes cross reference traffic and motor vehicles ch 31 alcoholic beverages footnotes  1  editors note secs 167 of adopted aug 14 201 amended ch 4 in its entirety to read as herein set out see table for prior amendatory history cross reference consumption of alcohol at airport  760  alcoholic liquor prohibited in memorial auditorium  2352 state law reference intoxicating liquors and beverages ksa ch 41 in general definitions the following words and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them alcoholic liquor means alcohol spirits wine beer and every liquid or solid patented or not containing alcohol spirits wine or beer and capable of being consumed as a beverage by a human being but shall not include any cereal malt beverage alcoholic liquor retailer means a person who sells at retail or offers for sale at retail alcoholic liquors but shall not include a microbrewery microdistillery or farm winery caterer means an individual partnership or corporation which sells alcoholic liquor by the individual drink and provides services related to the serving thereof on unlicensed premises which may be open to the public but does not include a holder of a temporary alcoholic liquor permit selling alcoholic liquor in accordance with the terms of such permit cereal malt beverage means any fermented but undistilled liquor brewed or made from malt or from a mixture of malt or malt substitute or any flavored malt beverage as defined in ksa 412729 and amendments thereto including beer as defined by ksa 41102 but not including any such liquor which is more than six percent alcohol by weight cereal malt beverage retailer means any person who sells or offers for sale any cereal malt beverage for use or consumption and not for resale in any form class a club means a premises which is owned or leased by a corporation partnership business trust or association and which is operated thereby as a bona fide nonprofit social fraternal or war veterans club as determined by the state of kansas for the exclusive use of the corporate stockholders partners trust beneficiaries or associates hereinafter referred to as members and their families and guests accompanying them class b club means a premises operated for profit by a corporation partnership or individual to which members of such club may resort for the consumption of food or alcoholic beverages and for entertainment club means a class a or class b club distributor or wholesaler means the person importing or causing to be imported into the state or purchasing or causing to be purchased within the state alcoholic liquor for sale or resale to retailers licensed under the kansas liquor control act and this chapter or cereal malt beverage for sale or resale to any offpremises cereal malt beverage retailer or any onpremises cereal malt beverage retailer licensed under this chapter drinking establishment means premises which may be open to the general public where alcoholic liquor by the individual drink is sold employee means any person employed in the business of selling cereal malt beverages or alcoholic liquor by a licensee farm winery means a winery licensed by the state of kansas to manufacture store and sell domestic table wine and domestic fortified wine as defined by state law fundraising location means any location where complimentary alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are provided pursuant to ksa 41104h and amendments thereto licensee means the person who has been properly issued a license to sell cereal malt beverages andor alcoholic liquor within the corporate limits of the city manufacturer means every brewer fermenter distiller rectifier wine maker blender processor bottler or person who fills or refills an original package and others engaged in brewing fermenting distilling rectifying or bottling alcoholic liquor beer or cereal malt beverage but shall not include a microbrewery microdistillery or a farm winery microbrewery means a brewery licensed by the state of kansas to manufacture store and sell domestic beer as defined by state law microdistillery means a facility which produces spirits from any source or substance that is licensed by the state of kansas to manufacture store and sell spirits minor means a person under 21 years of age offpremises cereal malt beverage retailer means a licensee who has a license to sell or offer for sale cereal malt beverages in original and unopened containers and not for consumption on the premises or for resale in any form onpremises cereal malt beverage retailer means a licensee who has a license to sell or offer for sale cereal malt beverages for consumption on the licensed premises and not for resale in any form open space area means any unimproved tract parcel or piece of land presently owned or leased or hereafter owned or leased by the city which land shall be maintained primarily in a natural state or condition park or recreation area shall mean any tract parcel or piece of land designated by the city as a park or recreation area person means any natural person corporation partnership or association place of business means any place where cereal malt beverages are sold premises means the specific area described in a license or permit application and approved as the location upon which the cereal malt beverages andor alcoholic liquor may be sold served andor consumed under the license or permit school means any public or private facility which conducts regular classes prekindergarten or any portion thereof and which meets the minimum educational standards set forth by the state of kansas in addition school shall also include any publicly owned or operated vocationaltechnical institution sell at retail sale at retail or sold at retail mean sales for use or consumption and not for resale in any form and sales to clubs licensed drinking establishments licensed caterers or holders of temporary permits it does not refer to or mean sales by a distributor a microbrewery a farm winery a licensed club a licensed drinking establishment a licensed caterer or a holder of a temporary permit temporary alcoholic liquor permit means a temporary permit issued in accordance with the laws of the state of kansas which allows the permit holder to offer for sale sell and serve alcoholic liquor for consumption on unlicensed premises which may be open to the public subject to the terms of such permit temporary cereal malt beverage permit means a temporary permit issued in accordance with the laws of the state of kansas which allows the permit holder to offer for sale sell and serve cereal malt beverages for consumption on unlicensed premises which may be open to the public subject to the terms of such permit  81412   21919 cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq state law reference similar definitons ksa 412701 consumption and possession in certain places forbidden a it shall be unlawful for any person to drink or consume alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage or to possess an open container holding such cereal malt beverage or alcoholic liquor while upon the public streets sidewalks alleys parking lots roads parks recreation areas open space areas or highways within the city or upon property owned by the state or any governmental subdivision thereof pursuant to ksa 41719 and amendments thereto b neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the sunset zoological park so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed in conformity with state law city ordinances and all rules and regulations governing the use of the sunset zoological park c neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the confines of the manhattan regional airport passenger terminal so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage was purchased from an airport concessionaire licensed to sell alcoholic liquor andor cereal malt beverages and so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed only in areas designated by the airport director for such activities and done so in a manner that conforms with state law city ordinances and airport rules and regulations d neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the confines of the union pacific depot so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed in conformity with state law city ordinances and all rules and regulations governing the use of the union pacific depot e neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the confines of the jon and ruth ann wefald pavilion so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed in conformity with state law city ordinances and all rules and regulations governing the use of the wefald pavilion f neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the confines of the flint hills discovery center within its outdoor terraces or within the driveway and parking lot south and southeast of the flint hills discovery center more particularly described as lot 7 of the downtown entertainment district commercial pud so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed in conformity with state law city ordinances all rules and regulations governing the use of the flint hills discovery center and when applicable the terms and conditions of a city special event permit g neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage within the public park known for purposes of this article as blue earth plaza and more particularly described as lot 8 of the downtown entertainment district commercial pud so long as such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is possessed and consumed only in areas designated by the parks and recreation director for such activities and done so in a manner that conforms with state law city ordinances all rules and regulations governing the use of blue earth plaza and when applicable the terms and conditions of a city special event permit h neither subsection a nor ksa 41719 shall apply to persons possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage on specified property title of which is vested in the city that the city has exempted by ordinance or resolution if such possession and consumption is in accordance with the ordinance or resolution i a violation of this section is a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not less than $5000 or more than $20000 or by imprisonment for not more than six months or both such fine and imprisonment  81412   10218 purchase consumption and possession of alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages by minors  furnishing to minors  hosting minors under the age of 21 a no person under the age of 21 shall obtain or purchase or attempt to obtain or purchase alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage from any person b no person under the age of 21 shall possess or consume alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage except 1 said persons may possess or consume cereal malt beverage only when such cereal malt beverage is furnished and the possession or consumption is permitted and supervised by the persons parent or legal guardian such possession or consumption may not occur on premises licensed to sell cereal malt beverage or alcoholic liquor or at any other location where possession or consumption is prohibited by law 2 an employee who is not less than 18 years of age may dispense or sell cereal malt beverage if the place of business of the employer is licensed solely as an offpremises cereal malt beverage retailer and not for consumption on the premises  or the place of business of the employer is a licensed food service establishment as defined by ksa 36501 and amendments thereto and not less than 50 percent of the gross receipts from the place of business is derived from the sale of food for consumption on the premises 3 such person may serve alcoholic liquor as permitted by state law c no person shall furnish alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage to any person under the age of 21 furnishing alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage to a minor is recklessly directly or indirectly buying for or distributing any alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage to any minor this section shall not apply to the furnishing of cereal malt beverage by a parent or legal guardian to such parents child or such guardians ward at a location other than upon premises licensed to sell cereal malt beverage or any other location where possession of such cereal malt beverage would be prohibited by law d it shall be unlawful for any person to host a minor who is consuming or possessing alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage unlawfully hosting minors consuming or possessing alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage is recklessly permitting a persons residence or any land building structure or room owned occupied or procured by such person to be used by an invitee of such person or an invitee of such persons child or ward in a manner that results in the unlawful possession or consumption therein of alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages by a minor e it shall be unlawful for any licensee or permit holder or the owner officer or employee thereof to permit whether knowingly or unknowingly any person under the age of 21 to possess or consume alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage upon the premises where the alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are sold by such licensee or permit holder there shall be a rebuttable presumption that any person possessing or consuming alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage upon the premises has been permitted to possess or consume such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage by the owner officer and employee of said establishment this section shall not apply to the dispensing of cereal malt beverage or the serving of alcoholic liquor as set forth in subparagraphs 43b2 and 43b3 above f it shall be unlawful for the owner operator or manager of any establishment licensed as an onpremises cereal malt beverage retailer to allow or permit any person under the age of 18 to enter or remain upon such premises between the hours of  pm and  am if cereal malt beverages are available for sale or being consumed on the premises unless 1 such person under the age of 18 is accompanied by a parent or guardian  or 2 such person under the age of 18 is an employee of such establishment and is not involved in the dispensing or selling of cereal malt beverages there shall be a rebuttable presumption that any person located within such premises has been permitted and allowed to enter and remain there by the owner operator and manager of such establishment g penalties 1 the penalty for a violation of subsection 43a or 43b shall be a minimum fine of $20000 not to exceed $50000 or a term of imprisonment not to exceed one month or both such fine and imprisonment 2 the penalty for a violation of subsection 43c or 43f shall be a minimum fine of $20000 not to exceed $50000 or a term of imprisonment not to exceed six months or both such fine and imprisonment 3 the penalty for a violation of subsection 43d shall be a minimum fine of $100000 not to exceed $250000 or a term of imprisonment not to exceed one year or both such fine and imprisonment if the court sentences the offender to perform community service or public service work as a condition of probation or parole the court shall consider ordering the offender to serve the community or public service at an alcohol treatment facility 4 the penalty for a violation of subsection 43e shall be a minimum fine of $10000 not to exceed $25000 or imprisonment not exceeding 30 days or both such fine and imprisonment h in addition to any other penalty provided under a violation of subsection a or b of this section 1 the court may order the offender to do either or both of the following i perform 40 hours of community service  or ii attend and satisfactorily complete a suitable educational or training program dealing with the effects of alcohol or other chemical substances when ingested by humans  and 2 the court shall order the following i upon a first conviction the court shall order the division of vehicles to suspend the offenders driving privileges for 30 days upon receipt of the court order the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving privileges of the violator for 30 days whether or not that person has a drivers license ii upon a second conviction the court shall order the division of vehicles to suspend the offenders driving privileges for 90 days upon receipt of the court order the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving privileges of the violator for 90 days whether or not that person has a drivers license iii upon a third or subsequent conviction the court shall order the division of vehicles to suspend the driving privileges of such offender for one year upon receipt of the court order the division shall notify the violator and suspend the driving privileges of the violator for one year whether or not that person has a drivers license 3 for the purposes of determining whether a conviction is a first second third or subsequent conviction i conviction includes being convicted of a violation of subsections a or b of this section or being convicted of a violation of a law of any state or any ordinance of any city or resolution of any county which prohibits the acts that subsections a or b prohibit ii conviction shall not include entering into a diversion agreement in lieu of further criminal proceedings for a violation of subsections a or b or a violation of a law of any state or any ordinance of any city or resolution of any county which prohibits the acts that subsections a or b prohibit iii any convictions occurring during a persons lifetime shall be taken into account when determining the sentence to be imposed iv it is irrelevant whether an offense occurred before or after conviction for a previous offense  81412 restrictions upon the possession and consumption of alcoholic liquor and cereal malt beverages upon premises and fundraising locations a it shall be unlawful for the owner operator manager or employee of any premises or any location where complimentary alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are provided pursuant to ksa 41104h and amendments thereto to permit or allow any person to possess or consume either alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages upon the premises or the fundraising location except as follows 1 within the confines of a building located upon the premises or the fundraising location  or 2 within an outdoor area upon the premises or fundraising location if such area is fenced or screened such that access from outside of said fenced or screened area can only be gained building upon the premises or gates or doors access to such outdoor areas shall provide the proper egress required by the applicable fire codes such outdoor area shall be contiguous to the building on the premises or fundraising location and shall not include any parking areas b it shall be unlawful for the owner operator manager or employee of any premises or fundraising location to permit or allow any person to exit the areas described in subparagraph 44a while in possession of an open container of alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage except an exit directly to another area as described in subparagraph 44a c there shall be a rebuttable presumption that any person possessing an open container of alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage upon a premises a fundraising location or while exiting an area as described in subparagraph 44a has been permitted to do so by the owner operator manager and employee of said premises or fundraising location  81412 sale to certain persons forbidden a no person shall knowingly sell give away dispose of exchange or deliver or permit the sale gift or procuring of any alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage to or for any person who is an incapacitated person or any person who is physically or mentally incapacitated by the consumption of such alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverage b violation of this section is a misdemeanor punishable by a fine of not less than $10000 and not exceeding $25000 or imprisonment not exceeding 30 days or both  81412 state law reference similar provisions ksa 41715 secs 46410  reserved alcoholic liquor retailers footnotes  2  state law reference power of city to regulate sales ksa 41208 division 1 under the age of 21 years in connection with the operation of such retail establishment  or 3 to employ any person in connection with the operation of such retail establishment who has been adjudged guilty of a felony  state law reference similar provisions ksa 41713 reserved secs 414 415  reserved restrictions on location a no person shall sell at retail any alcoholic liquor in its original unopened containers within 200 feet of any public or parochial school b no person shall sell at retail any alcoholic liquor in its original unopened containers within 200 feet of any college c no person shall sell at retail any alcoholic liquor in its original unopened containers within 200 feet of a church d no alcoholic liquor shall be sold at retail upon any premises which have an inside entrance or opening which connects with any other place of business e the restrictions of subsections 416ac shall not apply if the school college or church is established within 200 feet of the licensed premises after the premises have already been licensed f the distances set forth in this section shall be measured from the property line of the school college or church to the nearest entrance or exit of the establishment selling alcoholic liquor which is available to and normally used by the public by the shortest route which a pedestrian would normally walk  81412 secs 417420  reserved division 2  alcoholic liquor retailers license footnotes  3  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 state law reference licensing and related provisions ksa 41301 et seq license required it shall be unlawful for any person who is obligated to have in such persons possession an alcoholic liquor retailers license issued by the state of kansas to sell keep for sale offer for sale or expose for sale any alcoholic liquor unless he or she also has in his or her possession a valid unexpired license issued by the city for such purpose  81412 application  issuance  term a any person desiring to secure a license under this division shall make and file an application on a form provided by the city clerk the application and the fee for new or renewal city licenses shall be submitted to the city clerk along with a copy of a valid license issued to the applicant by the state of kansas for the same activity to be licensed by the city b the city clerk shall issue a city license if the applicant has met the application requirements set forth in subsection a and if the proposed location complies with all code and zoning requirements of the city c the term of the city license shall coincide with the term of the license issued by the state of kansas and the city license shall expire at the same time the license issued by the state of kansas expires no license issued under this division shall be transferable or assignable  81412 revocation or suspension appeal a the city manager upon five days written notice to the person holding a license under this division may permanently revoke or cause to be suspended such license for any of the following reasons 1 the licensee fraudulently obtained the license by giving false information in the application therefor or any hearing thereon  2 the licensee violated any provisions of the kansas liquor control act ksa 41101 et seq and amendments thereto or any rules or regulations adopted thereunder  3 there has been a violation of a provision of the laws of kansas or of the united states or the city of manhattan pertaining to the sale of intoxicating or alcoholic liquors or any crime involving a morals charge on premises where alcoholic liquor is sold by such licensee  4 the licensee has become ineligible to obtain a license or permit under this division  5 there has been a violation of ksa 214106 or 214107 and amendments thereto on premises where alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are sold by such licensee b within 20 days after the order of the city manager revoking or suspending any license the licensee may appeal such order to the district court  provided that such appeal shall not suspend the order of revocation or suspension during the pendency of the appeal  81412 fee a the license fee for an alcoholic liquor retailers license shall be $60000 b any person to whom a license has been issued under this division may surrender such license to the city clerk at such time as the license is no longer necessary and may at such time request a prorated refund of the license fee paid hereunder the city clerk shall refund a prorated amount of the license fee based upon the number of unexpired whole months remaining in the license term from the date of surrender no such refund shall be applicable to any license that is revoked or withdrawn pursuant to the provisions of this chapter or state laws regulating the sale and consumption of alcoholic beverages  81412 display every licensee shall cause his license to be framed and hung in plain view in a conspicuous place on the licensed premises  81412 secs 426432  reserved private clubs drinking establishments caterers and temporary alcoholic liquor permit holders footnotes  4  state law reference licensing regulation of clubs ksa alcoholic beverage control or by any law enforcement officer shall be a condition on which every license or temporary alcoholic liquor permit is issued and the application for and acceptance of any license or temporary permit shall conclusively be deemed to be the consent of the applicant and licensee or permit holder to such immediate entry and inspection such right of immediate entry and provided by the city clerk the application and the fee for new or renewal city licenses shall be submitted to the city clerk along with a copy of a valid license issued to the applicant by the state of kansas for the same activity to be licensed by the city b the city clerk shall issue a city license if the applicant has met the application requirements set forth in subsection 437a and if the proposed location complies with all code and zoning requirements of the city c the term of the city license shall coincide with the term of the license issued by the state of kansas and the city license shall expire at the same time the license issued by the state of kansas expires if the license issued by the state of kansas is revoked or withdrawn for any reason the license issued by the city shall be deemed to be revoked and withdrawn as of the date of revocation or withdrawal of the state license every licensee shall cause their license to be placed in plain view on the licensed premises or in the case of a caterer where such caterer is serving or mixing alcoholic liquor for consumption on the premises  81412 fee a the license fee for all licenses under this division shall be as follows 1 class a clubs  $50000 2 class b clubs  $50000 3 caterers  $50000 4 drinking establishments  $50000 b any person to whom a license has been issued under this division may surrender such license to the city clerk at such time as the license is no longer necessary and may at such time request a prorated refund of the license fee paid hereunder the city clerk shall refund a prorated amount of the license fee based upon the number of unexpired whole months remaining in the license term from the date of surrender no such refund shall be applicable to any license that is revoked or 412622 restrictions on location a no license under the terms of this division shall be issued to any person for a location unless it complies with all relevant zoning regulations and other ordinances of the city b any premises licensed under this division prior to  shall be exempt from the restrictions set forth in subsection 439a above the exemption granted by reason of this subsection shall terminate if the premises cease to be licensed for a period of more than 120 consecutive days any bona fide purchaser from a licensee covered hereunder shall likewise succeed to the exemption granted in this subparagraph  provided that the exemption granted by reason of this subparagraph shall terminate if the premises cease to be licensed for a period of more than 120 consecutive days  81412 transfer no license issued under the provisions of this division shall be transferable or assignable  81412 records every person holding a license to operate an establishment under this division shall at all times maintain in the place of the establishment a current list of all officers directors stockholders owners and members and the name of the manager if any subject to inspections by any authorized officer or agent  81412 revocation or suspension appeal a the city manager upon five days written notice to the person holding a license under this division may permanently revoke or cause to be suspended such license for any of the following reasons 1 the licensee fraudulently obtained the license by giving false information in the application therefor or any hearing thereon  2 the licensee violated any provisions of the kansas club and drinking establishment act ksa 412601 et seq and amendments thereto or any rules or regulations adopted thereunder  3 the licensee has become ineligible to obtain a license or permit under this division  4 there has been a violation of a provision of the laws of kansas or of the united states or the city of manhattan pertaining to the sale of intoxicating or alcoholic liquors or cereal malt beverages or any crime involving a morals charge on premises where alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are sold by such licensee  5 there has been a violation of ksa 214106 or 214107 and amendments thereto on premises where alcoholic liquor or cereal malt beverages are sold by such licensee b at any time the governing body may request the director of alcoholic beverage control of the state department of revenue to hold a hearing on whether any state license issued pursuant to the ksa 412601 et seq and amendments thereto should be revoked or suspended c within 20 days after the order of the city manager revoking or suspending any license the licensee may appeal from such order to the district court  provided that such appeal shall not suspend the order of revocation or suspension during the pendency of the appeal in case of the revocation of a license of any licensee no new license shall be issued to such person or to any person acting for or on his behalf for a period of two years after the revocation becomes effective  81412 state law reference similar provisions ksa 412611 caterers notice to riley county police department at least two days prior to any event at which a caterer will sell or serve alcoholic liquor by the individual drink the caterer shall provide written notice to the director of the riley county police department the notice shall contain the location name of the group sponsoring the event and the exact date and times the caterer will be serving alcoholic liquor  81412 division 3  temporary permit temporary alcoholic liquor permits it shall be unlawful for any person to offer for sale sell and serve any alcoholic liquor for consumption on unlicensed premises at any event within shall be made at least ten days before the event b written application for the permit shall be made on a form provided by the city clerk in addition to any other information required the applicant shall provide the following 1 the name and residence of the applicant  2 the length of time that the applicant has resided within the state of kansas  3 the premises for which the permit is to be issued  4 the group for which the event is planned  5 the date and time of the event  6 the duration of the event  7 any anticipated need for police fire or other municipal services  8 a statement that the applicant is a citizen of the united states not less than 21 years of age and that the applicant has not within two years immediately preceding the date of making application been convicted of a felony any crime involving moral turpitude drunkenness driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or violation of any other intoxicating liquor law of any state municipality or of the united states  81412 same standards for issuance a upon presentation of a state temporary alcoholic liquor permit payment of the citys temporary alcoholic liquor permit fee and a written application as provided for hereinbefore the city clerk shall issue a local temporary alcoholic liquor permit to the applicant if there are no conflicts with any zoning or other ordinances of the city b no temporary alcoholic liquor permit shall be issued for an event that requires a special event permit pursuant to chapter 31 article iv of this c no more than four temporary alcoholic liquor permits may be issued to any one applicant in a calendar year  81412 same permit fee the fee for a temporary alcoholic liquor permit shall be $2500 per day which shall be paid at the time the application is submitted such fee shall be in addition to any fee due to the state of kansas whether collected by the city or the state no fee paid pursuant to this division shall be refundable  81412 same permit term transfer a the term of the temporary alcoholic liquor permit shall coincide with the term of the temporary permit issued by the state of kansas the temporary alcoholic liquor permit shall expire at the same time the temporary permit issued by the state of kansas expires if a temporary permit issued by the state of kansas is revoked or withdrawn for any reason the temporary alcoholic liquor permit issued by the city shall be deemed to be revoked and withdrawn as of the date of revocation or withdrawal of the state temporary permit b no temporary alcoholic liquor permit issued hereunder shall be transferable or assignable  81412 same regulations a every temporary alcoholic liquor permit holder shall cause the permit to be placed in plain view at the event entrance along with the name of the permit holder and a diagram of the premises covered by the permit  b no temporary alcoholic liquor permit holder may allow anyone under the age of 21 to possess purchase or consume alcoholic liquor upon the permitted premises  c every temporary alcoholic liquor permit holder must allow immediate entry and inspection by the alcoholic beverage control agents or other law enforcement officers  d no temporary alcoholic liquor permit holder shall allow the consumption of alcoholic liquor between the hours of  am and  am  e all local ordinances and state statutes for the sale serving and consumption of alcoholic liquor apply to holders of temporary alcoholic liquor permits  81412 same revocation a the city clerk or the riley county police department upon written notice to the permit holder delivered to the permit holders address as listed on the application for such permit or personally delivered to the permit holder at the permitted premises may revoke or suspend a temporary alcoholic liquor permit for any of the following reasons 1 the permit holder violated any regulation in section 449  2 the permit holder violated any state law or city ordinance pertaining to the sale serving or consumption of alcoholic liquor on the premises during the term of the permit  3 the permit holder violated a condition or restriction placed upon the permit  4 criminal activity has occurred on the premises during the term of the permit for which a citation is issued or an arrest made that is reasonably likely to cause injury or threat to persons or property or to create an unreasonable disturbance  81412 same appeal within 20 days after the order of the city clerk or riley county police department revoking suspending or denying a temporary alcoholic division 1  generally defined an automatic amusement device is hereby defined for the purposes of this article as a machine or device which upon the insertion of a coin slug or similar object operates or may be operated or used for game contest or amusement and shall include such devices as marble machines pinball machines shuffle boards bowling electric shooting and similar amusement devices under whatever name they may be indicated  cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq prohibited locations no automatic amusement device shall be set up or operated at any place in the city within a distance of 500 feet from any school ground in the city owned by or under the control of the board of education of the city  secs 513520  reserved division 2  license revocation when devices used for gambling no license shall be issued under this division to operate any gambling device or any game machine that is illegal and when any amusement device for which a license has been issued is thereafter used or operated for gambling or illegal purposes the license shall be revoked  secs 524530  reserved billiard and poolhalls division 1  generally minors prohibited  exception it shall be unlawful for any owner operator or person in charge of any billiard or poolhall to allow any minor under the age of 18 years to use any table billiard or pool cue or poolhall unless a parent or guardian of such minor shall in person present to such owner or operator or person in charge a written statement signed by the parent or guardian of such minor granting permission to such minor to use the equipment in and frequent such billiard or poolhall  secs 532540  reserved division 2  license footnotes  2  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 required it
