international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows habitable spaces every habitable space shall have at least one 1 window of approved size facing directly to the outdoors or to a court the minimum total window area measured between stops for every habitable space shall be five 5 square feet except when artificial light and ventilation may be provided in accordance with the provisions of the building or residential code whenever walls or other portions of a structure face a window of any room and such obstructions are located less than three 3 feet from the window and extend to a level above that of the ceiling of the room such a window shall not be deemed to face directly to the outdoors not to a court and shall not be included as contributing to the required minimum total window area for the room 21 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows common halls and stairways every common hall and stairway other than in one and twofamily dwellings shall be capable of being lighted at all times with at least a 60watt standard incandescent light bulb or equivalent sufficient natural light shall serve as an equivalent for each international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows minimum ceiling heights habitable spaces hallways corridors laundry areas bathrooms toilet rooms and habitable basement areas shall have a clear ceiling height of not less than 7 feet 2134 mm exceptions 1 beams girders or similar obstructions spaced not less than 4 feet on center and projecting not more than 6 inches below the of the minimum required floor area in calculating the floor area of such rooms only those portions of the floor area with a ceiling height of at least 5 feet or more shall be included 24 the 26 of the international property maintenance hereby deleted 27 the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows facilities drinking facilities shall be a drinking fountain water cooler bottled water cooler or disposable cups next to a sink or water dispenser drinking facilities within drinking or dining establishments or wholesale or retail grocery stores shall not be located in toilet rooms or bathrooms 28 if the international property maintenance hereby deleted 29 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows heat supply every owner and operator of any building who rents leases or lets one or more dwelling unit rooming unit dormitory or guest room on terms either express or implied to furnish heat to the occupants thereof shall supply sufficient heat during the period from october 1 to may 15 to maintain a room temperature of not less than 65 degrees fahrenheit 18 degrees celsius in all habitable rooms bathrooms and toilet rooms during the hours between  am and  pm of each day and not less than 60 degrees fahrenheit 16 degrees celsius during other hours the temperature shall be measured at a point 3 feet 914 mm above the floor and 3 feet 914 mm from the exterior walls 30 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows occupiable work spaces every enclosed occupied work space shall be supplied with sufficient heat during the period from october 1 to may 15 to maintain a temperature of not less than 65 degrees fahrenheit 18 degrees celsius during all working hours the temperature shall be measured at a point 3 feet 914 mm above the floor and 3 feet 914 mm from the exterior walls exceptions 1 processing storage and operation areas that require cooling or special temperature conditions 2 areas in which persons are primarily engaged in vigorous physical activities 31 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows service the size and usage of appliances and equipment shall serve as a basis for determining the need for additional facilities in accordance with the national electrical adopted in of the city ordinances dwelling units shall be served by a three wire 120240 volt single phase electrical service having a rating of not less than 60 amperes 32 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows emergency escape openings every sleeping room located in a basement in an occupancy in use group i1 or r shall have at least one openable window or exterior door approved for emergency egress or rescue  or shall have access to not less than two approved independent exits exception buildings equipped throughout with an automatic fire suppression system may have fixed windows in accordance with the international building approved emergency escape or rescue window shall have a minimum clear opening width and height of 18 inches a minimum total clear openable area of 4 square feet and a maximum sill height above floor level of 48 inches permanently installed steps may be used to attain maximum sill height such steps must have a minimum tread of 12 inches and a maximum riser height of 16 inches emergency escape or rescue windows wells shall be a minimum of 24 inches measured from the exterior wall of the structure to the inside of the well and shall be at least as wide as the window 33 of the international property maintenance hereby changed to read as follows installation near cooking appliances and bathrooms newly installed or battery powered replacement smoke detectors shall not be installed within 20 feet of a cooking appliance or within 3 feet of the opening of a bathroom that contains a tub or shower unless either would prevent placement of a smoke alarm required by this code 34 of the international property maintenance hereby deleted  41003   112079   12782   6584   51987   3293   12595   9297   1698   2601   7604   71707   111610   8613   62116 escrow of rentals from certain unfit substandard housing a general the boca basic national existing structures which was adopted by reference in section 8176 of this hereinafter be referred to as the es code in the following paragraphs of this section b terms of application notwithstanding any other provisions of law or of any agreement whether oral or in writing whenever the building official certifies a dwelling or dwelling unit as unfit for human habitation the duty of the tenant of such dwelling or dwelling unit to pay and the right of the landlord to collect rent shall be suspended as hereinafter provided without affecting any other terms or conditions of the landlordtenant relationship until the dwelling or dwelling unit is certified as fit for human habitation or until the tenancy is terminated for any lawful reason other than nonpayment of rent  provided that paragraphs b m of this section shall not apply to those premises containing not more than two dwelling units of which one dwelling unit is occupied by the owner or members of his family and also shall not apply to those premises occupied by the owner or members of his family and also shall not apply to those premises occupied by the owner or members of his family if less than five persons are tenants of the premises  and provided further that paragraphs b m of this section shall not apply unless it is shown to the reasonable satisfaction of the building official of the city that the tenant has notified in writing the landlord or his representative of the alleged unfit substandard condition of the premises at least 14 days prior to the tenant making any request that the building official inspect the premises for determination that it is unfit substandard c standards for determining unfit housing the building official in determining whether any dwelling or dwelling unit is unfit or fit for human habitation shall apply the same standards as those found in the es code defining substandard housing in applying said standards the building official shall consider any determination by the state department of health or the citycounty board of health that any dwelling or dwelling unit is unfit for human habitation  provided that if the building official finds that the dwelling or dwelling unit is so immediately dangerous to the life limb property or safety of the public or of the occupants as to require immediate vacation as set out in the es code then no human occupancy shall be allowed regardless of the rent escrow provisions of this section until the building office determines that such immediate danger has ceased or been corrected d notification of landlord or record owner written notice shall be given to the landlord or record owner of the dwelling or dwelling units that for up to a threemonth period during which the dwelling or dwelling unit remains unfit substandard the tenant may pay his rentals into escrow as provided in this section this notice shall accompany the notice of commencement of proceedings against a substandard building as contained in the es code no such notice of the tenants right to pay rentals into escrow shall accompany an order to vacate under the es code or order of demolition under the es code e appeal from building officials determinations any determination by the building official that a dwelling or dwelling unit is unfit for human habitation substandard may be appealed in the manner and form set out in the es code for other appeals during the taking of such appeals the tenant may pay his rentals to the rent escrow agent as otherwise provided in this section f clerk of city designated rent escrow agent during any period when the duty to pay rent is suspended and the tenant continues to occupy the dwelling unit the rent withheld shall be deposited by the tenant with the clerk of the city to be placed by him in an escrow account in a bank or trust company approved by the city and shall be paid to the landlord by the clerk when the dwelling or dwelling unit is certified as fit for human habitation at any time within three months from the date on which the dwelling or dwelling unit was certified as unfit for human habitation g disposition of rent escrow monies if at the end of three months after the certification of a dwelling or dwelling unit as unfit for human habitation such dwelling or dwelling unit has not been certified as fit for human habitation any monies deposited in escrow on account of continued occupancy shall be payable to the depositor  except that any funds deposited in escrow may be used at any time during the aforesaid threemonth period for the purpose of making such dwelling unit fit for human habitation and for the payment of utility services and prorated taxes for which the landlord is obligated but which he refuses or is unable to pay the clerk of the city is hereby authorized to accept for deposit any monies paid to him under the provisions of this section the clerk is further authorized to pay out of the funds deposited hereunder such amounts authorized to pay hereunder as may be approved by voucher signed by the building official h disposition of excess rent escrow monies if a dwelling or dwelling unit is made fit for human habitation by utilizing escrow funds any excess thereof shall be payable to the landlord i limitations of eviction during threemonth escrow period notwithstanding the provisions of any other ordinance or agreement no tenant shall be evicted for a period of three months while rent is deposited in escrow pursuant to this section  provided that such tenant during the escrow period continues to make deposits in the amounts and at the times as were otherwise established for the payment of rent under the lease agreement  provided further that if the landlord in good faith and without the intent to evade the provisions of this section more than 15 days in advance of the commencement of proceedings to declare the dwelling or dwelling unit unfit for human habitation shall have given legally sufficient written notice to the tenant to quit the dwelling or dwelling unit such landlord may proceed with eviction whether or not the tenant invokes the provisions of this section j disposition of rent escrow if tenant quits premises in less than three months if the tenant vacates the dwelling or dwelling unit in question at any time during the period in which his rent is held in escrow said rent monies shall continue to be held in escrow for the original threemonth period of escrow during which period the monies may be used to bring the dwelling or dwelling unit up to fitness for human habitation at the expiration of such threemonth period if the premises are still uninhabitable and if any monies remain in escrow they shall revert to the tenant k provisions of this section not subject to contract no provision of this chapter can be waived or made subject to a contract between the parties any such waiver or contract shall be void and of no effect l when provisions of sections do not apply the provisions of this section shall not apply if the condition or conditions which caused the dwelling or dwelling unit to be certified as unfit substandard for human habitation or to be in violation were caused by the tenant or by members of his family or by his guests  nor shall they apply if the tenant has refused entry to the owner landlord agent or other person operating the dwelling or dwelling unit or their agents for the purpose of correcting the conditions giving rise to the said certification or giving rise to the violation  nor shall the provisions of this section apply if the tenant is delinquent in his rental payments m designation of deputy to building official the city manager is authorized to appoint in writing any qualified person as deputy to the building official to act in the capacity of the building official for all purposes contained in paragraphs a m of this section  6584   51987 secs 81798185  reserved factorybuilt housing footnotes  5  cross reference mobile homes and trailers ch 20 definition for the purpose of this article a factorybuilt structure is a structure which has been assembled at a modular factory in partial or complete units a factorybuilt structure is different from a mobile home which is a vehicular portable structure built on a chassis and primarily intended and designed to be used without a permanent foundation    12385 cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq compliance with construction codes etc factorybuilt structures of a prefabricated panelized or modular nature may be erected in the city  provided that they comply with the requirements of this article and of the plumbing and gas fitting codes the electrical code the mechanical code and the building code    12385 plans two complete sets of plans and specifications shall be filed with the building official for his examination and approval showing that the proposed factorybuilt structure meets the building plumbing gas electrical and mechanical codes incorporated by the city before construction commences at the factory one set of plans and specifications will be returned to the applicant with any revisions that are needed the other set will remain in the building officials office should the building official find that the proposed structure does not meet the requirements of the codes he shall require that the manufacturer of the factorybuilt structure obtain endorsement from the research committee of the international conference of building officials that the structure is built to specifications which are acceptable to the requirements of the uniform building    12385 inspection an inspection of the factory shall be made by the building official and plans examiner before any factorybuilt structure will be given permission to be erected within the city limits the applicant shall provide necessary air transportation and the necessary accommodations for the first visit to the factory all other inspections at the factory will need to be certified by an agency approved by the building official all onsite work shall be done by tradesmen licensed by the city and inspected all gas lines installed at factory shall be tested at factory and after placement on the foundation    12782   12385 certificate prior to leaving the factory a certificate shall be furnished to the building official for every factorybuilt structure which shall certify that the structure has been inspected and conforms to the plans as approved the certificate must be presented to the building official prior to the erection of the structure on the job site if plumbing wiring or mechanical equipment are factory installed each installation shall also be certified as meeting the plumbing electrical or mechanical codes of the city to be acceptable each certificate of approval must be made by an agency approved by the building official approved agency shall mean a licensed architect professional engineer or agency regularly engaged in the work of inspections    12385 reserved editors note  adopted dec 7 198 deleted former  8191 which pertained to bond requirements and was derived from  permits and fees all permits required by the codes of the city shall be obtained prior to starting any construction onsite for a factorybuilt structure and permit shall be issued only if a licensed general contractor is erecting the structure building permit fees shall be charged on the same schedule as for onsite construction inspection fees and any other fees shall be charged on the same schedule as for onsite construction on the basis of inspection and other services actually performed onsite    12385 violations a a person who shall violate a provision of this article or fails to comply therewith or with any of the requirements thereof or who shall erect construct alter or repair or has erected constructed or repaired a building or structure in violation of a detailed statement or plan submitted and approved thereunder or of a permit or certificate issued thereunder shall be guilty of an offense punishable as provided in section 17 b the owner of a building or structure or portion thereof or of the premises where anything in violation of this article shall be placed or shall exist and an architect builder contractor agent person or corporation employed in connection therewith and who may have assisted in the commission of such violation shall be guilty of a separate offense and upon conviction thereof be punished as provided in section 17  secs 81948202  reserved residential code footnotes  6  editors note of adopted feb 6 200 amended art x in its entirety to read as herein set out former art x pertained to private swimming pools and derived from adopted dec 3 1985  adopted oct 18 1988  adopted dec 15 1992  adopted dec 5 1995  and adopted jan 6 1998 the international residential adopted by section 8203 is hereby changed altered modified or otherwise amended as follows 1 of the international residential hereby changed to read as follows title these regulations shall be known as the residential one and twofamily dwellings of the city of manhattan kansas and herein after known as this code 2 of the international residential hereby changed to read as follows work exempt from permit permits shall not be required for the following exemption from permit requirements of this code shall not be deemed to grant authorization for any work to be done in any manner in violation of this code or any other law or ordinances of this jurisdiction building 1 one story detached accessory structures used as tool and storage sheds playhouses and similar uses provided the floor area does not exceed 200 square feet 2 detached pergolas and other detached structures which do not exceed 400 square feet are entirely open and do not have solid roofs 3 fences not over 7 feet high 4 retaining walls that are not over 7 feet in height measured from grade on the low end to the top of the wall unless supporting a surcharge 5 water tanks supported directly upon grade if the capacity does not exceed 5000 gallons and the ratio of height to diameter or width does not exceed 2 to 1 6 sidewalks and driveways 7 porches decks and similar uses which are less than 30 inches from floor to grade at any point and are not roofed or enclosed 8 painting papering tiling carpeting cabinets countertops and similar finish work 9 swings and other playground equipment 10 window awnings supported by an exterior wall which do not project more than 54 inches from the exterior wall and do not require additional support electrical repairs and maintenance a permit shall not be required for minor repair work including the replacement of lamps or the connection of approved portable electrical equipment to approved permanently installed receptacles gas 1 portable heating cooking or clothes drying appliances 2 replacement of any minor part that does not alter approval of equipment or make such equipment unsafe 3 portablefuelcell appliances that are not connected to a fixed piping system and are not interconnected to a power grid mechanical 1 portable heating and ventilation appliances 2 portable cooling units or portable evaporative coolers 3 steam hot or chilled water piping within any heating or cooling equipment regulated by this code 4 replacement of any minor part that does not alter approval of equipment or make such equipment unsafe 5 selfcontained refrigeration systems containing 10 pounds or less of refrigerant that are actuated by motors of 1 horsepower or less 6 portablefuelcell appliances that are not connected to a fixed piping system and are not interconnected to a power grid the clearing of stoppages or stopping of leaks in drains water soil waste or vent pipe  provided however that if any concealed trap drainpipe water soil waste or vent pipe becomes defective and it becomes necessary to remove and replace the same with new material such work shall be considered as new work and a permit shall be obtained and inspection made as provided in this code 3 of the international residential hereby changed to read as follows temporary power the building official is authorized to give permission to temporarily supply and use power in part of an electric installation before such installation has been fully completed and the final certificate of completion has been issued the part covered by the temporary certificate shall comply with the requirements specified for temporary lighting heat or power in the national electrical adopted in of the city ordinances 4 of the international residential hereby value of all construction work for which the permit is issued including all finish work painting roofing electrical plumbing heating air conditioning elevators fireextinguishing systems and any other permanent equipment no fee other than that set forth above shall be charged for new construction  although this does not preclude the building official from charging separate fees for sewer and water adopted apr 17 198 provided that art xi  82168225 82318242 be amended to read as herein set out prior to such amendment former art xi pertained to the same subject matter and was derived from the 1973 514  and  2 adopted dec 7 1982 cross reference moving of wires for moving of buildings by communications services inc  15163 division 1  generally compliance with city ordinances generally no building or structure now or hereafter erected shall be moved into or relocated within the corporate limits of the city unless such building or structure can be made to conform with the requirements of the ordinances and building codes of the city  41784 moving of interfering wires a if a permit application required by this article states that it will be necessary to cut and move raise or in any way interfere with any wires cables or other aerial equipment of any public or municipally owned utility the applicant shall give not less than 15 days written notice to the public or municipally owned utility owning or operating such wires cables or other aerial facilities or to their agents of the intent to move a structure giving the time and location of the applicants moving operations should the moving operation be delayed then applicant shall again give the public or municipally owned utility not less than 24 hours advance notice of the actual operation b it shall be the duty of any public utility owning or operating such wires cables or other aerial equipment after service of notice to furnish competent workmen or linemen to remove raise or cut such wires cables or other aerial equipment as will be necessary to facilitate applicants moving operations the necessary expense which is incurred by or on behalf of any public utility for cutting raising removing or otherwise facilitating the moving operations of the applicant shall be paid by applicant to each public utility concerned the public utility may require the applicant to furnish the public utility with appropriate bond or other surety agreement insuring the payment of all expenses incurred as a result of applicants moving operations c no person firm or corporation shall move haul or transport any house building derrick or other structure of the height when loaded for movement of 24 feet or more from the surface of the highway road street or alley upon across or over any public highway road street or alley provided that if the designated travel route does not interfere with any existing telephone cable television or electric power wires traffic signals trees or other similar objects there are no limitations on the load height d it shall be unlawful for any person firm or corporation engaged as principal or employee in moving any house building derrick or other structure as provided for in the above sections to move touch cut molest or in any way interfere with any telephone telegraph electric light or electric power wires or any poles bearing any such wires or any other equipment  41784   51987   61912 rotating traffic signals if any traffic signal must be rotated for maneuvering the mover is required to have this work done by a licensed electrician  41784 cutting or trimming trees it shall be unlawful for any person engaged in the moving of any building or structure to cut or trim trees for the purpose of allowing any such building to pass street avenue alley or public way or lands within the city without the consent of and under the direction of the owner of such tree and the forestry supervisor when a building or structure to be moved is of a sufficient height to cause undue damage to shade trees adjacent to the moving route it shall be the duty of the forestry supervisor to forbid the moving of such building except that he shall not forbid the moving of any building if an alternate route can be established by which damage to shade trees is avoided any cutting or trimming shall be completed by a licensed arborist contracted by the mover to the satisfaction of the forestry supervisor  41784 damage to public property if in moving any building or structure any person shall cause damage to any street avenue alley or public place or to any building bridge or any other property belonging to the city the same shall be immediately repaired at the movers expense and under the direction and supervision of the building official  41784 passageways  safety requirements if at any time during the actual moving of such building upon any street avenue or alley of the city it is not reasonably possible for vehicles to safely pass along the building a flagman or barricade shall be placed at the intersecting street ahead and to the rear of the building to detour traffic around the block in which the building is located every such mover when moving any building or other structure over along or upon any street avenue or alley shall move during daylight hours  41784 halting outside city limits to assure compliance with article all buildings or structures except those included under section 8232 being moved into or corporate limits of the city may be halted outside the city limits until all provisions of this article relative to inspections and permits have been complied with by the person moving the structure or building  41784 halting in city when damage or violations occur authorized city officials or any police officer shall have the right at all times to halt the moving of any building or structure over along or upon any of the streets avenues or alleys of the city when such moving is being done in a dangerous careless inefficient manner likely to lead to serious damage to paving curb gutter trees or any other public property or to person or private property due to lack of proper equipment for such moving inexperienced employees lack of proper supervision or from any other cause and it is hereby made their duty to halt such moving until such lack of proper method has been corrected it shall also be the duty of the aforesaid officials to halt the loading of any building or structure until the necessary provisions of this article have been complied with  41784 cleanup  filling in of basement the contractor shall remove any foundation walls that extend above the ground and make level the lot with approved materials within seven days after the building is moved from the lot  unless the existing basement is in sound condition and a building permit has been issued for an improvement that incorporates the existing basement  41784 abandoned sewers every abandoned building sewer or part thereof shall be plugged or capped in an approved manner within five feet of the property line when this is accomplished it shall be inspected and the measurements recorded by the building official the abandoned building sewer must be plugged or capped within five working days after the building is moved from the lot  41784 secs 82268230  reserved division 2  permit required no person shall move any building or structure along or across any street or public way within the corporate limits of the city without a permit therefor from the building official issued in accordance with the provisions of this division  41784 exceptions a the permit provisions of this division shall not apply to the moving of any small onestory buildings such as garages accessory buildings and construction offices when such buildings do not exceed 200 square feet of floor area provided that such building is loaded upon a pneumatictired truck or a truck and not more than one twowheeled pneumatictired trailer  provided further that the combined height of building and truck or trailer is not greater than 16 feet from the surface of the highway road street or alley b every person shall when moving any such building or structure use the highest degree of care that no damage results to any person or property in case damage to person or property results from such moving the city shall in no case be held liable for such damage a permit shall be required for the moving of any structure over along or upon any street or other public grounds of the city under which it is necessary to use heavy house moving timbers house moving trucks or other regular building moving equipment  41784   51987   61912 application all applications for permits to move any building or structure or appurtenances thereto upon or across any street or public way in the city shall be made to the building official applications shall be made in writing on forms furnished by the city and shall accurately state the legal owner the location and description of the proposed building or structure to be moved and shall state a suggested route over which it is proposed to be moved and the proposed new location thereof giving the lot address and ward or addition such application shall further state the proposed date or dates for the moving of such building or structure  41784 fees a charge of $10000 shall be collected in advance from the mover or owner of the building for the moving permit in addition for those structures being relocated within the city limits a fee of $020 per square foot of total floor area of the structure being moved shall be collected as the building permit fee to cover necessary inspections to assure compliance with codes  41784 tentative approval by building official before the granting of a moving permit under this division the building official shall examine the structure and the proposed location and if the condition of such structure is such that it can be moved safely and the new location is in accordance with the ordinances of the city the building official shall pass such permit application on to the other involved agencies with a favorable recommendation  otherwise the application shall be refused  41784 issuance of the permit the building official shall approve the issuance of the building andor moving permits only if the following requirements have been met 1 the applicant has filed a complete application and paid the fees and the application meets the requirements of this article 2 if a building or structure will be moved to a location within the city limits that the proposed use and structure meet the requirements of all city ordinances and the manhattan zoning regulations  41784   61912 compliance with the building code if a building is to be relocated within the city it shall be brought into compliance with the requirements of the current new construction codes and all other city codes sufficient to authorize the issuance of an occupancy permit for the structure within 120 calendar days of the issuance of the moving permit in addition all such relocated structures that have a substantially deteriorated exterior shall have such exterior repaired recovered or replaced an applicant for good cause shown may receive an extension of the 120day requirement from the building official  41784   61912 reserved city officers to approve route and make other recommendations it shall be the duty of the building official upon receiving an application for a moving permit to approve the route over or along which the building shall be moved he may require the planking of streets shoring up of bridges and such other requirements as he may deem necessary it shall be the duty of the forestry and traffic supervisors to approve the moving of buildings and the route thereof and file evidence of the same with the building official  41784 display of permit the moving permit as required in this division shall at all times accompany the building or structure being moved under such permit the permit issued placard shall be displayed so that it is highly visible by opposing traffic  41784 denial revocation suspension of permits  appeal a the building official may deny revoke or suspend a permit issued pursuant to this article for the following reasons 1 the requirements set forth in section 8236 have not been met  or 2 the permit holder or the permit holders employees contractors agents or other persons responsible fail to perform the activities provided for in the permit in compliance with the permit andor city ordinances b any person who has been denied a permit under the terms of this article or whose permit has been revoked or suspended may appeal such action to the city manager by filing a notice of such appeal within seven days of the action with the city clerk the city manager in conducting such appeal may enter such orders as are consistent with this article  41784   61912 penalty any person who is convicted of a failure to comply with any requirement of this article shall be fined in any sum not exceeding $50000 or imprisoned for a period not exceeding six months or by both such fine or imprisonment each day that a violation of the requirements of this article exists shall be deemed to be a separate and distinct offense  41784 secs 82438250  reserved existing of this division  12782 exceptions to section 8261 the permit provision of section 8261 shall not apply to the demolition of any small one story buildings such as garages or accessory buildings when such buildings do not exceed 200 square feet of floor area  12782   8613 abandoned sewers every abandoned building sewer or part thereof shall be plugged or capped in an approved manner within five moving of building  8225 fees a charge of $5000 per structure shall be collected in advance from the demolition contractor unless the demolition is being done in preparation for a new building construction project on the same site and the demolition permit and new construction permit are applied for at the same time  12782   1290 display of permit a permit issued placard shall be posted and visible from the street before and during demolition  12782 revocation of permit any permit granted under the provisions of this article is revocable and the governing body may upon their own motion and after five days written notice to the holder of the permit which is under consideration revoke or cancel the permit for the failure of the party holding such permit to comply with the terms of this article or for conducting his business in any manner detrimental to the best interests of the citizens or residents of the city such revocation or cancellation may be ordered forthwith or the governing body may prescribe additional requirements for the continuation of the permit as may be desirable and in the best interests of the city  12782 cleanup filling in of basement upon set out former art xiv pertained to similar subject matter and derived from adopted dec 7 1982  adopted   adopted   adopted   and adopted oct 18 1988 fees for sign permits when a sign permit is required by the manhattan zoning regulations the applicant shall pay the following feess at the time the sign permit application is submitted to the city a for each sign identified in the application the fee shall be $2500  except that for each sign or portion thereof that includes a digital animated sign digital graphic sign or electronic changeable copy sign the fee shall be $10000 b for signs installed before a permit is approved and issued the fees charged shall be tripled  2 1306   12214 sign contractors license required  fee  term a it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in the business or trade of constructing rebuilding erecting remodeling relocating expanding altering or painting signs in the city without first obtaining a license therefore as provided in this article b no license shall be issued until a complete application has been filed with and approved by the building official such application shall be on a form provided by the building official and shall contain all the information requested by the building official an application is not complete until the applicant has paid the required annual license fee to the city c this article shall not apply to officials or employees of the federal state county or city governments engaged in the performance of their official duties d the annual license fee for a sign contractors license shall be $10000 e all such licenses shall expire on december 31 of the year issued  2 1306 sign contractors license  denial suspension revocation a licenses applied for or issued under this article may be denied suspended or revoked by the building official at any time for any of the following causes 1 failure to furnish a completed application or required license fee 2 fraud misrepresentation or any false statement contained in the application for a license 3 any violation of the manhattan zoning regulations b written notice of a denial suspension or revocation shall be made in writing stating the causes therefore and shall be delivered to the applicant or licensee personally or mailed to the applicant or licensees address stated in the application for a license c any person whose license has been denied suspended or revoked shall have the right to request a hearing before the city manager by filing a written request with the city clerk within ten days following the delivery or mailing of the written notice of denial suspension or revocation the decision of the city manager shall become final within five days after mailing notice thereof to the appealing party unless within the five days the appealing party requests in writing a hearing before the governing body  2 1306 secs 82748299  reserved alarm systems division 1  generally definitions as used in this article the following words shall have the following meaning alarm business means any business operated by a person who engages in the activity of selling altering installing leasing maintaining repairing servicing monitoring or responding to an alarm system or which causes any of these activities to take place alarm coordinator means that person or those persons designated by the city manager to administer and enforce the provisions of this article alarm system means any assembly of equipment or devices or a single device installed upon a house building or other structure fixed upon real estate which when activated emits an audible visual or electronic signal that is designed to be heard seen or received by persons outside of the protected house building or other structure and is reasonably expected to elicit or cause a response by the riley county police department or the fire department of the city provided further this term includes any assembly of equipment or devices or a single device installed in a building with multiple dwelling units which when activated emits an audible visual or electronic signal that is designed to be heard seen or received by the inhabitants of the building and is reasonably expected to elicit or cause a response by the riley county police department or the fire department of the city provided however that term does not include smoke detectors and other alarms designed to merely give onpremises notification of an alarm condition in singlefamily dwelling units alarm user means any person who owns operates manages or is otherwise in control of an alarm system and who owns operates manages or is otherwise in control of the building structure premises or facility upon which such alarm system is located answering service means a telephone answering business providing among its services the service of receiving on a continuous basis employees emergency signals from alarm systems and thereafter immediately relaying the message by live voice to the riley county police department or the fire department of the city automatic dialing device means an alarm system which automatically sends over telephone lines to the riley county police department or the fire department of the city by direct dialing or otherwise a prerecorded message or coded signal indicating the existence of an emergency situation the alarm system is designed to detect central station protective system means a system or group of systems operated by a person in which the operations of electrical protection circuits and devices are transmitted to recorded in maintained and supervised from a central station having operators in attendance at all times city means the city of manhattan kansas director means the director of the riley county police department or said persons official designee director of fire services means the director of fire services of the fire department of the city or said persons official designee false alarm means the activation of an alarm system resulting in a response by law enforcement or fire personnel when a situation requiring a response does not in fact exist a false alarm may be the result of but not limited to mechanical or electric failure malfunction improper installation improper adjustment accidental tripping misoperation misuse defect or negligence of a person 1 provided however if an alarm signal is caused by a violent condition of nature or other circumstances not reasonably subject to control by the alarm user or alarm business it shall not be deemed a false alarm for purposes of this article 2 provided further that a system designed to be used to report a robbery or holdup when used for any other purpose shall be considered a false alarm hereunder  11398 secs 83018310  reserved division 2  permits permit required it is unlawful for any person to own operate manage or otherwise control any alarm system unless an alarm system permit has been issued by the city for such alarm system  11398 permit issuance a applications for alarm system permits shall be made to the alarm coordinator applications shall be made in writing on forms provided by the city b the applicant shall supply all information requested by the city and pay a fee of $2500 prior to the issuance of the alarm system permit c alarm system permits are nontransferable however the alarm system permit is valid as long as the permit holder continuously operates the alarm system at the same location  11398 alarm system permits for governmental entities an alarm user which is a governmental entity or political unit shall be required to obtain an alarm system permit pursuant to the provisions of this division however such governmental entity or political unit is not required to pay the fee required for the issuance of the permit  11398 inspection of alarm system permits alarm system permits shall be kept on the premises upon which the alarm system is located and shall be made available for inspection to employees of the riley county police department or the city upon request  11398 confidentiality the governing body of the city of manhattan finds that information contained in applications for alarm permits is of a sensitive and private nature and should not be available to the public it is hereby declared to be the official policy of the city of manhattan that all applications submitted in compliance with this article shall be deemed to contain information of a personal nature where the public disclosure thereof would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy and are further deemed to be plans designs drawings or specifications which are prepared by a person other than an employee of a public agency or records which are the property of a private person all such information is therefore exempt from mandatory disclosure under the kansas open records act pursuant to the exceptions contained in ksa 45221a18 ksa 45221a30 and any other applicable exception all such information shall be kept so that the contents thereof shall not be known except to persons authorized with the administration and enforcement of this ordinance the alarm coordinator shall be charged with the responsibility of maintaining all records of any kind whatsoever under this article  11398 secs 83168320  reserved division 3  regulations general regulations an alarm system that emits an audible sound or signal that may be heard outside of the protected premises shall conform to the following requirements a the alarm system shall automatically discontinue emitting the sound or signal within ten minutes after activation of the alarm  and b alarm systems shall not emit a sound or signal that is similar to that of an emergency vehicle siren or a civil defense warning system  11398 notification of testing alarm users shall notify the appropriate authorities of any service test repair maintenance adjustment alteration or installation of an alarm system which might activate a false alarm upon the completion of such service test repair maintenance adjustment alteration or installation the alarm user shall notify the appropriate authorities of such completion the term appropriate authorities shall mean the riley county police department andor the fire department of the city and any other emergency agencies or personnel expected to respond to the alarm system  11398 reporting alarm signals alarm businesses alarm users employees of central station protective systems and employees of answering services shall give the following information to the appropriate persons at the time of making a request for a police or fire department response to an alarm system address of the alarmed location  type of alarm system that has been activated  name of commercial business or full first and last name of resident  specific location of the building structure or facility protected by the activated alarm  name of the alarm business making request if applicable  name of person making the request  and a phone number where the requesting party can be contacted it is the sole responsibility of the person making such request to notify authorized persons in control of such alarmed building structure or facility that such alarm has been activated  11398 false alarms a the director and the director of fire services shall forward reports of all responses to alarm systems within the city to the alarm coordinator the alarm coordinator shall be responsible for determining which alarms constitute false alarms as defined by 8300 a record of all false alarms shall be maintained by the alarm coordinator whenever the alarm coordinator makes a determination that an alarm was a false alarm and records such determination the alarm coordinator shall give notice to the alarm user of such determination b the following fees shall be assessed to alarm users who have recorded false alarms within a calendar year at a given location 1 there shall be no fees assessed for the first second and third false alarms 2 there shall be a fee of $5000 assessed for the fourth false alarm 3 there shall be a fee of $10000 assessed for the fifth false alarm 4 there shall be a fee of $15000 assessed for the sixth false alarm 5 there shall be a fee of $20000 assessed for the seventh false alarm 6 there shall be a fee of $25000 assessed for the eighth and each subsequent false alarm c whenever false alarm fees are assessed under the preceding subsection the alarm coordinator shall give notice of such assessment to the alarm user the alarm user shall submit the fees to the alarm coordinator within 30 days of the notice it is unlawful for any person to fail to pay the false alarm fees assessed by this article it shall not be a defense to this section that the alarm user did not receive the notice required herein d an alarm user who has been notified by the alarm coordinator that an alarm has been recorded as a false alarm may appeal such determination by filing a written notice of appeal with the alarm coordinator the notice of appeal shall be filed within 15 days of the date of the notice the filing of the notice of appeal shall stay the effect of the alarm coordinators determination until a decision on appeal is rendered the appeal shall be heard by the director the director of fire services or both depending upon which entity or entities responded to the alarm subsequent to considering the statements and other evidence of the person appealing and any other relevant evidence the director or the director of fire services shall issue a written decision either upholding or setting aside the determination that an alarm was a false alarm if the decision of the alarm coordinator is upheld the alarm user shall be ordered to pay the false alarm fee if applicable e any person aggrieved by or dissatisfied with the decision of the director or the director of fire services may within 15 days of the date of the decision file a written notice of appeal from said decision to the manhattan municipal court for an administrative hearing the notice shall be filed with the clerk of the municipal court and a copy of the notice shall be delivered to the alarm coordinators office the filing of an appeal under this subsection shall stay any false alarm fees ordered to be paid by the director or the director of fire services f an alarm user which is a political subdivision of the state shall not be subject to the provisions contained within subsections b c d and e of this section  11398 appeals to municipal court the hearing on appeal in municipal court provided for in section 8324 shall be conducted by the municipal court judge of the city who shall sit as an administrative judge for the purposes of this chapter the hearing on appeal shall be scheduled and held by the municipal court no later than 30 days after the notice of appeal is filed with the clerk of the court the sole issue for determination by the court shall be whether the decision of the director or the director of fire services was within the scope of his or her authority supported by substantial evidence and not arbitrary and capricious the court shall make specific findings of fact and conclusions of law in each case pursuant to its role as administrative judge the court is empowered to hold hearings subpoena witnesses take testimony of any person under oath and in connection therewith to require the production of any evidence related to any matter being heard  11398 automatic dialing devices prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to install maintain operate or assist in the operation of any automatic dialing device without the prior written consent of the agency to which the automatic dialing device is directed  11398 secs 83278340  reserved payment of proceeds of fire insurance policies scope and application the provisions of this article create a procedure pursuant to ksa 403901 et seq regarding the payment of proceeds of any insurance policy based upon a covered claim payment made for damage or loss to a building or other structure caused by or arising out of any fire explosion or windstorm no insurance company shall pay a claim of a named insured for loss or damage to any building or other structure located within the city caused by or arising out of any fire explosion or windstorm where the amount recoverable for the loss or damage to the building or other structure under all policies is in excess of 75 percent of the face value of the policy covering such building or other insured structure unless there is compliance with the procedures set out in this article  32001 lien created the governing body of the city of manhattan hereby creates a lien in favor of the city of manhattan on the proceeds of any insurance policy based upon a covered claim payment made for damage or loss to a building or other structure located within the city of manhattan caused by or arising out of any fire explosion or windstorm where the amount recoverable for all the loss or damage to the building or other structure under all policies is in excess of 75 percent of the face value of the policys covering such building or other insured structure the lien arises upon any unpaid tax special ad valorem levy or any other charge imposed upon real property by or on behalf of the city of manhattan which is an encumbrance on real property covered by the subject insurance policy whether or not evidenced by written instrument or such tax levy assessment expense or other charge that has remained undischarged for at least one year prior to the filing of a proof of loss  32001 sameencumbrances prior to final settlement on any claim covered by section 8342 the insurer or insurers shall contact the county treasurer of either riley county kansas or pottawatomie county kansas whichever is applicable to determine whether any such encumbrances as provided in section 8342 are presently in existence if the same are found to exist the insurer or insurers shall execute and transmit in an amount equal to that owing under the encumbrances a draft payable to the county treasurer of the appropriate county and adequately describing the encumbrance the draft is intended to satisfy  32001 samepro rata basis such transfer of proceeds pursuant to section 8342 shall be on a pro rata basis by all insurance companies insuring the building or other structure  32001 procedure a when final settlement on a covered claim has been agreed to or arrived at between the named insured or insureds and the company or companies and the final settlement exceeds 75 percent of the face value of any policy within the scope of this article covering any building or other insured structure and after all amounts due the holder of a first real estate mortgage against the building or other structure pursuant to the terms of the policy and endorsements thereto shall have been paid the insurance company or companies shall execute a draft payable to the city treasurer in an amount equal to the balance of the proceeds of such policy but not to exceed the sum of 15 percent of the covered claim payment unless the building official of the city has issued a certificate to the insurance company or companies indicating that the city has received proof satisfactory to the city that the insured has or will remove the damaged building or other structure as well as all associated debris or repaired rebuilt or otherwise made the premises safe and secure b such payment of proceeds to the city shall be on a pro rata basis by all companies insuring the building or other structure policy proceeds remaining after the transfer to the city shall be disbursed in accordance with the policy terms c upon the payment of the proceeds to the city as required by subsection a of this section the insurance company shall provide the city with the name and address of the named insured or insureds the total insurance coverage applicable to said building or other structure and the amount of the final settlement agreed to or arrived at between the insurance company or companies and the insured or insureds whereupon the building official shall notify the named insured or insureds by certified mail return receipt requested addressed to the address provided by the insurance company that said insurance proceeds have been received by the city of manhattan and further notifying them of the procedures to be followed under this article the failure of any insured to receive the notice provided for herein shall not invalidate any action taken by the city under this article  32001 fund created  deposit of monies the city treasurer is hereby authorized and shall create a fund to be known as the insurance proceeds fund all monies received by the city treasurer as provided for by section 8345 shall be placed in said fund and deposited in an interestbearing account  32001 building inspector  investigation removal of structure a upon receipt of monies as provided for by section 8345 the city treasurer shall notify the building official of the time and date of said receipt and transmit all documentation received from the insurance company or companies to the building official b prior to the expiration of 30 days from the receipt of said monies by the city treasurer the building official shall determine based upon investigation whether or not the building or other structure covered by the subject policy is unsafe or dangerous or is abandoned property and whether or not heshe should file with the governing body of the city the statement authorized by ksa 121752 as amended c if the building official has made the determinations required by subsection b heshe shall file the statement in writing as authorized by ksa 121752 as amended with the governing body of the city by filing such statement with the city clerk the city clerk shall note the time and date of the filing of such statement such statement shall be filed within 30 days after receipt of the payment by the city treasurer the building official shall also notify the city treasurer of the date and time of such filing and such notice to the city treasurer shall occur prior to the expiration of 29 days after the receipt of the payment by the city treasurer d if the building official does not make the determinations required by subsection b andor does not file the written statement authorized by subsection c heshe shall so notify the city treasurer the building official shall provide such notification to the city treasurer prior to the expiration of 29 days after receipt of the payment by the city treasurer upon receipt of such notification or upon expiration of 29 days after receipt of the payment by the city treasurer without any notice from the building official the city treasurer shall release all such monies received plus accrued interest to the insured or insureds as identified in the communication from the insurance company or companies such release shall be accomplished within 30 days of the receipt of the monies from the insurance company or companies  32001 removal of structure  excess monies if the building official has proceeded under the provisions of ksa 121750 et seq as amended all monies in excess of that which is ultimately necessary to comply with the provisions for the removal of the building or structure less salvage value if any shall be paid to the insured  32001 samedisposition of funds if the building official with regard to a building or other structure damaged by fire explosion or windstorm determines that it is necessary to proceed pursuant to ksa 121756 as amended any proceeds received by the city treasurer under the authority of section 8345 relating to that building or other structure shall be used to reimburse the city for any expenses incurred by the city in proceeding under ksa 121756 upon reimbursement from the insurance proceeds the building official shall immediately affect the release of the lien if any resulting therefrom should the expenses incurred by the city in the performance of actions taken pursuant to any of the provisions of ksa 121750 et seq as amended exceed the insurance proceeds paid over to the city treasurer under section 8345 the city may proceed to collect such deficiencies pursuant to law including the provisions of ksa 121750 et seq  32001 effect upon insurance policies this article shall not make the city a party to any insurance contract nor is the insurer liable to any party for any amount in excess of the proceeds otherwise payable under its insurance policy  32001 insurers  liability insurers complying with this article or attempting in good faith to comply with this article shall be immune from civil and criminal liability and such action shall not be deemed in violation of ksa 402404 and any amendments thereto including withholding payment of any insurance proceeds pursuant to this article or releasing or disclosing any information pursuant to this article  32001 secs 83528359  reserved energy conservation code incorporation of the international energy conservation is hereby incorporated by reference for the purpose of regulating and governing energy efficient building envelopes and installation of energy efficient mechanical lighting and power systems within the corporate city limits of the city of manhattan kansas that certain standard energy code known as the international energy conservation edition as being recommended by the international new jersey avenue nw 6 th floor washington dc 200 save and except such articles sections parts or portions thereof as hereinafter omitted deleted modified or changed no fewer than one copy of such publication shall be marked or stamped official copy as adopted by  and shall be attached to a copy of this ordinance and filed with the city clerk and open for inspection and available to the public at all reasonable hours all administrative departments of the city charged with enforcement of this code shall be supplied at the cost of the city such number of official copies similarly marked as may be deemed expedient  32613 amendments the international energy conservation adopted by section 8360 is hereby changed altered modified and otherwise amended as follows 1 of the international energy
