and the city on the design and construction to ensure that the work required is necessary and done in a cost effective manner the company may require payment in advance of estimated costs of relocation prior to undertaking any work required to accommodate any new private development project initiated after the effective date of this franchise h the company shall take adequate measures to protect and defend its facilities in the rightsofway from harm or damage if the company fails to accurately locate facilities when requested it shall have no claim for costs or damages against the city the company shall be responsible to the city and its agents representatives and authorized contractors for all damages including but not limited to delay damages repair costs down time construction delays penalties or other expenses of any kind arising out of the failure of the company to perform any of its obligations under this franchise agreement the above general provisions notwithstanding the city and its authorized contractors shall take reasonable precautionary measures including calling for utility locations one call and exercising due caution when working near the companys facilities i at a minimum and without limitation the company shall comply with all building electrical and zoning codes currently or hereafter in force in the city the company shall comply with all technical and zoning standards governing construction reconstruction installation operation testing use maintenance and dismantling of the facilities in the rightofway as required by present and future federal state and city laws and regulations including but not limited to the most recent standards of the state of kansas the occupational safety and health administration and the us department of transportation j the city encourages the conservation of the rightsofway by the sharing of space by all utilities notwithstanding provisions of this franchise prohibiting third party use to the extent required by federal or state law the company shall permit any other franchised entity by an appropriate grant or a contract or agreement negotiated by the parties to use any and all facilities constructed or erected by the company k the company shall comply with city ordinances and regulations regarding the cutting trimming and removal of trees upon and overhanging the rightsofway for routine trimming operations customers shall be contacted at least one week in advance by either personal contact or by informational door hanger the company shall perform line clearance work in accordance with its general terms and conditions nesc 218 and regulations established under osha 29 cfr  all pruning operations shall be performed by personnel qualified to perform the work and in accordance with the latest versions of ansi z1331 safety requirements for pruning repairing maintaining and removing trees and cutting brush and ansi a300  standard practices for tree shrub and other woody plant maintenance  5107 indemnity and hold harmless the company its successors and assigns in the construction maintenance and operation of its electric power system shall use all reasonable and proper precaution to avoid damage or injury to persons and property the company its successors and assigns shall hold and save the city its officers employees agents and authorized contractors harmless from any and against all claims damages expense liability and costs including reasonable attorney fees caused by the negligence in whole or in part of company employees agents or servants related to the companys occupancy of the rightsofway in the event a claim shall be made or an action shall be instituted against the city arising out of the companys occupancy of the rightsofway then upon notice by the city to the company the company shall assume responsibility for the defense of such actions at the cost of the company subject to the option of the city to appear and defend  5107 binding contract a this article shall become a binding contract between the parties and be in force and effect from and after its passage and upon approval by the city written acceptance by the company to the city clerk and publication in the official city newspaper b this nonexclusive franchise grant and privilege is granted under and subject to all applicable laws and under and subject to all of the orders rules and regulations now or hereafter adopted by governmental bodies now or hereafter having jurisdiction c if any clause sentence or section of this article shall be held to be invalid it shall not affect the remaining provisions of this article  5107 secs 15431550  reserved kansas gas servicenatural gas footnotes  4  editors note of adopted jan 9 200 repealed which pertained to a franchise agreement with kansas power and light company and which had been codified as  15511558 of enacted a new franchise agreement with kansas gas service which has streets alleys and public ways of the city for a period of 20 years from the first day of january 200 to place and maintain the equipment and property necessary for the purpose of transmitting and distributing natural gas to the city and its inhabitants city and beyond the limits thereof at the sole expense of kansas gas service for the full term of this franchise and to do all things necessary or proper to carry on the business of selling and distributing natural gas thereto b kansas gas service shall not use or allow any other person to use its facilities or the citys rightofway for any purpose other than the provision of natural gas kansas gas service shall not permit a subsidiary affiliate or a third party to acquire rights to occupy rightofway under this franchise except that kansas gas service may allow the use of its facilities when the city receives prior written notification of such use and such use is compensated to the city under the provisions of this franchise or a franchise granted by the city to any such third party  1907 consideration 1 as consideration for granting this franchise and in lieu of any city occupation license or permit fees or revenue taxes kansas gas service shall pay to the city during the term of this franchise four percent of its gross cash receipts from the sale of natural gas for consumption in the city for all purposes within the corporate limits of the city gross cash receipts shall not include other operating revenues received by kansas gas service that are not related to the sale of natural gas including but not limited to connection fees disconnection and reconnection fees temporary service charges delayed or late payment charges collection fees and returned check charges as such terms are used in tariffs or in the natural gas industry 2 kansas gas service shall make such payments monthly for the preceding monthly period 3 notwithstanding subsection 1 kansas gas service shall be required to pay the usual general property taxes and special ad valorem property assessments sales and excise taxes or charges made for privileges that are not connected to the natural gas business and the gross cash receipts payments required by subsection 1 shall not apply to such taxes assessments fees taxes or charges 4 for the term of this franchise any permit fees relating to the excavation of or adjacent to any street alley or other public place shall be deemed a part of the compensation paid in subsection 1 provided that kansas gas service shall notify the city submit application for and obtain approval of any required permits for excavation or any other work in the citys streets avenues bridges parks parking areas alleys public areas or rightsofway in the event of an emergency kansas gas service shall have the right to commence work without having first provided such forms  1907 installations all mains services and pipe which shall be laid or installed under this grant shall be so located and laid so as not to obstruct or interfere with any water pipes drains sewers or other structures or facilities already installed  1907 street excavations kansas gas service shall in the doing of any work in connection with its gas mains pipes and services avoid so far as may be practicable interfering with the use of any street alley avenue or other public thoroughfare kansas gas service shall at its own expense and without expense to the city restore and replace the paving or surface in a good condition to the satisfaction of the city  1907 cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 supply of gas it is recognized that the natural gas delivered by kansas gas service is supplied from a pipeline system transporting natural gas from distant sources of supply  and kansas gas service by its acceptance of this franchise obligates itself to furnish natural gas in such quantity and for such length of time required by the franchise to the extent that such distant sources and pipelines are reasonably capable of supplying  1907 protection of city kansas gas service its successors and assigns in the construction maintenance and operation of its natural gas system shall use all service employees agents or servants related to kansas gas services occupancy of the rightsofway in the event a claim shall be made or an action shall be instituted against the city arising from kansas gas services occupancy of the rightsofway then upon notice by the city to kansas gas service kansas gas service shall assume responsibility for the defense of such actions at the cost of kansas gas service subject to the option of the city to appear and defend  1907 binding contract a this article shall become a binding contract between the parties and be in force and effect from and after its passage and upon approval by the city written acceptance by kansas gas service to the city clerk and publication in the official city newspaper within 20 days after the passage and approval of this article kansas gas service shall file a copy of the article with the kansas corporation commission b if any clause sentence or section of this article shall be held to be invalid it shall not affect the remaining provisions of this article c this article shall constitute the entire franchise agreement between the city of manhattan and kansas gas service this article shall supersede and cancel prior understandings agreements or representations whether written or oral relating to the franchise  1907 subject to state law the city has the authority to grant this franchise to kansas gas service pursuant to the provisions of ksa 12200 as amended  1907 amendment 1 upon 60 days advance written notice by the city the franchise fee percentage rate may be changed on the fifth tenth or fifteenth anniversary of the effective date of this article provided that the franchise fee percentage rate shall not exceed five percent 2 if the kansas corporation commission takes action with respect to this franchise agreement as amended which precludes kansas gas service from recovering from its customers any costs or fees provided for the parties shall renegotiate accordingly 3 upon written request of either the city of manhattan or kansas gas service and upon mutual agreement of the other party the franchise may be reopened and renegotiated at any time upon the occurrence of any of the following events a change in federal state or local law regulation or order which materially affects any rights or obligations of either the city or kansas gas service including but not limited to the scope of the grant to kansas gas service or the compensation to be received by the city b change in the structure or operation of the natural gas industry which materially affects any rights or obligations of either the city or kansas gas service including but not limited to the scope of the grant to kansas gas service or the compensation to be received by the city c any other material and unintended change or shift in the economic benefit to the city or the company relied upon and anticipated upon entering into this franchise 4 the compensation provision of this franchise shall be reopened and renegotiated at any time if energy consumers within the city have access to alternative natural gas suppliers or other suppliers of energy use the public rightsofway or public property of the city without paying a franchise fee or other payment substantially equivalent to the franchise fee established herein which results in a material and unfair disadvantage to kansas gas service the use of the rightofway provision of this franchise shall be reopened and renegotiated if energy consumers within the city have access to alternative natural gas suppliers or other suppliers of energy which use the public rightsofway or public property of the city and do not have requirements on the use of the public ways substantially equivalent to the requirements of this franchise which results in a material and unfair disadvantage to kansas gas service upon any such event the city shall have up to 120 days after written request from kansas gas service to restore competitive neutrality provided that any adjustment in compensation resulting from the renegotiations under this subsection shall be effective no later than 120 days after the receipt of such notice by the city 5 any amendments pursuant to this section shall be made by ordinance as required by state law the franchise shall remain in effect according to its terms until any review or renegotiation is complete and such amendments are adopted  1907 use of the citys rightofway kansas gas service shall comply with the citys rules regulations policies resolutions and ordinances in effect now or hereafter adopted that relate to the use of the citys rightofway kansas gas service shall comply with the citys rules regulations policies resolutions and ordinances in effect now or hereafter adopted that relate to permits sidewalk and pavement cuts utility location construction coordination and other requirements on the use of the rightofway provided however that kansas gas service retains its right to oppose challenge or seek judicial review of any such rules regulations policies resolutions or ordinances proposed adopted or promulgated by the city as provided by law further other than the fee required by section 1552 such rules regulations or policies shall not require the payment of additional fees or additional costs for the use of the rightofway  1907 transport fees the city may by separate ordinance provide for the assessment and collection of franchise fees on all natural gas transported transport gas by kansas gas service or by others but not sold by kansas gas service to any consumer or user within the city facilities of kansas gas service located in the public rightofway such ordinance shall provide that the customer transporting gas gas service facilities shall be solely responsible for the payment of any applicable franchise fee but said franchise may grant to kansas gas service the authority to collect on behalf of the city the total compensation to be made to the city by other parties using kansas gas service facilities for distribution of transport gas such franchise assessment shall be compatible with the kansas gas service billing system to the extent any transporter using kansas gas service facilities fails to pay any amounts owed by transporters under the separate ordinance kansas gas service shall notify the city of such amount and city shall be solely responsible for collecting any sums owed  1907 western union telegraph company rights granted the western union telegraph company its successors and assigns are authorized to erect and maintain on the streets alleys and public ways of the city the poles and fixtures and wires necessary for the purpose of supplying the citizens of the city and to the public communication by telegraph or other improved electrical device such use to be and continue upon the terms and conditions hereinafter stated  location of poles and lines the location of the poles and the lines now in use is hereby approved  and the location of all poles and lines hereafter to be erected and any change in the location of the poles and lines now in use or extensions thereof shall be under the direction and control of the governing body  not to interfere with traffic poles and wires shall be placed and maintained so as not to interfere with travel on the highways and the company shall hold the city free and blameless from all damages arising by reason of any abuse of such occupancy this grant is made and is to be enjoyed subject to such reasonable regulations and ordinances of a police nature as the governing body is authorized and sees proper at any time to adopt not destructive to the rights herein granted  cross reference traffic and motor vehicles generally ch 31 not exclusive the right of use herein given shall not be exclusive and the city reserves the power to grant a like rightofway to any other telegraph company  the same however not to interfere with the reasonable and proper exercise of the privileges herein granted  consideration in consideration whereof the western union telegraph company shall and by the acceptance of this article does agree to allow the governing body to attach at any time to the top crossarm of any of the poles where practicable the city fire alarm and police wires and such poles are hereby made a municipal instrumentality for that purpose  provided that the attachment shall be made so as not to interfere with the companys use and the attachment shall be made and maintained under the direction of the companys manager in the city the company shall furnish for the city the use of its poles for the attachment thereto of its fire alarm boxes without charge to the city  removal of lines and poles whenever the company ceases to operate a telegraph line in the city and ceases to use the poles and lines herein provided for in the operation of its line of telegraph then the company shall remove such lines and poles from the streets and alleys of the city within 60 days from date that the company ceases to use and operate such lines  secs 15771580  reserved southwestern bell telephone company footnotes  5  editors note of adopted  repealed from which art vi  15811598 derived of said ordinance enacted similar provisions to read as herein set out definitions for purposes of this article the following words and phrases shall have the meanings given herein access line shall mean and be limited to retail billed and collected residential lines  business lines  isdn lines  pbx trunks and simulated exchange access lines provided by a central office based switching arrangement where all stations served by such simulated exchange access lines are used by a single customer of the provider of such arrangement access line may not be construed to include interoffice transport or other transmission media that do not terminate at an end user customers premises or to permit duplicate or multiple assessment of access line rates on the provision of a single service or on the multiple communications paths derived from a billed and collected access line access line shall not include the following wireless telecommunications services the sale or lease of unbundled loop facilities special access services lines providing only data services without voice services processed by a telecommunications local exchange service provider or private line service arrangements access line count means the number of access lines serving consumers within the corporate boundaries of the city on the last day of each month access line fee means the fee determined by the city up to a maximum as set out in kansas statutes annotated 122001 supplemental 2002 ksa and amendments thereto to be used by sbc kansas in calculating the amount of access line remittance access line remittance means the amount to be paid by sbc kansas to the city the total of which is calculated by multiplying the access line fee as determined by the city by the number of access lines served by sbc kansas as a telecommunications local exchange service provider within the city for each month in that calendar quarter communications system or system means the cables wires lines optic fiber and any associated converters equipment or other facilities designed constructed or occupied by a provider or others for the purpose of producing receiving amplifying or distributing telecommunications service to or from locations within the city city means the city of manhattan kansas facilities means any portion of a system located in along over upon under or public rightofway franchise fee means the access line fee or fee on gross receipts established under this article gross receipts means only those receipts collected from within the corporate boundaries of the city and which are derived from the following a recurring local exchange service for business and residence which includes basic exchange service touch tone optional calling features and measured local calls  b recurring local exchange access line services for pay phone lines provided by a telecommunications local exchange service provider to all pay phone service providers  c local directory assistance revenue  d line status verificationbusy interrupt revenue  e local operator assistance revenue  and f nonrecurring local exchange service revenue which shall include customer service for installation of lines reconnection of service and charge for duplicate bills all other revenues including but not limited to revenues from extended area service the sale or lease of unbundled network elements nonregulated services carrier and end user access long distance wireless telecommunications services lines providing only data service without voice services processed by a telecommunications local exchange service provider private line service arrangements internet broadband and all other services not wholly local in nature are excluded from gross receipts gross receipts shall be reduced by bad debt expenses uncollectible and late charges shall not be included within gross receipts if a telecommunications local exchange service provider offers additional services of a wholly local nature which if in existence on or before  would have been included with the definition of gross receipts such services shall be included from the date of the offering of such services in the city local exchange service means local switched telecommunications service within any local exchange service area approved by the state corporation commission regardless of the medium by which the local telecommunications service is provided the term local exchange service shall not include wireless communication services provider means a local exchange carrier as defined in subsection h of ksa 661187 and amendments thereto or a telecommunications carrier as defined in subsection m of ksa 661187 and amendments thereto public rightofway means only the area of real property in which the city has a dedicated or acquired rightofway interest in the real property it shall include the area on below or above the present and future streets alleys avenues roads highways parkways or boulevards dedicated or acquired as rightofway the term does not include the airwaves above a rightofway with regard to wireless telecommunications or other nonwire telecommunications or broadcast service easements obtained by utilities or private easements in platted subdivisions or tracts sbc kansas or company means southwestern bell telephone lp the franchisee herein telecommunications local exchange service provider means a local exchange carrier as defined in subsection h of ksa 661187 and amendments thereto and a telecommunications carrier as defined in subsection m of ksa 661187 and amendments thereto which does or in good faith intends to provide local exchange service the term telecommunications local exchange service provider does not include an interexchange carrier that does not provide local exchange service competitive access provider that does not provide local exchange service or any wireless telecommunications local exchange service provider telecommunications services means providing the means of transmission between or among points specified by the user of information of the users choosing without change in the form or content of the information as sent and received  61703 grant a this contract franchise ordinance hereby grants to sbc kansas a telecommunications local exchange service provider providing local exchange service within the city the nonexclusive contract right privilege and franchise to construct maintain and operate facilities along across upon and under the public rightofway for the purpose of providing telecommunications services nothing in this franchise is intended to preclude the city from seeking or authorize the city to seek a franchise from any subsidiary affiliate or third party providing telecommunications services b this contract franchise ordinance shall not convey title equitable or legal in the public rightofway and gives only the right to occupy public rightofway for the purposes and for the period stated herein c this contract franchise ordinance does not provide sbc kansas the right to provide cable service to the city and inhabitants thereof for purposes of this ordinance cable service is defined as the oneway transmission to subscribers of video programming or other programming services and subscriber interaction if any which is required for the selection of such video programming or other programming service  but cable service does not include point to point point to multipoint and switched video services that sbc kansas has historically offered or other similar services that sbc kansas may in the future offer nothing in this contract franchise ordinance is intended to preclude the city from seeking or authorize the city to seek a franchise from any subsidiary affiliate or third party providing cable services sbc kansas and city agree that nothing in this franchise is intended to authorize the city to seek from sbc kansas nor to require sbc kansas to obtain a franchise to offer open video systems as that term is used in section 653 of the telecommunications act of 1996 codified at 47 usc 573 sbc kansas and city further agree however that this ordinance does not authorize sbc kansas to offer open video systems without paying a franchise fee on the gross revenues of the system operator for the provision of cable service in lieu of a franchise fee pursuant to and in the manner described in 47 usc 573c2b and without complying with federal communication commission fcc regulations promulgated pursuant to 47 usc 573  61703 term a this contract franchise ordinance shall be effective for a term of one year from the effective date of this contract franchise ordinance thereafter this contract franchise ordinance will renew for one additional one year term unless either party notifies the other party of its intent to terminate the contract franchise ordinance prior to 180 days before the termination of the then current term the term of this franchise shall be deemed a continuation of the franchise that became effective on  and not a new franchise the additional term provided for herein shall also be deemed a continuation of this franchise and not a new franchise or amendment b upon written request of either the city or grantee this contract franchise ordinance shall be renegotiated at any time in accordance with the requirements of ksa 12200 as amended upon any of the following events changes in federal state or local laws regulations or orders that materially affect any rights or obligations of either the city or grantee including but not limited to the scope of the contract franchise ordinance granted to the grantee or the compensation to be received by the city hereunder c amendments under this section if any shall be made by contract ordinance as prescribed by statute the contract franchise ordinance shall remain in effect according to its terms pending completion of any review or renegotiation provided by this section  61703   71106   71508 compensation a in consideration of this contract franchise ordinance sbc kansas agrees to remit to the city a franchise fee of $120 per access line thereafter compensation for each calendar year of the remaining term of the contract franchise ordinance shall continue to be based on a sum equal to $120 per access line unless the city notifies sbc kansas at least 90 before the end of the calendar year that it intends to switch to a gross receipts fee in the following calendar year in the event the city elects compensation based on a gross receipts fee nothing herein precludes the city from switching back to a access line fee provided the city notifies sbc kansas at least 90 before the end of the calendar year b beginning  and every 36 months thereafter the city subject to the public notification procedures set forth in ksa 122001 l and m as amended may elect to adopt an increased access line fee or gross receipts fee subject to the provisions and maximum fee limitations contained in ksa 12200 as amended or may choose to decline all or any portion of any increase in the access line fee c the franchise fee shall be due and payable on a monthly basis within 45 calendar days after the end of the remittal period if any franchise fee or any portion thereof is not postmarked or delivered on or before the due date interest thereon shall accrue from the due date until received at the applicable statutory interest rate d franchise fee payments shall be accompanied by a 9k2 statement showing the manner in which the franchise fee was calculated on a quarterly basis no acceptance by the city of any franchise fee shall be construed as an accord that the amount paid is in fact the correct amount nor shall acceptance of any franchise fee payment be construed as a release of any claim of the city any dispute concerning the amount due under this section shall be resolved in the manner set forth in ksa 12200 as amended e the city or its designated representatives shall have the right to examine upon written notice to sbc kansas no more often than once per calendar year those records necessary to verify the correctness of the franchise fees f within 60 days of the effective date of this contract franchise ordinance sbc kansas shall pay to the city a onetime application fee of $100000 the parties agree that such fee reimburses the city for its reasonable actual and verifiable costs of reviewing and approving this contract franchise ordinance sbc kansas shall additionally pay the publication costs of this ordinance g the franchise fee required herein shall be in addition to not in lieu of all taxes charges assessments licenses fees and impositions otherwise applicable that are or may be imposed by the city under ksa 122001 and 171902 as amended the franchise fee is compensation for use of the public rightofway and shall in no way be deemed a tax of any kind h sbc kansas shall remit a franchise fee to the city on those access lines that have been resold to another telecommunications local exchange service provider but in such case the city shall not collect a franchise fee from the reseller telecommunications local exchange service provider and shall not require the reseller to enter a contract franchise ordinance  61703 use of public rightofway a pursuant to ksa 171902 as amended sbc kansas shall have the right to construct maintain and operate poles  conduit  cable  switches and related appurtenances  and facilities along across upon and under the public rightofway such appurtenances and facilities shall be so constructed and maintained as not to obstruct or hinder the usual travel or public safety on such public ways or obstruct the legal use by other utilities b nothing in this contract franchise ordinance shall be interpreted as granting sbc kansas the authority to construct maintain or operate any facility or related appurtenance on property owned by the city outside of the public rightofway c the authority of sbc kansas to use and occupy the public rightofway shall always be subject and subordinate to the reasonable public health safety and welfare requirements and regulations of the city the city may exercise its home rule powers in its administration and regulation related to the management of the public rightofway provided that any such exercise must be competitively neutral and may not be unreasonable or discriminatory nothing herein shall be construed to limit the authority of the city to require a competitive infrastructure provider to enter into a contract franchise ordinance sbc kansas shall comply with all laws and lawful city regulations governing the use of public rightofway d the city shall have the authority to prohibit the use or occupation of a specific portion of public rightofway by sbc kansas due to a reasonable public interest necessitated by public health safety and welfare so long as the authority is exercised in a competitively neutral manner and is not unreasonable or discriminatory a reasonable public interest shall include the following 1 the prohibition is based upon a recommendation by the city engineer is related to public health safety and welfare and is nondiscriminatory among providers including incumbent providers  2 sbc kansas has rejected a reasonable competitively neutral and nondiscriminatory justification offered by the city for requiring an alternate method or alternate route that will result in neither unreasonable additional installation expense nor a diminution of service quality  3 the city reasonably determines after affording the provider reasonable notice and an opportunity to be heard that a denial is necessary to protect the public health and safety and is imposed on a competitively neutral and nondiscriminatory basis  or 4 the specific portion of the public rightofway for which sbc kansas seeks use and occupancy is environmentally sensitive as defined by state or federal law or lies within a previously designated historic district as defined by local state or federal law e if there is an emergency necessitating response work or repair sbc kansas may begin that repair or emergency response work or take any action required under the circumstances provided that sbc kansas notifies the city promptly after beginning the work and timely thereafter meets any permit or other requirement had there not been such an emergency f sbc kansas shall repair all damage to the public rightofway caused by the activities of sbc kansas or of any agent affiliate employee or subcontractor of sbc kansas while occupying installing repairing or maintaining facilities in a public rightofway and to return the public rightofway to its functional equivalence before the damage pursuant to the reasonable requirements and specifications of the city if sbc kansas fails to make the repairs required by the city the city may affect those repairs and charge sbc kansas the cost of those repairs if the city incurs damages as a result of a violation of this subsection then the city shall have a cause of action against sbc for violation of this subsection and may recover its damages including reasonable attorney fees if sbc is found liable by a court of competent jurisdiction g when requested by the city in order to accomplish construction and maintenance activities directly related to improvements for the health safety and welfare of the public sbc kansas promptly shall remove its facilities from the public rightofway or shall relocate or adjust its facilities within the public rightofway at no cost to the city such relocation or adjustment shall be completed as soon as reasonably possible within the time set forth in any request by the city for such relocation or adjustment any damages suffered by the city or its contractors as a result of sbc kansas failure to timely relocate or adjust its facilities shall be borne by sbc kansas h sbc kansas shall coordinate the placement of its facilities in the public rightofway in a manner that minimizes adverse impact on public improvements as reasonably determined by the city engineer i in granting this contract franchise ordinance the city makes no express or implied representation or warranty regarding its rights to authorize the installation or construction of facilities on any particular segment of the public rightofway the burden and responsibility for making all such determinations in advance of construction or installation shall be entirely upon sbc kansas j except as may otherwise be provided by other applicable ordinances of the city where reasonable and appropriate and where adequate public rightofway exist sbc kansas shall place aboveground facilities underground in conjunction with city capital improvement projects andor at specific locations requested by the city provided that such placement is practical efficient and economically feasible k when sbc kansas is allowed to place facilities above ground under this section sbc kansas may attach its facilities to an existing utility pole pursuant to a properly executed agreement with the pole owner provided  however that any necessary replacement of the pole in order to accommodate the attachment shall be subject to the proper exercise of the citys police powers and in no instance shall a franchisee erect a new pole within an existing aerial pole line absent the citys prior authorization aboveground pedestals vaults or other aboveground facilities may be installed only if approved by the city where alternative underground facilities are not feasible or where underground requirements are otherwise waived pursuant to this section and shall generally be located behind the sidewalk where feasible and shall be screened from public view facilities in rear lot easements shall be exempt from the screening requirements except when they are within 50 feet of a street or highway the underground requirements of this subsection shall not apply to the maintenance and repair of existing facilities as determined by the city engineer l sbc kansas shall take all reasonable measures necessary to maintain accurate as completed records in electronic format of all facilities constructed reconstructed or relocated in the public rightofway of arterial streets after the date hereof such facilities shall be horizontally and vertically located at least every 100 feet and at any other alignment change all points of facilities shall be horizontally located from street centerline or section or quarter section lines or corners vertical locations on all points of facilities shall consist of elevations in united states geological survey datum sbc kansas shall cooperate promptly and fully with the city and take all reasonable measures necessary to provide accurate and complete information regarding the nature and horizontal and vertical location of its facilities located within rightofway when requested by the city or its authorized agents for a public project such location and identification shall be at the sole expense of sbc kansas without expense to the city its employees agents or authorized contractors m permission is hereby granted to sbc to trim trees upon any overhanging streets alleys sidewalks and public places of said city so as to prevent the branches of such trees from coming in contact with sbcs facilities  all the said trimming shall comply with all applicable laws statutes andor city regulations  61703 indemnity and hold harmless a it shall be the responsibility of sbc kansas to take adequate measures to protect and defend its facilities in the public rightofway from harm or damage if sbc kansas fails to accurately or timely locate facilities when requested it has no claim for costs or damages against the city and its authorized contractors unless such party is responsible for the harm or damage by its negligence or intentional conduct the city and its authorized contractors shall be responsible to take reasonable precautionary measures including calling for utility locations and observing marker posts when working near sbc kansas facilities b sbc kansas shall indemnify and hold the city and its officers and employees harmless against any and all claims lawsuits judgments costs liens losses expenses fees including reasonable attorney fees and costs of defense proceedings actions demands causes of action liability and suits of any kind and nature including personal or bodily injury including death property damage or other harm for which recovery of damages is sought to the extent that it is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be caused by the negligence of the provider any agent officer director representative employee affiliate or subcontractor of the provider or their respective officers agents employees directors or representatives while installing repairing or maintaining facilities in a public rightofway the indemnity provided by this subsection does not apply to any liability resulting from the negligence of the city its officers employees contractors or subcontractors if sbc kansas and the city are found jointly liable by a court of competent jurisdiction liability shall be apportioned comparatively in accordance with the laws of this state without however waiving any governmental immunity available to the city under state law and without waiving any defenses of the parties under state or federal law this section is solely for the benefit of the city and sbc kansas and does not create or grant any rights contractual or otherwise to any other person or entity sbc kansas or the city shall promptly advise the other in writing of any known claim or demand against sbc kansas or the city related to or arising out of the sbc kansas activities in a public rightofway  61703 insurance requirement and performance bond a during the term of this franchise sbc kansas shall obtain and maintain insurance coverage at its sole expense with financially reputable insurers that are licensed to do business in the state of kansas should sbc kansas elect to use the services of an affiliated captive insurance company for this purpose that company shall possess a certificate of authority from the kansas insurance commissioner sbc kansas shall provide not less than the following insurance 1 workers compensation as provided for under any workers compensation or similar law in the jurisdiction where any work is performed with an employers liability limit equal to the amount required by law 2 commercial general liability including coverage for contractual liability and products completed operations liability on an occurrence basis and not a claims made basis with a limit of not less than $200000000 combined single limit per occurrence for bodily injury personal injury and property damage liability the city shall be included as an additional insured with respect to liability arising from sbc kansas operations under this ordinance b as an alternative to the requirements of subsection a sbc kansas may demonstrate to the satisfaction of the city that it is selfinsured and as such sbc kansas has the ability to provide coverage in an amount not less than $100000000 per occurrence and $200000000 in aggregate to protect the city from and against all claims by any person whatsoever for loss or damage from personal injury bodily injury death or property damage occasioned by sbc kansas or alleged to so have been caused or occurred c sbc kansas shall as a material condition of this franchise prior to the commencement of any work and prior to any renewal thereof deliver to the city a certificate of insurance or evidence of selfinsurance satisfactory in form and content to the city evidencing that the above insurance is in force and will not be cancelled or materially changed with respect to areas and entities covered without first giving the city 30 days prior written notice sbc kansas shall make available to the city on request the policy declarations page and a certified copy of the policy in effect so that limitations and exclusions can be evaluated for appropriateness of overall coverage d sbc kansas shall as a material condition of this franchise prior to the commencement of any work and prior to any renewal thereof deliver to the city a performance bond in the amount of $5000000 payable to the city to ensure the appropriate and timely performance in the construction and maintenance of facilities located in the rightofway the required performance bond must be with good and sufficient sureties issued by a surety company authorized to transact business in the state of kansas and satisfactory to the city attorney in form and substance  61703 nondiscrimination sbc kansas will not on the grounds of race color sex religion national origin ancestry disability or age discriminate or permit discrimination against any person in the use of the public rightofway or in activities under this franchise  61703 transfer and assignment this franchise shall be assignable in accordance with the laws of the state of kansas sbc kansas shall provide the city written notice of any transfer or assignment within 30 days including notice of the name and address of the assignee and contact information  61703 expiration or termination of contract franchise ordinance upon expiration of this contract franchise ordinance whether by lapse of time by agreement between sbc kansas and city or by forfeiture thereof sbc kansas shall have the right to remove any and all of its facilities within a reasonable time after such expiration or termination or to transfer any and all of its facilities to another entity authorized to place facilities in the public rightofway it shall be the duty of the company immediately upon any such removal to restore the public rightofway from which said facilities are removed to as good a condition as the same were before said removal was effected  61703 notices except in emergencies all notices by either the city or the company to the other shall be made by personal delivery depositing such notice in the us mail certified mail return receipt requested or by facsimile any notice served by certified mail return receipt requested shall be deemed delivered five calendar days after the date of such deposit in the us mail unless otherwise provided any notice given by facsimile is deemed received by the next business day business day for purposes of this section shall mean monday city and sbc kansas observed holidays excepted emergency notices shall be provided by telephone with written notice immediately following by facsimile notices shall be addressed to the city as follows city clerk 1101 poyntz avenue manhattan kansas 66502 notice to sbc kansas shall be addressed to the company as follows sbc kansas directormunicipal affairs 220 e 6 th street room 505 topeka kansas 66603 notice shall be given as required by the terms of this contract franchise ordinance notice shall be provided to the abovenamed addressees unless directed otherwise in writing by city or sbc kansas both sbc kansas and the city shall provide to the other contact information with telephone and facsimile numbers for use in emergencies  61703 confidentiality information provided to the city by sbc kansas under ksa 122001 andor this contract franchise ordinance shall be governed by confidentiality procedures in compliance with ksa 45215 and 661220a et seq and amendments thereto in the event the city is required by law to disclose such information the city shall provide sbc kansas ten days advance notice of its intent to disclose such information and shall take such action as may be reasonably necessary to cooperate with sbc kansas to safeguard such information sbc kansas agrees to indemnify and hold the city harmless from any and all penalties or costs including attorneys fees arising from the actions of sbc kansas or of the city at the written request of sbc kansas in seeking to safeguard the confidentiality of information provided by sbc kansas to the city under this contract franchise ordinance  61703 conditions of franchise this contract franchise ordinance is granted and accepted under and subject to all applicable laws and under and subject to all of the orders rules and regulations now or hereafter adopted by governmental bodies now or hereafter having jurisdiction including all permit requirements fee payments and all other city codes and ordinances in effect as of the date of this ordinance or hereinafter adopted to the extent not in contravention of state or federal law each and every provision hereof shall be subject to acts of god fires strikes riots floods war and other causes beyond sbc kansas or the citys control  61703 acceptance prior to the effective date of the continuation of this franchise pursuant to the terms hereof grantee shall file with the city clerk of the city of manhattan its acceptance in writing of the provisions terms and conditions of this ordinance which acceptance shall be duly acknowledged before an officer authorized by law to administer oaths when so accepted the ordinance and acceptance shall constitute a contract between the city and grantee subject to the provisions of the laws of the state of kansas  61703   71106   71508 reservation of rights a the city specifically reserves its right and authority as a customer of the company and as a public entity with responsibilities towards its citizens to participate to the full extent allowed by law in proceedings concerning the companys rates and services to ensure the rendering of efficient telecommunications service at reasonable rates and the maintenance of the companys property in good repair b in granting its consent hereunder the city does not in any manner waive its regulatory or other rights and powers under and by virtue of the laws of the state of kansas as the same may be amended its home rule powers under the constitution of the state of kansas nor any of its rights and powers under or by virtue of present or future ordinances of the city c in granting its consent hereunder sbc kansas does not in any manner waive its regulatory or other rights and powers under and by virtue of the laws of the state of kansas as the same may be amended or under the constitution of the state of kansas nor any of its rights and powers under or by virtue of present or future ordinances of the city  61703 failure to enforce the failure of either party to insist in any one or more instances upon the strict performance of any one or more of the terms or provisions of this contract franchise ordinance shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment for the future of any such term or provision and the same shall continue in full force and effect no waiver or relinquishment shall be deemed to have been made by either party unless said waiver or relinquishment is in writing and signed by the parties  61703 severability if any clause sentence or section of this contract franchise ordinance or any portion thereof shall be declared by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid such decision shall not affect the validity of the remainder as a whole or any part thereof other than the part declared to be invalid  provided however the city or sbc kansas may elect to declare that the entire agreement is invalidated if the portion declared invalid is in the judgment of the city or sbc kansas an essential part of this contract franchise ordinance  61703 governing law and venue a as a condition of this contract franchise ordinance sbc kansas is required to obtain and is responsible for any necessary permit license certification grant registration or any other authorization required by any appropriate governmental entity including but not limited to the city the fcc or the kansas corporation commission kcc subject to sbcs right to challenge in good faith such requirements as established by the fcc kcc or other city regulations sbc kansas shall also comply with all applicable laws statutes andor city regulations subject to sbc kansas right to challenge in good faith such laws statutes andor city regulations b the obligations and undertakings of both parties hereto shall be performed at manhattan riley county kansas in the event that any legal proceeding is brought to enforce the terms of this franchise the same shall be brought in state or federal courts as appropriate having jurisdiction for riley county kansas  61703 effective date of franchise the effective date of the continuation of this franchise shall be   61703   71106   71508 kansas state university telecommunication system rights granted kansas state university is hereby granted the right to construct maintain and operate a communication cable in along that rightofway which is approved by action of the governing body of the city for the purpose of supplying telecommunication service to facilities owned and operated by kansas state university and others as set forth herein said grant is to be nonexclusive and subject to the terms and conditions set forth hereinafter  9995 use of rightofway in the use of rightofway under this article kansas state university shall be subject to all rules regulations policies resolutions and ordinances now or hereafter adopted or promulgated by the city in the reasonable exercise of its police power and is subject to all applicable laws orders rules and regulations adopted by governmental bodies now or hereafter having jurisdiction in addition kansas state university shall be subject to all rules regulations policies resolutions and ordinances now or hereafter adopted or promulgated by the city relating to permits and fees sidewalk and pavements cuts utility location construction coordination beautification and other requirements on the use of the rightofway and shall comply with the following a kansas state universitys use of rightofway shall in all matters be subordinate to the citys use of the rightofway for any public purpose kansas state university shall coordinate the placement of its cable in a manner which minimizes adverse impact on public improvements as reasonably determined by the city where placement is not otherwise regulated the facility shall be placed with adequate clearance from such public improvements so as not to impact or be impacted by such public improvement b all earth materials sidewalks paving crossings utilities public improvements of any kind injured or removed by kansas state university in its activities under this article shall be fully repaired by kansas state university in its activities under this article shall be fully repaired or replaced promptly by kansas state university at its sole expense and to the reasonable satisfaction of the city or owner thereof c all facilities constructed reconstructed or relocated in the rightofway after the date hereof shall be placed underground unless otherwise agreed to by the city d kansas state university shall keep and maintain accurate records and asbuilt drawings depicting accurate horizontal and vertical location of all facilities constructed reconstructed or relocated in the rightofway after the date hereof all points of facilities shall be horizontally located from street center line or section or quartersection lines or corners vertical locations or all points of facilities shall consist of elevations in either city datum or united states geological survey datum e prior to construction reconstruction or relocation of any facilities in the rightofway kansas state university shall submit to the city engineer for approval plans and specifications of the proposed installation such approval shall not be unreasonably withheld delayed or conditioned f kansas state university shall cooperate promptly and fully with the city and take all measures necessary to provide accurate and complete information regarding the nature and locations both horizontal and vertical of its facilities located within rightofway when requested by the city or its authorized agents for a public project such location and identification shall be a the sole expense of kansas state university without expense to the city its employees agents or authorized contractors kansas state university shall have a person familiar with the facilities who is responsible for timely satisfying information needs of the city and other uses of the rightofway g kansas state university shall promptly relocate or adjust any facilities located in rightofway for a public project such relocation or adjustment shall be performed by kansas state university at its sole expense without expense to the city its employees agents or authorized contractors and shall be specifically subject to rules and regulations of the city not inconsistent with this article pertaining to such h it shall be the sole responsibility of kansas state university to take adequate measures to protect and defend its facilities in the rightofway from harm or damage if kansas state university fails to accurately or timely locate facilities when requested it has no claim for costs or damages against the city and its authorized contractors or any other party authorized to be in the rightofway unless such party is solely responsible for the harm or damage by its negligence or intentional conduct i kansas state university shall notify the city not less than three working days in advance of any construction reconstruction repair or relocation of facilities which would require any street closure which reduces traffic flow to less than two lanes of moving traffic except in the event of an emergency as reasonably determined by kansas state university no such closure shall take place without such notice and prior authorization from the city the city shall follow its policies in the grant or denial of such authority which shall not be unreasonably delayed in addition all work performed in the traveled way or which in any way impacts vehicular or pedestrian traffic shall be properly signed barricaded and otherwise protected such signing shall be in conformance with the latest edition of the federal highway administrations standards and guideline for work zone traffic control unless otherwise agreed to by the city j all technical standards governing construction reconstruction installation operation testing use maintenance and dismantling of the facilities in the rightofway shall be in accordance with applicable present and future federal state and city law and regulation including but not limited to the most recent editions of the national electrical the national electrical safety the fiber optic cable installation standard of the telecommunications industry committee or such substantive equivalents as may hereafter be adopted or promulgated it is understood that the standards established in this paragraph are minimum standards and the requirements established or referenced in this article may be additional to or stricter than such minimum standards nothing in this section is intended or shall be interpreted to eliminate kansas state universitys right to use the rightofway for the purposes of this article  9995   6298 citys right to use cable as partial consideration for this article kansas state university agrees that the city shall have the right to use any communication cable installed by the university under the terms of this article for the citys own public purposes including the transmissionreception of data from other governmental entities so long as it does not interfere with the utilization of the medium by kansas state university kansas state university shall notify the city as far in advance as possible of all scheduled maintenance that would discontinue or disrupt the use even temporarily kansas state university shall notify the city immediately of any malfunction of disruption of the medium and shall provide an estimated repair time as soon as practical kansas state university shall take whatever steps are necessary to immediately repair or replace the medium whenever necessary to insure its continued operation should kansas state university decide to discontinue its own use of the medium the medium shall revert to the ownership of the city if the city so desires  9995 indemnity and hold harmless kansas state university shall hold and save the city its officers employees agents and authorized contractors on public improvements harmless from and against all claims damages expense liability and costs including attorney fees which may be occasioned by kansas state university in any manner solely or in part by kansas state universitys occupancy of rightofway except to the extent otherwise specified in section 5101h in the event a claim shall be made or an action shall be instituted against the city growing out of such occupancy of the rightofway by facilities of kansas state university then upon notice by the city to kansas state university kansas state university will assume liability for the defense of such actions at the cost of kansas state university subject to the option of the city to appear and defend at its own costs any such case  9995 payments and charges the payments herein provided shall be in lieu of all other licenses taxes charges fees or impositions except that the usual general property taxes and special ad valorem property taxes permits and fees including charges for pavement cuts or other charges based on restoring premises to their same condition or charges outside the scope of this article which are not in any way connected with telecommunication business as such will be imposed on kansas state university and are not covered by the payments herein  9995 compensation to city kansas state university shall pay to the city as compensation for the right and privilege granted in this article the amount of $500000 effective the date of this  9995 forfeiture of grant and privilege in case of failure on the part of kansas state university its successors and assigns to comply with any of the provisions of this article or if kansas state university its successors and assigns should do or cause to be done any act or thing prohibited by or in violation of the terms of this article kansas state university its successors and assigns shall forfeit all rights and privileges granted by this article and all rights hereunder shall cease terminate and become null and void provided that said forfeiture shall not take effect until the city shall carry out the following proceedings before the city proceeds to forfeit said article as in this section prescribed it shall first serve a written notice upon kansas state university setting forth in detail in such notice the neglect or failure complained of and kansas state university shall have 90 days thereafter in which to comply with the conditions of this grant and privilege if at the end of such 90day period the city deems that the conditions have not been complied with and that the article is subject to cancellation by reason thereof the city shall enact a repealing ordinance setting out the grounds upon which said grant and privilege is to be cancelled or terminated if within 30 days after the effective date of said repealing ordinance kansas state university shall not have instituted an action either in the district court of riley county kansas or some other court of competent jurisdiction to determine whether or not kansas state university has violated the terms of this article and that the article is subject to cancellation by reason thereof this article shall be cancelled and terminated at the end of such 30day period if within such 30day period kansas state university does institute an action as above provided to determine whether or not kansas state university has violated the terms of this article and that the article is subject to cancellation by reason thereof and prosecutes such action to final judgment with due diligence then in that event in case the court finds that the article is subject to cancellation by reason of the violation of its terms this article shall terminate 30 days after such final judgment is rendered provided however that the failure of kansas state university to comply with any of the provisions of this article or the doing or causing to be done by kansas state university of anything prohibited by or in violation of the terms of this article shall not be a ground for the forfeiture thereof when such act or omission on the part of kansas state university is due to any cause or delay beyond the control of kansas state university its successors and assigns or to bona fide legal proceedings  9995 rights and duties of grantee upon expiration of ordinance upon expiration of this article whether by lapse of time by agreement between kansas state university and the city or by forfeiture thereof kansas state university shall have the right to remove from public property any and all of its facilities used in its said business within a reasonable time after such expiration but in such event it shall be the duty of kansas state university immediately upon such removal to restore the rightofway from which said facilities are removed to as good condition as the same were before said removal was effected  9995 terms and termination date this article shall be and remain in full force and effect for a period of ten years from the effective date hereof unless sooner terminated as herein provided kansas state university is granted the option to renew the rights granted in this ordinance for one additional ten year term subject to the renegotiation of the provisions of this ordinance except for the compensation provided for in section 15105 kansas state university shall not be obligated to pay any additional compensation for any extension under this section kansas state university shall give notice of the exercise of the option at least nine months prior to the expiration of the term the renewal is subject to the provision of section 15113  9995 right to assign the rights granted by this article inure to the benefit of kansas state university such rights shall not be assignable without the expressed written consent of the governing body of the city except that kansas state university may contract with others to install or maintain such cable on behalf of kansas state university any required consent is to be evidenced by an ordinance or resolution of the governing body of the city that fully recites the terms and conditions if any upon which consent is given  9995 participation in utility location kansas state university agrees to participate in the one call damage prevention system serving the area where it has or will have facilities installed the system is presently known as kansas one call  9995 force majeure each and every provision hereof shall be subject to acts of god fires strikes riots floods war and other causes beyond kansas state universitys control  9995 invalidity if any clause sentence or section of this article shall be held to be invalid it shall not affect the remaining provisions of this article  9995 effectiveness and acceptance this ordinance shall not take effect or become in force until it shall have been read in full at three regular meetings of the governing body of the city nor until and immediately after its final passage it shall be published in the official city paper once each week for three consecutive weeks and such ordinance shall not take effect or be in force until and after the expiration of 60 days from the date of its final passage nor if pending the final passage and taking effect of said ordinance an election shall be called as provided by law in which event said ordinance shall not take effect or become in force until the same shall have been duly approved by the electorate within 60 days after the final passage and approval of this ordinance kansas state university shall file with the city clerk of the city of manhattan its acceptance in writing of the provisions terms and conditions of this ordinance which acceptance shall be duly acknowledged before some officer authorized by law to administer oaths  and when so accepted the ordinance and acceptance shall constitute a contract between the city and kansas state university subject to the provisions of the laws of the state of kansas  9995 secs 15114 15115  reserved rightofway permit footnotes  6  editors note  adopted  added provisions designated as art vii  1510015106  inasmuch there already exists an art vii  1510015113 the editor has redesignated the provisions of  as a new art viii  1511615122 and retained the originally assigned section numbers as part of the history note right to apply for permit any person other than public utilities which are eligible to obtain a franchise from the city desiring to place within any street alley or other public rightofway within the city any cable pipe conduit transmission line wire or any other such similar device or structure may apply to the city for a permit for such purpose as set forth in this article 15100 5796 permit application the application for a permit under this article shall be submitted to the city clerk along with a fee of $25000 such application shall be on a form provided by the city containing as a minimum the following information a the name and address of the person making the application b the nature of the device or structure proposed to be placed within the public rightofway c all proposed public rightsofway within which such devices or structures are to be located d the location ownership and use of any and all properties that are to be served by or connected to the device or structure e such additional information as shall be reasonably requested by the city manager or his designee such as construction drawings andor specifications 15101 5796 issuance of permit  requirements the city manager or his designee may issue a permit for the purposes set forth in this article if the city manager or his designee finds that such use of the public rightofway will not be detrimental to the public use of such rightofway and if the following requirements are met a the applicant has executed a document which indemnifies and holds the city harmless from any and all loss damages claims demands actions causes of action costs and expenses of whatever nature which may result from injury to or death of persons or from loss of or damage to property including damage to the devices or structures owned by the applicant when such injury death loss or damage is due to or arises in connection with or as a result of the use of the public rightofway by the applicant regardless of any negligence of the city  b the applicant has executed a document which obligates the applicant to remove or relocate the structures or devices at the sole cost of the applicant if such removal or relocation is necessitated by a valid public purpose as determined by the city  c the applicant has executed a document which provides that the devices and structures will only be used by the applicant to serve the locations provided in the application and that the applicant will not allow any third party to connect to such structures or devices  and d the applicant has agreed to participate in the one call damage prevention system serving the area where it has or will have facilities installed for the duration of the permit 15102 5796 obligation to maintain the installation maintenance and repair of any structure or device authorized by this article shall be at the sole cost and expense of the applicant and shall be accomplished pursuant to all applicable codes and ordinances and shall also be accomplished pursuant to such other reasonable requirements as established by the city manager or his designee 15103 5796 nontransferable any permit issued under this article shall be valid only to the person to whom it is issued and shall not be deemed to run with any tract of real estate such permit may not be transferred or assigned without the written consent of the city once the permit is delivered the applicant shall not be released from the requirements of such permit nor from the requirements of this article except in writing from the city 15104 5796 revocation any violation of the terms or conditions of the permit shall be grounds for its revocation the city manager or his designee may revoke a permit based upon such grounds upon 30 days written notice to the holder of such permit 15105 5796 appeal any person denied a permit hereunder or whose permit has been revoked may appeal such decision to the governing body by filing a written notice of such appeal with the city clerk within ten days of the notice denying or revoking such permit 15106 5796 secs 1512315129  reserved occupation tax for providers of telecommunications services footnotes  7  editors note of adopted  added a new art vii  1510015107 inasmuch as there already exists an art vii said provisions have been redesignated art ix  1513015137 definitions access lines shall mean and be limited to retail billed and collected residential lines  business lines  isdn lines  pbx trunks and simulated exchange access lines provided by a central office based switching arrangement where all stations served by such simulated exchange access lines are used by a single customer of the provider of such arrangement access line may not be construed to include interoffice transport or other transmission media that do not terminate at an end user customers premises or to permit duplicate or multiple assessment of access line rates on the provision of a single service or on the multiple communications paths derived from a billed and collected access line access line shall not include the following wireless telecommunications services the sale or lease of unbundled loop facilities special access services lines providing only data services without voice services processed by a telecommunications local exchange service provider or private line service arrangements franchise shall mean a current franchise granted by the city of manhattan for any telecommunications services under the procedures and provisions of ksa 122001 et seq as amended local exchange service means local switched telecommunications service within any local exchange service area approved by the state corporation commission regardless of the medium by which the local telecommunications service is provided the term local exchange service shall not include wireless communication services provider means a local exchange carrier as defined in ksa 661187h and amendments thereto or a telecommunications carrier as defined in ksa 661187m and amendments thereto telecommunications local exchange service provider means a local exchange carrier as defined in ksa 661187h and amendments thereto and a telecommunications carrier as defined in ksa 661187m and amendments thereto which does or in good faith intends to provide local exchange service the term telecommunications local exchange service provider does not include an interexchange carrier that does not provide local exchange service competitive access provider that does not provide local exchange service or any wireless telecommunications local exchange service provider telecommunications service means providing the means of transmission between or among points specified by the user of information of the users choosing without change in the form or content of the information as sent and received  3497   111803 telecommunications service occupations tax there is hereby imposed an occupation tax on the privilege of engaging in the business of furnishing local exchange services this tax is levied upon providers in the amount of $120 per month for each access line served by the provider for local telecommunication service within the city of manhattan the occupation tax shall be paid to the city by the provider based upon the number of access lines served on the last day of the month for which the occupation tax is imposed  3497   111803 payment and reporting a each provider that is obligated to pay the occupation tax imposed hereunder shall report the amount of access lines served and such other information deemed necessary by the city treasurer on forms to be established and furnished by the city treasurer the provider shall pay the occupation tax due on a monthly basis within 30 days of the last day of the month for which the occupation tax is imposed the governing body shall be authorized to adopt by resolution rules and regulations deemed necessary from time to time to account for and collect the occupation tax b for each and every month or any part thereof that the tax provided for by this article remains unpaid after the same becomes due and payable by the provider there shall be added to such tax as a late charge the sum of one and onehalf percent per month  3497 credit for franchise payments a a provider who is operating under a franchise shall receive credit on the occupation tax due to be paid hereunder to the extent that such payment would be duplicative of payments such provider is making under its franchise b any provider that makes payment to the holder of a franchise in a monthly sum equal to or greater than the occupation tax imposed by this article shall receive a credit on the occupation tax due to be paid hereunder provided that the holder of franchise remits such payment to the city pursuant to its obligations under the franchise  3497 franchise rights not waived nothing in this article shall be construed to preclude the city from requiring a franchise from any person firm partnership corporation or entity who uses the streets and rightofway of the city for the purpose of constructing and operating a telecommunications system any tax payment received by the city under this article shall not be deemed to waive or diminish the citys rights under ksa 122001 et seq  3497 violations it shall be unlawful for a provider to fail or refuse to pay the occupation tax imposed by this article in addition it shall be unlawful for a provider to engage in the business of furnishing telecommunications service within the city during the times that the occupation tax is unpaid and past due  3497 penalties any person who violates any of the provisions of this article shall upon conviction be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished by a fine not exceeding $250000 each and every day of operation in violation of the article shall constitute a separate offense  3497 savings clause if any clause sentence or section of this article shall be held to be invalid it shall not affect the remaining provisions of this article  3497 secs 1513815149  reserved kansas state university cable television system footnotes  8  editors note of adopted dec 18 200 amended the adding art x to ch 15 inasmuch as there already exists an art x and the provisions of are similar the editor has treated said ordinance as superseding art x  1515015162 which derived from adopted dec 17 2002 rights granted kansas state university is hereby granted the right to construct maintain and operate a cable television system in along the public rightsofway of the city of manhattan kansas such right shall be for the sole purpose of supplying cable television service to facilities owned and operated by kansas state university the phrase cable television service shall exclude other telecommunication services including but not limited to telephone and open video systems notwithstanding the fact that this franchise is related to the providing of cable television service the city hereby declares that kansas state university is not a cable grantee as that term is used in the communications act of 1934 and the telecommunications act of 196 and that neither of such acts are applicable to the services provided under this article  121807 term of franchise the
