reserved urban area planning board footnotes  2  cross reference administration ch 2  boards agencies and commissions  2191 et seq state law reference joint cooperation in area planning ksa 12716 et seq creation  agreement between county and city pursuant to ksa 12744 the city does hereby adopt approve and make effective the agreement dated the sixth day of february 200 set forth hereinafter between riley county and the city of manhattan related to joint cooperation in area planning and zoning an original of such agreement along with exhibit a attached thereto after it has been signed by all parties and has been approved by the attorney general shall be placed on file with the city clerk the body of such agreement reads as follows agreement between the city of manhattan kansas and riley county kansas relating to joint cooperation in planning and zoning this agreement is hereby entered into pursuant to ksa 12744 this 6th day of february 200 by and between the city of manhattan kansas a municipal corporation hereinafter sometimes referred to as the city  and the board of county commissioners of riley county kansas hereinafter sometimes referred to as the county whereas the city and the county have previously entered into an agreement the original agreement pursuant to ksa 12716 which was effective on   and whereas the original agreement created a joint planning commission the manhattan urban area planning board hereinafter sometimes referred to as muapb to exercise planning functions both within the corporate limits of the city and within a designated area outside the city but within riley county  and whereas the original agreement was amended by the parties several different times including on  to modify the designated area outside the city  and whereas the original agreement was again amended by the parties in 1981 to provide for a different method of appointing members of muapb  and whereas the city and the county have adopted the original agreement and the amendments thereto by ordinance and resolution respectively  and whereas the kansas legislature has repealed ksa 12716 and replaced it with ksa 12744 which now provides the authority for cities and counties to cooperate by written agreement in the exercise and performance of planning powers duties and functions and to establish a joint planning commission  and whereas the parties hereto desire to amend and replace in their entirety the original agreement and the amendments thereto now therefore in consideration of the mutual promises contained herein the parties hereto agree as follows  that the original agreement and all amendments thereto are hereby amended and replaced in their entirety by the provisions set forth hereinafter  the city and the county hereby agree to cooperate in the exercise and performance of planning powers duties and functions within the urban area all as more specifically set forth hereinafter  that the joint planning commission known as the muapb as created by the original agreement and amendments thereto is hereby continued as more specifically set forth hereinafter the muapb shall consist of seven 7 members with three 3 being appointed by the city pursuant to its own adopted procedure governing the appointment of members to its boards and three 3 being appointed by the county pursuant to its adopted procedures governing the appointment of members to its boards and one 1 being alternately appointed by the county and the city again pursuant to the procedures of the appointing body the members of the muapb shall be appointed for three 3 year terms and the members previously appointed pursuant to the original agreement shall continue to serve and their term shall expire at the same time as it would have expired under their original appointment the alternating appointment between the city and the county shall continue in the same order as it was previously established under the original agreement the members of the muapb while appointed for a term for the convenience of the jurisdiction appointing them shall serve in that term at the pleasure of the governing body of the jurisdiction appointing them in order to qualify for service as a member of the muapb a person must reside within the area of the jurisdiction of the muapb  the muapb is hereby empowered to carry into effect the provisions of kansas law delegated to planning commissions all as set forth in ksa 12741 et seq pertaining to matters within the corporate limits of the city of manhattan kansas and also pertaining to matters within the urban area for the purposes of this agreement the urban area shall consist of an area lying outside the corporate limits of the city of manhattan but within riley county the boundaries of which shall be specifically agreed to in writing by the governing bodies of the city of manhattan and riley county at the outset of this agreement and until modified by written agreement of the parties the boundaries of the urban area are set forth on exhibit a attached hereto the parties hereto agree to review and modify if necessary such boundaries on an annual basis or more frequently when events occur that cause the administrative staffs of either or both governing bodies to recommend such review andor modification  a the parties hereto agree to cooperate with each other and with the muapb in the creation of a single comprehensive plan for the city and surrounding urban area that is consistent with the citys growth policies and plans b the parties further agree to cooperate with each other and the muapb in the creation and maintenance of subdivision regulations that are consistent for both the urban area and the city of manhattan c any comprehensive plan created pursuant to this agreement shall not be effective until it has been adopted by the muapb pursuant to ksa 12747 and approved by the governing body of the city and the board of the riley county commissioners also pursuant to ksa 12747  in addition to those duties proscribed by ksa 12741 et seq the muapb shall continually when time and priorities permit make specific recommendations to the governing bodies regarding any matters that might facilitate cooperation between the parties in the providing of governmental services within the urban area such matters include by way of example but are not limited to the following a the adoption of codes relating to minimum standards of housing building electrical work plumbing work and other related areas b the staffing for administration inspection and enforcement of all of such codes as well as subdivision regulations and zoning regulations within the boards jurisdiction c the division of cost between the city and the county related to such cooperation  until such time as plans or regulations provided for herein or recommendations by the muapb are adopted by the city and the county the separate regulations of the city shall apply within the corporate limits of the city and the separate regulations of the county shall apply in the unincorporated area further until the city and the county have adopted joint regulations which provide otherwise the city and the county shall continue to have separate administrative staffs and personnel for administration inspection and enforcement  however these separate staffs are directed to work diligently and cooperatively in connection with the efforts of the muapb and in furtherance of the purposes of this agreement  the duration of this agreement is perpetual unless terminated on january 1 of any given year by either the city or the county the party desiring termination shall provide written notice to the other party on or before march 1 of the year preceding the effective date of termination  the parties agree to adopt this agreement by official action of their governing bodies pursuant to law   res no 102180d 11480   appointed to function as municipal airport zoning commission pursuant to ksa 37052 the governing body appoints the urban area planning board to be the municipal airport zoning commission and to carry out the functions and duties of the same as set out in ksa 3701 et seq  9473 cross reference aviation generally ch 7 secs 26182628  reserved big lakes regional planning commission footnotes  3  cross reference administration ch 2  boards agencies and commissions  2191 et seq state law reference joint cooperation in area planning ksa 12716 et seq participation  agreement the city pursuant to ksa 12716 et seq as amended does elect to participate in the expanded big lakes regional commission the city does approve and adopt by reference the bylaws of the big lakes regional planning commission which read as follows big lakes regional council bylaws as amended january 1979 providing for the establishment operation power duties jurisdiction and the sharing of the expenses of operation of the big lakes regional council whereas the board of county commissioners of counties with adjoining jurisdictions in an area defined as the big lakes region together with cities in the region recognize the need for unified development and coordination of programs affecting the area these bylaws are formulated to establish the big lakes regional council of local governments the purpose of the council shall include but not be limited to the coordination of community improvement and development programs the identification and elimination of planning duplication the promotion of economy and efficiency in the development of the region and the support of programs to improve the general welfare and prosperity of the people in the region programs and policies will be developed to reflect the trends and needs of the physical social economic and governmental conditions in the region the big lakes regional council of local governments shall assist in the development and implementation of programs and shall serve in an advisory capacity to all governmental units in the region be it resolved by the board of county commissioners of member counties to establish the big lakes regional council of local governments in accordance with the following articles article i name name the name of the association shall be the big lakes regional council of local governments article ii membership and directors membership membership in the council will be limited to governmental jurisdictions within counties whose board of county commissioners adopt these bylaws by ordinance and contribute to the budget of council in accordance with provisions in each governmental jurisdiction within the boundaries of contributing counties is considered a member of the council and entitled to participate in programs and services provided by the regional council membership requests any county commission having adjoining jurisdiction with any member county of the big lakes regional council may petition the council for active membership new members will be accepted upon majority vote by the council and upon signifying their acceptance of the terms of the bylaws and other memorandum or agreements adopted by the council board of directors the board of county commissioners from member counties in the big lakes regional council shall appoint three members to the board of directors to the big lakes regional council based on the following selection procedures a a member of the board of county commissioners from each member county shall be designated as a member of the board of directors of the big lakes regional council b the board of county commissioners of member counties shall appoint two residents of their county to serve as atlarge members of the board of directors of the council who shall serve as representatives of local units of government within the county c appointments to the board of directors shall be for twoyear terms terms shall be staggered to assure a continuity of membership on the board of directors and on the executive committee of the council appointments of less than two years shall be made to fill unexpired terms on the board of directors or to make adjustments as determined necessary by the board of directors executive committee an executive committee shall be established the executive committee shall include one representative from each member county designated by the respective board of county commissioners and the elected chairperson of the council executive committee members shall be members of the board of directors of the big lakes regional council of local governments committee responsibilities shall include the development of recommendations of policies and programs of the council and on other matters as directed by the board of directors ex officio members elected or appointed representatives of federal state or local governmental entities or representatives of other public or private organizations or agencies may be appointed to serve as ex officio nonvoting members of the council the appointments of ex officio members on the council shall be determined by the voting members of the board of directors of the big lakes regional council compensation board of director members of the council shall serve without compensation removal or suspension officers of the council shall not be removed or suspended from office except for cause and after a hearing held before the council board of directors the removal or suspension of a member of the board of directors shall be the exclusive jurisdiction of the board of county commissioners by whom the member was appointed article iii officers council officers the board of directors of the council shall elect from its membership a chairperson and a vicechairperson a secretarytreasurer for the council shall also be elected who need not be a member of the council a officers of the council shall be elected at the annual meeting of the council which shall be held in january of each year elected officers shall assume office on the first day of february and shall serve a term of 12 calendar months b unscheduled vacancies in an office of the council shall be filled for the unexpired term by special election at the first regular meeting of the council following receipt of notification of the vacancy responsibilities and duties the responsibilities and duties of officers shall be those normally pertaining to their office and shall include but not be limited to the following a chairpersonthe chairperson shall preside at all meetings of the council and the executive committee the chairperson shall be the designated officer authorized to sign contracts agreements and other documents on behalf of the big lakes regional council the chairperson shall appoint with approval of the council and the director of the cooperative extension service at kansas state university an executive director to the council b vicechairpersonthe vicechairperson shall perform all duties of the chairperson in the absence or incapacity of the chairperson and perform other functions determined necessary for the normal conduct of the councils program c secretarytreasurerthe secretarytreasurer shall be responsible for maintenance of a record of proceedings and financial affairs of the council responsibility for the daytoday duties of the secretarytreasurer may be delegated to the executive director of the council article iv meetings and quorums meetings the big lakes regional council shall hold a minimum of ten regular meetings during each calendar year meetings shall generally be scheduled for a specific day during a specific week of the month at a time and place designated by the council or its chairperson the meeting in january of each year shall be the annual meeting of the council a special meetings of the council may be called by the chairperson or upon request from a majority of the members of the board of directors of the council b special meetings shall require a minimum of seventytwo 72 hour notice to each member of the council unless the required notice is waived in writing by a majority of the board of directors of the council c the maximum period of time between meetings of the council shall not exceed sixtyfive 65 calendar days quorum a quorum shall be required to conduct the formal business of the council a quorum shall be defined as a majority of the board of directors officially appointed and serving as a member of the big lakes regional council article v annual budget and sharing costs budget the big lakes regional council shall adopt annually a budget for its operation this budget will be submitted to the board of county commissioners of member counties on or about june 1 of each year such annual budget is to be for the fiscal year commencing january 1 subsequent to the adoption thereof the annual budget so prepared by the council shall be subject to approval by the board of county commissioners of member counties of the council thereafter and upon such approval each of said public bodies shall appropriate funds to implement said budget proration of budget the local cost of operating the program of the big lakes regional council of local governments shall be allocated among its member county governments by a mill levy to be determined in the annual budget on the assessed valuation of each county transfer of funds upon approval of the annual budget by the county commissioners of each member county the treasurer of each member county shall be directed to make payment to the depository of the big lakes regional council the initial payment for each budget year shall be made prior to february 1 of each year article vi functions duties and powers legislative authority the big lakes regional council of local governments shall have all the functions duties and powers as provided in ksa to 12721 inclusive as amended and as provided in ksa et seq duties and functions duties and functions of the council shall include a the gathering and assimilation of economic technical and social information b providing educational assistance in identifying problems determining priorities setting goals and solving problems c identifying and organizing resources to meet the needs of people d providing assistance to community leaders in the development and improvement of their leadership ability the council shall use educational programs in community and resource development as a source of information and as a demonstration of application of the decision making process fiscal responsibilities the fiscal responsibilities and functions pertaining to the council shall include a authority to approve expenditures by voucher or check executed by designated officers or employees of the council from appropriated funds b designation of a depository or depositories for the total budget of the council proposed changes in the depository for the operating budget of the council shall be considered by the council at the regular meeting immediately preceding the beginning of a new fiscal year and a depository change shall be effective with the beginning of the fiscal year the depository or depositories for federal grants special programs or special purposes with definite termination dates shall be designated for the complete term of the grant special program or special purposes c authority to accept receive and expend funds grants and services from the united states government or its agencies and from instrumentalities of state and local governments d authority to accept receive and expend funds grants and services from private persons or organizations including business or nonprofit organizations e development and approval of rules of fiscal management necessary for proper reporting of receipt and expenditure of public and private funds article vii termination of council termination the termination of the big lakes regional council of local governments shall require a vote of threefourths of the voting members of the council the termination of the big lakes regional council shall become effective 90 days following such a vote to allow adequate time for transfer of responsibilities and pertinent data to the proper agencies and for preparation of reports and materials for final consideration the termination shall be effected in the following manner a all equipment and property of the big lakes regional council shall be sold at auction and proceeds deposited in the depository of the big lakes regional council b balances in the account or accounts of the big lakes regional council after payment of all bills and obligations including the proceeds from the sale of equipment and other property shall be distributed by check to the county treasurer of all contributing counties in the year of the termination vote the amount of this distribution will be established by the percentage of the local contribution provided by each county during the year of the termination vote article viii amendments amendments amendments to these bylaws shall be approved by twothirds vote of the board of directors of the council written notice shall be given of proposed bylaw amendments to all members by depositing such notice in the us postal service at least ten days prior to its consideration by the council following completion of required public notice of proposed changes article ix use of funds use of funds funds shall not be used to the benefit of or be distributable to its members trustees officers or other private persons except that the council shall be authorized and empowered to pay reasonable compensation for services rendered and to make payments and distributions in furtherance of the purposes established by the council the council shall not participate in or intervene in including the publishing or distribution of statements any political campaign on behalf of any candidate for public office notwithstanding any other provision of these articles the council shall not carry on any other activities not permitted to be carried on a by the council exempt from federal income tax under c3 of the internal revenue or the corresponding provision of any future united states internal revenue law or b by a council contributions to which are deductible under c2 of the internal revenue or the corresponding provision of any future united states internal revenue law article x rules and policies rules and policies the council shall adopt other rules and policies as determined necessary by the board of directors including rules for the transaction of council business rules and policies shall be adopted for functions including but not limited to a membership b officers c meetings and voting d staff and budget e sharing of costs f agreements with the cooperative extension service at kansas state university and other cooperating agencies article xii effective date separability if these bylaws or any part thereof shall be held or determined to be unconstitutional illegal ultravires or void the same shall not be held or construed to change or annul any provision hereof which may be legal or lawful  and in the event these bylaws or any part thereof shall be held unconstitutional illegal ultravires or void the same shall not affect any action heretofore taken by the big lakes regional council of local governments heretofore established and constituted article xii effective date effective date the bylaws of the big lakes regional council of local governments shall become effective following approval by a twothirds vote of the voting members of the board of directors of the council and adoption by the board of county commissioners of each member county contributing to the budget of the big lakes regional council of local governments  police footnotes  1  cross reference administration ch 2  offenses ch 22  traffic and motor vehicles ch 31 in general secs 2712715  reserved merchant guard or merchant patrol division 1  generally definitions the following words and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings respectively ascribed to them agents and employees shall mean all persons employed by a merchant guard or merchant patrol in the conduct of his business except stenographic and clerical employees whose duties are confined entirely to stenographic and clerical duties in the business office of the merchant guard or merchant patrol or other employees not directly engaged in providing protection or preserving the peace merchant guard or merchant patrol shall mean any person who conducts or is engaged in the business of providing protection or preserving the peace of the property of another for a fee property shall mean either personal or real property and shall include property used for commercial residential or industrial purposes providing protection and preserving the peace shall mean any service designed and intended to prevent the injury or damage to or commission of a crime upon the property of another and shall include the routine surveillance of such property for that purpose  7577   21886 cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq uniforms uniforms shall be worn by agents or employees of merchant guards or merchant patrols while employed within the city and will be of a color different and distinctive from that worn by officers of the riley county police department  7577 vehicles the vehicles used in the conduct of the merchant guard or merchant patrol business within the city by any licensee shall be of a color different from that of the vehicles of the riley county police department and the fire department  once determined the color shall not be changed except by mutual agreement between the director and the business licensee in addition such vehicles shall not be equipped with any rotating roof lights or siren nor shall any insignias be painted on the sides thereof which are similar to or which could be confused with that painted on the sides of the vehicles of the police department and the fire department  7577 state law reference merchant or security police licensed by municipality must have state licensed vehicles ksa 121679 use of flashing blinking or rotating lights or sirens prohibited the licensee shall not operate or permit the operation of any flashing blinking or rotating lights on its vehicles other than as may be permitted under the standard traffic adopted by the city sirens of any type shall not be used or permitted to be used on the licensees vehicles  7577 use of words police officer prohibited the words police officer shall not be used in any advertising or upon the premises within the limits of the city occupied by the merchant guard or merchant patrol nor on any of its vehicles or equipment  7577 firearms agent or employee licensees may have the right to carry firearms only after completion of a firearm proficiency program under the direction and control of the riley county police department and the certification by the director or his designee that the licensee has completed the program and has demonstrated his proficiency in the use and safety of a firearm the authority to carry a firearm will be extended only while the licensee is performing the required duties of his employment and while in route to or from his place of business the right to carry a firearm may be suspended or revoked by the director if the right has been abused such decision by the director shall be effective immediately provided however that appeal from the decision may be made to the governing body  7577 change in personnel a whenever an agent or employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol is discharged for any reason his employer shall immediately notify the city clerk of such fact the city clerk shall forward a copy of the notification to the director of the riley county police department the employer shall notify the police department of the reasons for dismissal  such information shall be confidential b when an agent or employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol is dismissed he shall forthwith surrender the identification card to the director of the riley county police department if the person surrendering the identification card is reemployed during the remainder of the year the identification card may be reissued to him without change  7577 changing place of business or vehicle a any licensee changing place of business or abode shall immediately notify the city clerk of such fact together with the address of the new place of business or abode  provided however that if a licensee changes his place of abode this shall not be deemed to be a transfer of license or require the payment of any additional fees the city clerk shall forward a copy of the notification to the director of the riley county police department b whenever a new vehicle is acquired by a licensee for use in the conduct of his business the type and description of the vehicle shall be immediately reported to the city clerk who shall forward a copy to the director of the riley county police department  7577 unlawful acts it shall be unlawful for any licensee under this article to 1 hinder or interfere with any investigation under the jurisdiction of the riley county police department  2 fail to report immediately to the riley county police department violations of city state or federal laws which constitute felonies or breach of the peace coming to his attention  3 draw or fire a firearm in the performance of his duties except when necessary to protect himself from great bodily harm or to prevent the commission of a felony involving force or violence  4 fail to notify the riley county police department of any arrests and to fail to turn such person over to the riley county police department  provided the licensee upon refusal of the riley county police department to take custody of the subject may turn the individual over to any competent law enforcement agency  5 represent himself to be an officer of the riley county police department  6 willfully suppress facts that pertain to any violation of city state or federal laws under investigation by the riley county police department  7577 secs 27252730  reserved division 2  license footnotes  2  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 required a it shall be unlawful for any person to engage in or conduct a merchant guard or merchant patrol business without obtaining a license as provided in this division b it shall be unlawful for any merchant guard or merchant patrol to employ any agent or employee unless the person to be employed has obtained a license as provided in this division c it shall be unlawful for any person to accept employment as an agent or employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol without obtaining a license as provided in this division  7577 application a applicants for a license as a merchant guard or merchant patrol or agent or employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol shall file an application with the city clerk on forms to be provided by him for that purpose and shall contain the following 1 if an applicant for a license as a merchant guard or merchant patrol the applicants name address and social security number  a description of the nature and type of business to be conducted  the services to be offered and the area expected to be covered in the conduct of the business  a statement as to the number of persons to be employed as agents or employees  a statement as to the number and type of vehicles to be used in conduct of the business and a description thereof  a description of all weapons registered to that applicant 2 if an applicant for a permanent license as an agent or an employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol the applicants name address and social security number  the name of the person by whom the applicant is employed b each applicant as designated in subsection a also shall file with his application 1 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has been convicted of any felony misdemeanor or ordinance violation the nature of the offense the penalty or punishment imposed and the date and place where such offense occurred  2 a statement as to whether or not the applicant has ever had a judgement or conviction for fraud deceit or misrepresentation entered against him and if so the details thereof  3 a statement as to the business or employment record of the applicant for the five years immediately preceding the date of application  4 three letters certifying to the good character and business responsibility of the applicant c the director is hereby instructed to prepare appropriate application forms to be supplied to the city clerk at the citys expense  4 7 7577 fee the fee for a license under this division shall be as prescribed in section 1937  7577 investigation upon receipt of the application fee under this division the city clerk shall direct the applicant to complete the forms given to him the applicant shall return the completed original forms to the city clerk who shall forward the original and a copy of the completed documents to the office of the director of the riley county police department who shall within 21 days investigate the applicants qualifications and forward to the city clerk the original documents and a statement of his recommendation of approval or disapproval of the application the director shall accompany any application which he disapproves with a summary of all reasons why the application should be disapproved the original statements of approval or disapproval of the director as well as any summaries of reasons for disapproval shall be maintained in the original by the city clerk  7 7577 mandatory causes for denial no license shall be issued under this division to any of the following persons 1 any person under 18 years of age  2 any person whose character and reputation and record of sobriety is not satisfactory to the governing body  3 any person convicted of a felony misdemeanor or violation of a municipal ordinance pertaining to moral turpitude within ten years immediately preceding the date of application  or in the case of a corporation if any officer director or principal stockholder has been convicted as above  4 any person against whom a judgment or conviction for fraud deceit or misrepresentation has been entered within ten years immediately preceding the date of application  5 any person who has a record of drug addiction or a record of violent acts against persons or property within ten years immediately preceding the date of application  provided this section shall not apply to violent acts against persons or property while the applicant was under the age of 18  7577 insurance prerequisite to issuance all merchant guard or merchant patrol business licensees shall carry insurance for the purpose of indemnifying third persons for bodily injury in amounts not less than $10000000 for each bodily injury and $30000000 aggregate limit  and further to indemnify third persons for any damage to property as the result of the action of the merchant guard or merchant patrol agent or employee in an amount of not less than $10000000 per claimant and $30000000 aggregate limit the insurance shall be with companies licensed to do business in the state it shall be the business licensees responsibility to determine that its insurance carrier has notified the city clerk of any lapse or cancellation in coverage within ten days of notification to the insured  7577 bond prerequisite to issuance all merchant guard or merchant patrol business licensees shall file with the city clerk a surety bond issued by a corporation authorized to do business in the state in the sum of $1000000 running to any and all employers of the principal of the bond conditioned that the principal of the bond shall well and faithfully perform the services he engaged to perform action on the bond may be brought by any employer of the principal in the bond such bond shall be approved as to form and surety by the city attorney  7577 issuance the city clerk shall issue a license under this division for persons employed by a merchant guard or merchant patrol upon approval of the application by the director the city clerk shall issue a license under this division for any persons engaged in the business of providing merchant guards or merchant patrols upon approval of the application by the governing body and the filing of insurance as provided in this division the director upon display of a license duly executed by the city clerk shall issue the identification card as provided in this division  7577   2283 in addition to other permits this article is intended to be in addition to all other permits licenses or other law enforcement authority vested in persons by the state county or city and it shall not be a defense to the failure to secure a license to protect or preserve the peace of one or more establishments that the person had such authority  7577 identification cards a in addition to the license issued under this division the director of the riley county police department shall issue an identification card to each licensee which shall be carried by the licensee at all times while on duty as a merchant guard the identification card shall be approximately two and onehalf inches by four inches and shall include the following information 1 the type of license and expiration date thereof  2 name address physical description and picture of the licensee  3 the name of the employer if the licensee is an agent or employee of a merchant guard or merchant patrol  4 the signature of the licensee and that of the director  5 a statement as to whether or not the licensee is authorized to carry a firearm  6 such other information as the director may deem advisable b the director of the riley county police department is hereby authorized to charge the sum of $300 per identification card to cover expenses of printing etc  7577 renewal the director of the riley county police department is authorized to prepare rules and regulations if necessary concerning the renewal of licenses under this division  the rules and regulations so prepared shall then be examined and adopted or adopted as amended by the governing body  7577 revocation or suspension the governing body shall have the authority to revoke or suspend any license granted pursuant to this division for violation of any federal or state statute city ordinances for falsification of application documents for violation of any of the provisions of this division or for any act committed by a licensee which is deemed by the governing body to make the licensee unfit to handle the responsibilities of such a license upon request suspension periods shall be for the maximum of 60 days in cases of revocation or suspension of the license of a merchant guard or merchant patrol business a hearing shall be held by the governing body and the licensee may present any evidence or be heard with respect to the allegations contained in the request for revocation  7577 secondhand goods footnotes  1  cross reference peddlers and solicitors ch 24  sales ch 28 articles i ii  reserved footnotes  2  editors note  adopted feb 21 198 repealed the substantive sections of ch 29 being  2916 2917 29262929 which pertained to junkyards and wrecking yards and the licensing thereof prior to repeal such sections had been derived from the 1973  and 10802 secs 2912940  reserved pawnbrokers footnotes  3  state law reference regulation of pawnbrokers ksa 16706 et seq division 1  generally defined as used in this article the word pawnbroker shall mean any person who loans money on deposit or pledge of personal property or valuable thing other than intangible personal property or a person that deals in the purchase of personal property on condition of selling the same back again at a stipulated price but such term shall not include any person operating under the supervision of the state banking commissioner credit union commissioner or the consumer credit commissioner of this state  cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq state law reference similar definition ksa 16706 loans secured by pledged goods a every loan made by a pawnbroker for which goods are received in pledge as security shall be evidenced by a written contract in ink a copy of which shall be furnished to the borrower the loan contract shall set forth the loan period which shall be one month the date on which the loan is due and payable and the charges and it shall clearly inform the borrower of his right to redeem the pledge during the redemption period of two months after due date except as otherwise provided herein the holder of any such contract shall be presumed to be the person entitled to redeem the pledge and the pawnbroker shall deliver the pledge to the person presenting the contract upon payment of the principal and charges b every pawnbroker shall retain in his possession after the date on which the loan became due and payable every article pledged to him for a redemption period of two months during such period the borrower may redeem the pledged articles upon payment of the principal and charges it shall be unlawful for any pawnbroker to sell or transfer title or possession of any pledged property until the expiration of such period of redemption c if any pledged article is not redeemed within such redemption period the pawnbroker shall become vested with all right title and interest of the pledgor or his assigns to such pledged article to hold and dispose of as his own property any other provision of law relating to the foreclosure and sale of pledges shall not be applicable to any pledge the title to which is transferred in accordance with this section  state law reference similar provisions ksa 16714 report of description of property received in pawn or purchased as secondhand merchandise every pawnbroker shall report to the director of the riley county police department the description of all property received in pawn or purchased as secondhand merchandise in whatever quantity received including property purchased as secondhand merchandise at wholesale secondhand merchandise taken in for sale or possessed on consignment for sale and secondhand merchandise taken in trade  provided that no such report need be made concerning property or merchandise acquired from another pawnbroker licensed in the state in a transaction involving the purchase or other acquisition from the other pawnbroker of his stock in trade or a substantial part thereof in bulk where the other pawnbroker has made the reports required by this section with respect to such property or merchandise state law reference similar provisions ksa 16715 record of transactions at the time of any transaction a pawnbroker shall enter in a pawnbroker kept by him for that purpose the date duration amount and charges of every loan made by him an accurate description of the property pledged and the name and residence address of the pledgor state law reference similar provisions ksa 16716 secured loans to minors prohibited no person shall receive in pawn or as security for any loan transfer service undertaking or advantage anything of value from any person under the age of 18 years  state law reference similar provisions ksa 16717 inspection and examination of premises and contents by law enforcement officers  search and seizure every pawnbroker and every person employed by a pawnbroker in the conduct of his business shall admit to any and every part of the premises designated in the license at any time any law enforcement officer of the city or county to examine any goods articles things pledges pawns books or other records on the premises and to search for and to take into possession any article known or believed by such officer to have been stolen such law enforcement officer may make any such search or seizure as is provided for in this section and property so seized shall be receipted for by such officer who shall adequately describe the seized property and sign the receipt state law reference similar provisions ksa 16718 interest and charges on pawnbroker transactions  applicability of other laws  maximum charges  terms of loans a no pawnbroker shall contract for charge or receive directly or indirectly on or in connection with any pawnbroker transaction any charges whether for interest storage insurance service fee handling compensation consideration or expense which in the aggregate are greater than the charges provided and authorized by this article any other provisions of law relating to interest storage and such charges shall not be applicable to any pawnbroker transaction made in accordance with this article b whenever any loan is made by a pawnbroker for which goods are received in pledge the following maximum amounts may be charged 1 on any amount a charge may be added in an amount not to exceed ten percent per month or 120 percent per annum of the amount advanced to the borrower  and 2 the maximum amount of a loan authorized by this article shall not exceed $30000 per transaction c the term of any loan made under the provisions of this article shall be one month loans may be extended or renewed by the payment of the charges herein provided monthly the charges authorized herein shall be deemed to be earned at the time the loan is made and shall not be subject to refund on loans under this article no insurance charges or any other charges of any nature whatsoever shall be permitted state law reference similar provisions ksa 16719 person selling personal property to give identification it shall be unlawful for any person selling or pledging personal property to a pawnshop hereunder to knowingly give a false or incorrect name or address further any person selling or pledging personal property to a pawnshop shall produce documentary evidence sufficient to identify such person before any owner or employee of such pawnshop may undertake to transact any business with such person sufficient documentary evidence for the purpose of this provision shall mean drivers license military identification card social security number or other documentary evidence of a comparable nature an owner or employee of a pawnshop may transact business with any person with whom they are personally acquainted without requiring the production of such documentary evidence  receipt of stolen property it shall be unlawful for any person owner or employee of a pawnshop to purchase take or receive any item of personal property from any person while knowing the same to have been stolen or having reason to believe that the item of personal property has been stolen it shall be the duty of such person to whom such personal property is offered to immediately advise the riley county police department of the city in order to facilitate a prompt investigation into the circumstances thereof it shall be unlawful for any person to sell or pledge any item of personal property to any pawnshop licensed hereunder if the personal property is subject to a financing statement which has been previously recorded with the register of deeds in any county of the state any sale or pledge of personal property subject to such mortgage indebtedness shall be null and void and the secured party named in said financing statement shall be entitled to immediate possession of the personal property involved the owner or employee of any pawnshop which has received personal property subject to such a valid financing statement shall forthwith return said personal property to the secured party named in the financing statement its successors or assigns  refusal to redeliver converted or stolen property received in pawn to rightful owner when converted or stolen property has been pawned and the pawnbroker refuses to redeliver such property to the rightful owner upon demand and presentation of a bill of sale or other proper indicia of ownership by the owner and legal action by the rightful owner to recover the property becomes necessary the court may assess the pawnbroker for reasonable attorneys fees incurred by the rightful owner if the court finds that the pawnbroker wrongfully withheld the converted or stolen property state law reference similar provisions ksa 16720 examination of books accounts and records each licensee shall keep and use in his business such books accounts and records as will enable the city to determine whether such licensee is complying with the provisions of this article and any such city or county may examine or cause to be examined the books accounts records and files used by any such licensee or by any other person engaged in the pawnbroking business irrespective of whether such person partnership or corporation shall act or claim to act as principal agent or broker or under or without authority of this article the duly designated representatives of the city shall have and be given free access to all such books accounts papers records files safes and vaults state law reference similar provisions ksa 16712 secs 29522960  reserved division 2  license footnotes  4  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 required it shall be unlawful for any person to establish or conduct the business of a pawnbroker unless the owner shall have first procured a license to conduct such business in the city in accord with this division  application a application for a license under this division shall be in writing and shall state the full name and place of residence of the applicant or if the applicant be a partnership of each member thereof or if a corporation or association of each officer shareholder or member thereof together with the address of the place or places where the business is to be conducted and the hours of the day and days of the week during which the applicant proposes to engage in the business of pawnbroking at each such place and such other information as may be necessary to determine the applicants qualifications for a license in accordance with the provisions of this division b each applicant also shall submit with his application 1 a statement that he is the holder of a valid registration certificate issued by the director of revenue pursuant to ksa 793608 for each place of business for which application for a license is made  and 2 a detailed inventory and description of all goods wares merchandise or other property held in pawn or for sale at the time of the application at each place of business stated therein indicating whether the same was received in pawn or purchased as secondhand merchandise the application shall be in a form approved by the attorney general  state law reference similar provisions ksa 16707 qualifications no license or any renewal thereof under this division shall be granted to 1 any person who is not a citizen of the united states  2 any person who has not been an actual resident of the state for at least two years immediately preceding the date of his application  3 any person who has been convicted of or has pleaded guilty to a felony under the laws of this state or any other state or of the united states or shall have forfeited his bond to appear in court to answer charges for any such offense within the ten years immediately prior to such persons application for a license  4 any person who has had his license revoked for cause under the provisions of this division  5 any person who is not at least 21 years of age  6 any person who at the time of application for renewal of any license issued hereunder would not be eligible for such license upon a first application  7 any person who does not own the premises for which a license is sought unless he has a written lease therefor for at least threefourths of the period for which the license is to be issued  8 any person whose spouse would be ineligible to receive a license hereunder for any reason other than the age citizenship and residence requirements  9 any partnership unless all of the partners shall be eligible to receive a license as an individual  and 10 a corporation if any officer manager director or stockholder would be ineligible to receive a license as an individual state law reference similar provisions ksa 16708 fee the fee for a license under this division shall be as prescribed in section 1939  transfer of stock by stockholder of corporate licensee a it shall be unlawful for any shareholder of a corporate licensee to transfer any stock in the corporation to any person who would be ineligible to receive a license as an individual and any such transfer shall be null and void  provided that if any such stockholder of a corporate licensee shall become deceased and his heirs or devisees to whom the stock descends by descent and distribution or by will shall be ineligible to receive a license hereunder then the legal representatives of the deceased stockholders estate his heirs and devisees shall have 14 months from the date of the death of the stockholder within which to sell the stock to a person eligible to receive a license hereunder with such sale to be made in accordance with the provisions of the state probate code and any amendments thereto if the legal representatives heirs and devisees shall fail refuse or neglect to so convey the stock within the time hereinbefore prescribed then the stock shall revert to and become the property of the corporation for which the corporation shall pay to the legal representatives heirs or devisees the book value of such stock if the stock in any corporation shall be the subject of any trust heretofore or hereafter created the trustee or trustees and the beneficiaries of each trustee and beneficiary of the trust who is 21 years of age or older must be a person who would be eligible to receive a license or the trustee shall be and he is hereby authorized and required within 14 months after the effective date of the trust to sell the stock to a person eligible to receive a license under this act and he shall hold and disburse the proceeds thereof in accordance with the terms of the trust or the license of the corporation shall be forfeited b during the 14month periods hereinbefore mentioned a corporation shall not be denied a license or have its license revoked if it meets all of the other requirements necessary to have a license as provided in this division state law reference similar provisions ksa 16709 contents  display  restrictions on issuance the document or other instrument evidencing the license of a pawnbroker shall state the address at which the business is to be conducted and shall state fully the name of the licensee and if the licensee is a partnership the names of the members thereof and if a corporation the date and place of its incorporation and the names of all shareholders thereof such license shall be kept conspicuously posted in the place of business of the licensee and shall not be transferable or assignable not more than one place of business shall be maintained under the same license but more than one license may be issued to the same licensee upon compliance with all the provisions of this division governing the issuance of an initial license state law reference similar provisions ksa 16710 change in location of place of business  notice  duplicate license  restrictions whenever a licensee shall change his place of business to another location within the same political subdivision by which he is licensed he immediately shall give written notice thereof to the clerk of such subdivision who then shall issue a duplicate license which shall show in addition to all of the information appearing on the old license a record of the change of location and the date thereof which new license shall be authority for the operation of such business under such license at such location the licensee shall return the old license to the appropriate clerk as soon as the new license has been received and the change in location has taken place no change in the place of business of a licensee to a location outside of the licensing subdivision shall be permitted under the same license state law reference similar provisions ksa 16711 suspension or revocation a any license issued under this division may be suspended or revoked after due notice and public hearing if the licensee 1 has failed to pay the annual license fee  2 has violated any provision of this article  or 3 has been convicted of or has pleaded guilty to a felony under the laws of this state or any other state or of the united states or shall have forfeited his bond to appear in court to answer charges for any such offense if such conviction or plea occurred subsequent to or within the ten years immediately prior to the date of the licensees application for the license b any license issued under this division shall be revoked after due notice and hearing thereon if it shall be proved at the hearing that the licensee sold any handgun to a minor c the hearing herein provided shall be held within 30 days after notice thereof and the alleged violation determined by written order of the city within 60 days after such hearing is concluded  but no revocation or suspension or surrender of any license shall impair or affect the obligation of any preexisting lawful contract between the licensee and any borrower state law reference similar provisions ksa 16713 streets sidewalks and other
