phosphorus 320 660 40%  121818 wastewater discharge permits a all nonresidential users proposing to connect to or to contribute to the potw shall complete a wastewater survey from the director before connecting to or contributing to the potw it shall be unlawful to fail to complete a wastewater survey when required it shall be unlawful to provide false misleading or fraudulent information on the wastewater survey b a wastewater discharge permit is required for a significant industrial user to connect to or contribute to the potw c it shall be unlawful for a significant industrial user to connect to or contribute or discharge to the potw without a wastewater discharge permit  7108 same  permit application issuance and denial a user required to obtain a wastewater discharge permit shall submit a completed application on the form provided by the city along with the required fee the city may request additional information for application as needed if the applicant is a proposed new user the applicant must apply at least 90 days prior to connecting to or discharging to the potw a current permit holder must submit an application for a new permit at least 60 days before the expiration date of the existing permit if after examining the information contained in the application the director determines that the characteristics of the existing or proposed discharge do not conflict with the provisions of this chapter and the permit fee is paid the director shall issue a permit allowing the discharge of waste as described in the permit and this chapter if it is determined by the director that the characteristics of the wastes are not in compliance with the provisions of this chapter the application may be denied and the applicant advised by the director of steps which must be taken to ensure compliance with the provisions of this chapter  7108 same  permit modifications within nine months of the promulgation of a national categorical pretreatment standard the wastewater discharge permit of users subject to such standards shall be revised to require compliance with such standards within the time frame prescribed by such standard where a user subject to a national categorical pretreatment standard has not previously submitted an application for a wastewater discharge permit as required by this article the user shall apply for a wastewater discharge permit within 90 days after the promulgation of the applicable national categorical pretreatment standard in addition the user with an existing wastewater discharge permit shall submit to the director within 90 days after the promulgation of an applicable federal categorical pretreatment standard the information required by this article  7108 same  permit conditions wastewater discharge permits shall be expressly subject to all provisions of this article and all other applicable regulations user charges and fees established by the city permits may contain the following a the unit charge or schedule of user charges and fees for the wastewater to be discharged to the wastewater system  b limits on the average and maximum wastewater constituents and characteristics  c limits on average and maximum rate and time of discharge or requirements for flow regulations and equalization  d requirements for installation and maintenance of inspection and sampling facilities  e specifications for monitoring programs that may include sampling locations frequency of sampling number types and standards for tests and reporting schedule  f compliance schedules  g requirements for submission of technical reports or discharge reports  h requirements for maintaining and retaining for a minimum of three 3 years the plant records relating to wastewater discharge and affording city access thereto  this period of retention shall be extended during the course of any unresolved litigation  i requirements for notification of the city of any new introduction of wastewater constituents or any substantial change in the volume or character of the wastewater constituents being introduced into the wastewater treatment system  j requirements for notification of slug discharges as per this article  k other conditions as deemed appropriate by the city to ensure compliance with this article such as but not limited to process modifications or addition of new processes l civil and criminal penalties for noncompliance with the permit conditions  7108 same  permit duration permits shall be issued for a specified time period not to exceed five years a permit may be issued for a period less than a year or may be stated to expire on a specific date the terms and conditions of the permit may be subject to modification by the city during the term of the permit as limitations or requirements are modified or other just cause exists the user shall be informed of any proposed changes in the permit at least 30 days prior to the effective date of change any changes or new conditions in the permit shall include a reasonable time schedule for compliance  7108 same  permit transfer wastewater discharge permits are issued to a specific user for a specific operation a wastewater discharge permit shall not be reassigned or transferred or sold to a new owner new user different premises or a new or changed operation without the approval of the director  7108 reporting requirements for permit holders  compliance date report within 90 days following the date for final compliance with applicable pretreatment standards or in the case of a new source following commencement of the introduction of wastewater into the potw any user subject to pretreatment standards and requirements shall submit to the director a report indicating the nature and concentration of all pollutants in the discharge from the regulated process which are limited by pretreatment standards and requirements and the average and maximum daily flow for these process units in the user facility which are limited by such pretreatment standards or requirements in cases where the pretreatment standard requires compliance with best management practices the user shall submit documentation as required by the director to determine compliance with the standard the report shall state whether the applicable pretreatment standards or requirements are being met on a consistent basis and if not what additional o&m andor pretreatment is necessary to bring the user into compliance with the applicable pretreatment standards or requirements an authorized representative of the industrial user shall sign this statement  7108 periodic compliance report a any industrial user subject to a pretreatment standard or in the case of a new source after commencement of the discharge into the potw shall submit to the director during the months of december and june unless required more frequently by the director a report indicating the nature and concentration of pollutants in the wastewater discharge which are limited by such pretreatment standards in addition this report shall include a record of all daily flows that during the reporting period exceeded the average daily flow reported in the permit application in cases where the pretreatment standard requires compliance with a best management practice or pollution prevention alternative the user shall submit documentation required by the director to determine the compliance status of the user at the discretion of the director and in consideration of such factors as local high or low flow rates holidays budget cycles etc  the director may agree to alter the months during which the above reports are to be submitted b the director may impose limitations on users that are using dilution to meet applicable pretreatment standards or requirements or in other cases where the imposition of mass limitations is appropriate in such cases the report required by this article shall indicate the mass of pollutants regulated by pretreatment standards in the wastewater discharge of the user these reports shall contain the results of sampling and analysis of the discharge including the flow and the nature and concentration or production and mass where requested by the director of pollutants contained therein which are limited by the applicable pretreatment standards all analysis shall be performed in accordance with procedures established by the epa or with any other test procedures approved by the epa sampling shall be performed in accordance with the techniques approved by the epa c baseline monitoring reports ninetyday compliance reports and reports on continued compliance require proper signatory and certification requirements in accordance with 40 cfr  7108 monitoring facilities a the city may require the user to provide and operate sampling and monitoring facilities to allow inspection sampling and flow measurement of the building sewer andor internal drainage systems the facilities shall be situated on the users premises  provided that when the director determines that such location is impractical or causes undue hardship on the user the director may allow the facility to be constructed in the public right of way as directed by the director b the sampling and monitoring facilities shall have ample area to allow accurate sampling and preparation of samples for analysis the user shall maintain the facility sampling and measuring equipment in a safe and proper operating condition c whether constructed on public or private property the sampling and monitoring facilities shall be provided in accordance with the citys requirements and all applicable construction standards and specifications construction shall be completed within ninety 90 days following written notification by the city that such facilities are required  7108 inspection sampling reporting and notification a the director shall inspect the facilities of any user to ascertain whether the purpose of this article is being met and all requirements are being complied with persons or occupants of premises where wastewater is created or discharged shall allow the city or their representative ready access at all reasonable times to all parts of the premises for the purposes of inspection sampling records examination or in the performance of any of their duties the city kdhe and the epa shall have the right to set inspection compliance monitoring andor metering operations where a user has security measures in force which would require proper identification and clearance before entry into their premises the user shall make necessary arrangements with their security guards so that upon presentation of suitable identification personnel from the city kdhe and epa will be permitted to enter without delay for the purposes of performing their specific responsibilities b the director will randomly sample and analyze the wastewater discharge from industrial users and conduct surveillance activities in order to identify independent of information supplied by industrial users occasional and continuing noncompliance with pretreatment standards the director will inspect and sample the wastewater discharge from each significant industrial user at least once a year and will evaluate at least once each two years whether each such significant industrial user needs a plan to control slug discharges the results of such activities shall be available to the approval authority upon request if the director decides that a slug control plan is needed the plan shall contain at a minimum the following elements 1 description of discharge practices including nonroutine batch discharges  2 description of stored chemicals  3 procedures for immediately notifying the director of slug discharges including any discharge that would violate a prohibition under 40 cfr 4035b with procedures for followup written notification within five days 4 if necessary procedures to prevent adverse impact from accident spills including inspection and maintenance of storage areas handling and transfer of materials loading and unloading operations control of plant site runoff worker training building of containment structures or equipment measures for containing toxic organic pollutants including solvents andor measures and equipment for emergency response c significant industrial users shall submit to the city at least once every six months on dates specified by the city a description of the nature concentration and flow of the pollutants required to be reported by the city these reports shall be based on sampling and analysis performed in the period covered by the report and performed in accordance with the techniques described in 40 cfr amendments thereto where 40 cfr does not contain sampling or analytical techniques for the pollutant in question or where epa determines that the sampling and analytical techniques are inappropriate for the pollutant in question sampling and applicable analysis shall be performed by using validated analytical methods or any other applicable sampling and analytical procedures including procedures suggested by the director or other persons approved by epa d the significant industrial user shall notify the director the epa regional waste management division director and state hazardous waste authorities in writing of any discharge into the potw of a substance which if otherwise disposed of would be a hazardous waste under 40 cfr such notification must include the information required under 40 cfr 40312p e if sampling performed by the significant industrial user indicates a violation the user shall notify the director within 24 hours of becoming aware of the violation the user shall also repeat the sampling and submit the results to the director within 30 days after becoming aware of the violation  7108 record keeping users subject to the reporting requirements of this article shall retain and make available for inspection and copying all records of information obtained pursuant to any monitoring activities required by this article and any additional records of information obtained pursuant to monitoring activities undertaken by the user independent of such requirements this requirement shall include documentation associated with best management practices records shall include the date exact place method and time of sampling and the name of the persons taking the samples  the dates analyses were performed  who performed the analyses  the analytical techniques or methods used  and the results of such analyses these records shall remain available for a period of at least three years this period shall be automatically extended for the duration of any litigation concerning the user or city or where the user has been specifically notified of a longer retention period by the director  7108 pretreatment a users shall provide necessary wastewater treatment as required to comply with this article and shall achieve compliance with all federal categorical pretreatment standards within the time limitations as specified by the federal pretreatment regulations any facilities required to pretreat wastewater to a level acceptable to the city shall be provided operated and maintained at the users expense the user shall submit detailed plans showing the pretreatment facilities and operating procedures to the director for review and such plans shall be approved by the director before construction of the facility the review of such plans and operating procedures shall in no way relieve the user from the responsibility of modifying the facility as necessary to produce a wastewater discharge acceptable to the city under the provisions of this article any subsequent changes in the pretreatment facilities or method of operation or changes in the nature and characteristics of discharge shall be reported to and be acceptable to the city prior to the users initiation of the changes b all reports relating to compliance with pretreatment standards shall be made available to officials of the epa or the kdhe if requested  7108 confidential information the information and data obtained from reports questionnaires permit applications permits and monitoring programs and from inspections shall be made available to the public as required by law if the user provides sufficient evidence that certain information or data constitutes a trade secret the city will withhold such information from disclosure to the extent permitted by law wastewater constituents and characteristics shall not constitute a trade secret further the epa and kdhe shall have immediate and unlimited access to all data and information gathered by the city in the implementation of this article  7108 enforcement  harmful contributions a the director may suspend the wastewater treatment service andor a wastewater discharge permit when such suspension is necessary in the opinion of the director in order to stop an actual or threatened discharge which presents or may present an imminent or substantial endangerment to the health or welfare of persons to the environment causes interference to the potw or causes the city to violate any condition of its npdes permit b any person notified of a suspension of the wastewater treatment service andor the wastewater discharge permit shall immediately stop or eliminate the discharge in the event of a failure of the person to comply voluntarily with the suspension order the director shall take such steps as deemed necessary including immediate severance of the sewer connection to prevent or minimize damage to the potw system or endangerment to any individuals the director shall reinstate the wastewater discharge permit andor the wastewater treatment service upon proof of the elimination of the noncomplying discharge a detailed written statement submitted by the user describing the causes of the harmful contribution and the measures taken to prevent any future occurrence shall be submitted to the director within 15 days of the date of occurrence  7108 suspension and revocation of permit the director may suspend or revoke a wastewater discharge permit of any user in the following circumstances a the user violates a condition of this article the wastewater discharge permit which may include a violation of best management practices or applicable state or federal regulation  b the user provides false misleading or fraudulent information in the wastewater discharge permit application  c the user fails to factually report the wastewater constituents and characteristics of the discharge  d the user fails to report significant changes in operations or wastewater constituents and characteristics  or e the user refuses reasonable access to the users premises for the purpose of inspection monitoring and sampling as required by this article  7108 publication of violation the city shall annually publish in the largest local daily newspaper a list of the industrial users that were in significant noncompliance as defined in this chapter of any pretreatment requirements or standards during the 12 previous months the notification shall also summarize any enforcement actions taken against the users during the same 12 months  7108 notice of violation a notice whenever the city finds that any user has violated or is violating this article wastewater discharge permit including best management practices or any prohibition limitation or requirements contained herein the city may serve upon such user a written notice stating the nature of the violation within 30 days of the date of notice a plan for the satisfactory correction thereof shall be submitted to the city by the user b administrative order when the director finds that an industrial user has violated or continues to violate the provisions set forth in this article or the users permit including best management practices or order issued thereunder the director may issue an order for compliance to the industrial user responsible for the discharge orders may contain any requirements as might be reasonably necessary and appropriate to address the noncompliance including but not limited to the installation of pretreatment technology additional selfmonitoring and management practices c consent order the director is empowered to enter into consent orders assurances of voluntary compliance or other similar documents establishing an agreement with the industrial user responsible for noncompliance such orders will include specific action to be taken by the user to correct the noncompliance within a time period specified by the order consent orders shall have the same force and effect as administrative orders issued pursuant to subsection b of this section  7108 hearing  appeal a hearing any person affected by a penalty order or directive of the city issued pursuant to this article may within ten days of the issuance of such penalty order or directive request a hearing before the director to show cause why such should be modified or made to not apply to such person such request shall be in writing and addressed to the director the director shall hold the requested hearing as soon as practical after receiving the request at which time the person affected shall have an opportunity to be heard at the conclusion of the hearing the director shall issue a written response to the person requesting the hearing affirming modifying or rescinding the penalty order or directive at issue b appeal any person aggrieved by the decision of the director may appeal such decision to the governing body within ten days of the receipt of the decision by filing notice of appeal with the city clerk upon hearing the governing body may affirm modify or reverse the decision of the director any appeal of the governing bodys decision shall be as provided by state law  7108 penalties and legal action a any person who shall be convicted of violating any provision of this article or any permit or order issued hereunder shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be punished by a fine of not more than $50000 or by imprisonment for not more than six months or by both each day that any such violation occurs shall constitute a separate offense and shall be punishable as a separate violation if upon trial of any person found guilty of a misdemeanor hereunder it shall appear to the court that the violation complained of is continuing the court shall enter such order as it shall deem appropriate to cause the violation to be abated b notwithstanding any other remedies or procedures available to the city any user who is found to have violated any provision of this article or any permit or order issued hereunder may be assessed an administrative penalty of not to exceed one thousand dollars per violation each day on which noncompliance shall occur or continue shall be deemed a separate and distinct violation such assessment may be added to the users next scheduled sewer service charge and the director shall have such other collection remedies as are available at law c notwithstanding any other remedies or procedures available to the city if any person discharges sewage industrial wastes or other wastes into the citys potw contrary to the provisions of this article or any permit or order issued hereunder the city may commence an action for appropriate legal or equitable relief including damages and costs whenever a user has violated or continues to violate the provisions of this article or any permit or order issued hereunder the city may seek a preliminary or permanent injunction or both which restrains or compels the activities on the part of the user  7108 falsifying information falsifying information is a separate offense and deemed a misdemeanor any person who knowingly makes any false statements representation or certification in any application record report plan or other document filed or required to be maintained pursuant to this article or wastewater discharge permit or who falsifies tampers with or knowingly renders inaccurate any monitoring device or method required under this article shall upon conviction be punished by a fine of not more than $100000 or by imprisonment for not more than six months or by both  7108 vegetation footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and buildings regulations ch 8  cutting or trimming trees for moving of buildings  8219  weeds  2126 et seq  streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 state law reference trees and shrubbery ksa ch 12 art 32 in general permit required for planting trimming removal on public grounds it shall be unlawful for any person to plant trim cut or remove any tree or shrub growing in any street alley or public grounds without a permit therefor from the forestry supervisor  cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 protection of public trees a no person shall attach any wire rope chain sign or any other material to any tree on any public street alley or other public property except when the same is done for the protection of the tree and with the approval of the forestry supervisor b any person constructing repairing or razing any building or structure shall use sufficient guards or protectors to prevent injury to any tree on any street alley or public property by reasons of such construction repairing or razing of such building or structure  17703 cross reference streets sidewalks and other public places ch 30 traffic hazards it shall be the duty of the owner of any premises abutting on any street alley or public sidewalk in the city to cut and trim all trees shrubs or hedges growing on the premises in such a manner that the branches thereof shall not obstruct free and convenient travel along the streets alleys and sidewalks or constitute a hazard to the users of the sidewalks alley and streets all such trees shall be trimmed so that the branches thereof over any street alley or sidewalk shall not be lower than ten feet from the surface of such street alley or sidewalk it shall be unlawful to permit any hedge to grow over any sidewalk street or alley  cross reference traffic and motor vehicles ch 31 secs 3343315  reserved tree maintenance footnotes  2  cross reference trimming of trees interfering with wires with manhattan cable tv services incorporated  1517 division 1  generally definitions the following terms are for the purpose of this article defined as follows person means any individual partnership association of persons or corporation who engage in the business or trade of trimming removal of and pruning of trees tree means a woody perennial plant having an upright stem with many branches and upon maturity being over ten feet in height  11574 cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq exemptions this article shall not apply to any person working at his own residence or established place of business or to employees of the person working thereon this article shall not apply to officials or employees of the federal state county or city governments engaged in the performance of their official duties  11574 secs 33183330  reserved division 2  license footnotes  3  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 required no person shall engage in the business or trade of trimming removing and pruning of trees within the city without first having obtained a license therefor as provided in this division  11574 application a written application for a license for the trimming removal and pruning of trees shall be filed with the city clerk the application shall meet the following requirements 1 name business address and phone number of applicant  2 filing of certificate of liability insurance  3 payment of the required license fee  11574 approval licenses required by this division shall be issued by the city clerk only after the application therefor has been approved by the governing body  11574 fee the fee for a license under this division shall be as prescribed in section 1948  11574 insurance each person who makes application for a license or renewal thereof under this division shall furnish a certificate of liability insurance covering the work in which they are engaged and upon the terms and conditions hereinafter set out the certificate of insurance shall show that the applicant is covered by an effective liability insurance policy issued by a solvent corporation authorized to do business within the state and shall be issued with minimum limits of $5000000 per person and $10000000 per accident for bodily injury and $2500000 for property damage such insurance policy shall not be cancelled or terminated until at least 20 days after a notice of cancellation of the insurance policy is received by the city clerk  11574 transferability a license granted under this division shall not be transferable when there is a change in the business status of the licensee the successor shall have 60 days within which to obtain a license as provided by the terms and conditions of this division  provided that in the event of the death of an individual his heirs or representatives shall be allowed 60 days within which to obtain a license and such additional times as may be granted by the city for cause within its discretion  11574 denial revocation the governing body may at any time revoke a license or decline to grant a license under the following circumstances 1 the licensee shall fail to furnish an acceptable written certificate of public liability insurance within 20 days from the date of notice is received from the city that the insurance policy previously furnished by the licensee is to be cancelled or terminated  2 the licensee or any employee solicitor agent or representative of the licensee has made any material misrepresentations for the purpose of defrauding any member of the public  11574 vehicles for hire footnotes  1  cross reference traffic and motor vehicles ch 31 in general secs 3413415  reserved taxicabs and livery vehicles division 1  generally definitions the following definitions shall apply in the interpretation and enforcement of this chapter 1 taxicab shall mean a motor vehicle designed for carrying 15 persons or less which transports persons for hire with driver furnished and is solicited to the general public  provided that the following vehicles shall not be considered to be taxicabs a vehicles owned by undertakers and used exclusively for funeral and ambulance service  b any vehicle operated by an agency that receives funding from the kansas department of transportation or the federal transit administration to provide transit services to the general public when those services include the picking up transporting or delivering of a passenger or passengers for hire  c any vehicle defined as a livery vehicle in section 34162 2 livery vehicle shall mean a motor vehicle designed for carrying fifteen persons or less which transports persons for hire at a fixed charge with driver furnished and is solicited to the general public provided that a taxicab and the motor vehicles listed in subsections 34161a and 34161b shall not be considered to be livery vehicles 3 operate a taxicab or operate a livery vehicle shall mean and include the picking up transporting or delivering a fare when that fare originates within the jurisdiction of the city of manhattan kansas and shall not include passing delivering a fare to this jurisdiction when the fare originates elsewhere  neither shall it include delivering a fare that originates outside this jurisdiction to a location within the jurisdiction and then waiting for the fare and returning that fare outside the jurisdiction 4 fixed charge shall mean a single monetary amount assessed for the entirety of the service provided by the livery vehicle which shall be determined and communicated to the passenger in advance of the commencement of such service by the provision of a written statement or receipt 5 cruising shall mean a method of soliciting passengers for hire by operation of any taxicab along a street or other public way for the purpose of obtaining or picking up pedestrians in the area    92088   102098   2 3612 cross reference rules of construction and definitions generally  121 et seq rates and meters for taxicabs a except as stated in subsection c the rate of fare to be charged by every licensee operating controlling or driving any taxicab within the city shall be as determined by the governing body by resolution such resolution shall establish a schedule of rates to be charged by the licensees the schedule of rates established shall be kept on file in the city clerks office and the schedule will also be prominently displayed in each taxicab b meters for measuring the rates to be charged shall be installed in all taxicabs operating in the city c the provisions of this section shall not apply to the operation of any taxicab providing service to a governmental entity under the terms of a written agreement as described hereinafter from the time the written agreement has been filed with the city clerk the written agreement must be for a fixed term of less than three years must establish the fee for such service and the service must be limited to the governmental entity and its designated users and not available for the public in general for the purposes of this subsection the term governmental entity shall include the city of manhattan riley county pottawatomie county the state of kansas and kansas state university    32073   71503   3612 cruising it shall be unlawful for any livery vehicle driver or owner to solicit passengers for hire practice of cruising    71503   3612 transportation to and from the manhattan regional airport each operator and driver licensee shall be required to abide by any rules and regulations promulgated by the manhattan regional airport when transporting passengers for hire to and from the manhattan regional airport    3612 limitation on use of vehicles for hire the owners license issued pursuant to this chapter shall designate each motor vehicle included on the owners license as either a taxicab or a livery vehicle no person shall use or direct or allow the use of a motor vehicle designated as a livery vehicle as a taxicab no person shall use or direct or allow the use of a motor vehicle designated as a taxicab as a livery vehicle provided that an owner licensee may change the designation of a motor vehicle on the owners license following submission and approval of the form provided by the city clerk    3612 secs 34213435  reserved editors note of adopted mar 6 201 reserved  34213435 in essence repealing  34213425 said sections pertained to various regulations pertaining to taxicabs and derived from the 1973 adopted  division 2  owners license footnotes  2  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 required no person whether acting as owner principal agent employee lessee or licensee shall operate or permit to be operated upon the streets of the city any taxicab or livery vehicle without having first procured a license as required by this division    3612 application any person whether acting as owner principal agent employee lessee or licensee in order to secure a license for the operation of a taxicab or livery vehicle shall pay the required fee and submit to the city clerk the license application form which shall include but is not limited to the following information 1 the name and address of the titleholder and if applicable leaseholder of each vehicle proposed to be included on the license  2 a complete description of each vehicle including the number of persons it is designed to carry the make model color state license plate number and vehicle identification number  and whether the vehicle will be used as taxicab or a livery vehicle  3 a copy of a certification of inspection of each vehicle performed within six months prior of the date of application  4 the applicants principal place of business telephone number and office address and if the applicant is a firm association or business organization the members and the managers of such firm association or business organization  if the applicant is a partnership the names and addresses of all the partners together with a copy of their partnership agreement  and if the applicant is a corporation the principal shareholders directors officers and managers of any such corporation  5 the trade name under which the applicant shall operate and the name of any insurance company from which the applicant receives vehicle liability insurance coverage and commercial general liability insurance coverage  6 whether or not the applicant has been previously licensed to operate a taxicab livery vehicle or other motor vehicle that carries passengers for hire if so when and by what municipality or state and whether such license has been revoked or suspended and the date thereof  7 the applicant shall sign the application and the information contained in such application shall be sworn to by the signing party in the case of a partnership the signature and oath will be made by one partner  in the case of a corporation the signature and oath will be that of the managing officer of the corporation    61593   71503   3612 taxicab and livery vehicle standards no person whether acting as owner principal agent employee lessee or licensee shall operate or permit to be operated upon the streets of the city any taxicab or livery vehicle unless the taxicab or livery vehicle meets the following standards a each taxicab or livery vehicle has been properly registered and bears valid and current state license tags b the taxicab or livery vehicle must be equipped with the following proper and working systems brakes suspension steering tires and wheels muffler and exhaust system glazing and mirrors windshield wipers defroster door latch and release mechanisms fuel tank and lines seat belts and restraints exterior and signal lighting horn and a knob or handle upon the side of the doors and windows by which doors and windows may be easily opened from the inside c the taxicab or livery vehicle must be thoroughly inspected and examined every six months by an ase certified mechanic who shall certify at a minimum that the vehicle complies with subsection b the certification shall be on the form provided by the city clerk and shall be documented and attested to by the mechanics signature the certification shall expire six months after its effective date the licensee shall obtain the inspection at the licensees expense and submit the required certification to the city clerk upon application for a new license or in the case of an existing license prior to the expiration of the prior certification the current certification for a particular vehicle shall be displayed inside the vehicle in plain view of the vehicles passengers d every taxicab and livery vehicle shall display in plain view of the vehicles passengers the certificate identifying it as a licensed taxicab or livery vehicle e every taxicab shall have an illuminated sign on the top of the cab bearing the legend taxicab or cab f every taxicab and livery vehicle must be insured with business automobile liability insurance written by an insurance carrier licensed to do business in kansas with minimum limits of insurance of $50000000 combined single limit for injury or death to any one person to all persons in any one accident and for property damage resulting from any one accident such insurance shall be effective whether the taxicab or livery vehicle is being driven by the licensee the licensees agent the licensees employee a lessee or any other person with the consent of the licensee such insurance shall contain all of the conditions required by the laws of the state and shall carry a uniform endorsement for actual notice to the city of any changes thereon  such policy and endorsement thereon shall further provide that it cannot be canceled until 30 days written notice shall have been filed with the city clerk the city reserves the right to require complete certified copies of all required insurance policies including endorsements affecting the required coverage the types and limits of insurance shown are to be considered as minimum amounts of insurance and in no way limits the liability of the licensee a riley county police department officer has the authority to conduct unannounced inspections of each taxicab or livery vehicle to determine compliance with this section    3612 criteria for issuance term of license and fee a an owners license and accompanying vehicle identification certificates shall only be issued or renewed by the city clerk if the applicant submits a complete application including the fees and the following conditions have been met 1 the applicant has secured and maintains in full force and effect with an insurance company licensed to do business in kansas a commercial general liability insurance policy covering liability arising from premisesoperations independent contractors personaladvertising and contractual liability with minimum limits of $50000000 for each occurrence and $50000000 general aggregate such insurance shall contain all of the conditions required by the laws of the state and shall carry a uniform endorsement for actual notice to the city of any changes thereon  such policy and endorsement thereon shall further provide that it cannot be canceled until 30 days written notice shall have been filed with the city clerk the city reserves the right to require complete certified copies of all required insurance policies including endorsements affecting the required coverage the types and limits of insurance shown are to be considered as minimum amounts of insurance and in no way limits the liability of the licensee 2 the applicants taxicabs or livery vehicles meet the vehicle standards set out in section 3438 3 if the applicant has previously been licensed to operate a taxicab business livery vehicle business or another motor vehicle business that carries passengers for hire the applicants license was never revoked or suspended b the applicant has paid the fee for a license under this division as prescribed in section 1944  3612 license term  transferability a a license issued under this division shall expire on december 31 of the calendar year for which it was issued b a license issued under this division is not transferable or assignable and any fees paid are not refundable however if a licensee substitutes a new or different motor vehicle for a taxicab or livery vehicle listed on a valid and current license the vehicle shall be substituted at no additional cost    3612 revocation  suspension  surrender of license a grounds for revocation the city clerk shall revoke an owners license at any time that the licensee would not qualify for the license pursuant to section 3439 b grounds for suspension or revocation the city clerk may suspend or revoke any such license if the licensee 1 erased or modified any portion of such license 2 falsified information on the license application 3 violated the provisions of sections 3417 3418 3419 or 3420 c surrender of license upon suspending or revoking a license hereunder the city clerk shall notify the holder of such license that it has been suspended or revoked upon such notification the holder of the license shall immediately surrender the license and vehicle certification certificates to the city clerk    3612 appeal any person who has been denied a license under the terms of this division or whose license has been revoked or suspended may appeal such action to the city manager by filing a notice of such appeal within seven days of the action with the city clerk the city manager in conducting such appeal may enter such orders as are consistent with this division  3612 secs 34433450  reserved division 3  drivers license footnotes  3  cross reference licenses generally ch 19 application a a license to operate a taxicab or livery vehicle within the city shall be issued by the city clerk to applicants who qualify for such license pursuant to the terms of this division b the license under this division shall be applied for in writing on such forms as the city clerk may provide and contain such information as may be required including the following for the purposes of this section the term conviction shall include any agreement the applicant has entered into which resulted in a diversion of the offense charged 1 whether or not the applicant has heretofore been licensed as a taxicab driver livery vehicle driver or as any other driver of a motor vehicle that carries passengers for hire  if so when and by what municipality or state and whether such license has been revoked or suspended and the date thereof  2 the date of conviction of the applicant and the court where convicted of any offense related to the operation of a motor vehicle  3 whether the applicant has ever been convicted of a felony or misdemeanor giving particulars of each conviction  4 a written consent by the applicant for the city to conduct a criminal record background investigation and from the 1973   adopted   and adopted  temporary license the city clerk may issue a temporary license under this division for a period not to exceed 30 days during the time investigation of the applicant is being conducted the permit is to expire automatically at the end of 30 days from the date of issuance    72076   51788 causes for denial a no license shall be issued to any person under this division unless that person is at least 18 years of age  has been a resident of the state of kansas for at least three months prior to the filing of the application  and has a current and valid drivers license issued by the state of kansas b no license shall be issued to any person under this division who has been convicted under the laws of the state of kansas any other state this city or any other city of any offense in category i below  or to any person who within the three years immediately preceding the date of application has been convicted under the laws of the state of kansas any other state this city or any other city of any offense in category ii below for the purposes of this term conviction shall include any agreement the applicant has entered into which resulted in a diversion of the offense charged category i 1 any felony  2 any offense involving moral turpitude  3 leaving the scene of an accident category ii 1 the illegal sale possession manufacture or transportation of intoxicating liquor  2 driving under the influence of alcohol andor drugs  3 reckless driving  4 fleeing or eluding a police officer  5 driving while license is suspended or revoked  6 failure to report an accident  7 five or more traffic violations not including parking violations    72076   51788   7390   71503 issuance  identification card if an applicant is issued a license revoke any such license upon a showing that the holder has 1 permitted any other person to use such license for any reason 2 erased or modified any portion of such license 3 falsified information on the application 4 violated the provisions of sections 3417 3418 or 3419 c surrender of license upon suspending or revoking a license hereunder the city clerk shall notify the holder of such license ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of ksa 121009 which provides for weekly meetings of the city commission for the cities of the first class in the state of kansas 791951 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject authorizing and limiting tax levies in any one year on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation prescribing an aggregate limit for all citywide levies and repealing charter ordinance no 2 of the city of manhattan kansas no 6 deposit of city funds  charter ordinance exempting city of manhattan kansas from k s a 132107 relating to deposit of city funds with the requirement that no interest be paid hereon as well as certain duties of the city treasurer no 7 meetings of governing body  a charter ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of k s a 121009 which provides for weekly meetings for the city commission of the cities of the first class in the state of kansas and otherwise providing as a substitute therefore meetings of said governing body as hereinafter set forth be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the regular meetings of the city commission of manhattan kansas shall be on the first tuesday and third tuesday of each month commencing at the hour of seven oclock  pm a call signed by a majority of the city commission shall be sufficient warrant for a special meeting a regular or a special meeting shall always be open to the public charter of said city is hereby repealed kansas statutes annotated 121009 as to the time and frequency of regular meetings of the city commission is hereby rendered inapplicable by the terms hereof this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city paper this charter ordinance shall not take effect until 60 days after its final publication and shall not be effective then in the event a sufficient petition is filed requiring a referendum on the subject matter of this ordinance all as provided by c 3 constitution of the state of kansas done at manhattan kansas this 4th day of may 1971 city of manhattan kansas _____ s robert l linder mayor city of manhattan kansas charter exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of ksa 12682 and allowing the city to use the provisions of ksa 12681 without submitting it to a vote of the electors is hereby repealed this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper the manhattan mercury this is a charter shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c 3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof on the 3rd day of july 1979 city of manhattan kansas s terry l glasscock mayor seal attest s marion h burt city clerk no 13 public improvements  a charter ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of k s a 131017 and providing substitute and additional provisions on the same subject relating to the making of public improvements be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it the provisions of k s a 131017 which applies to this city but not uniformly to all cities of the state of kansas before undertaking the construction or reconstruction of any sidewalk curb gutter bridge pavement sewer or any other public improvement in any street highway or public grounds or of any public building or facility or any other kind of public improvement shall be commenced or ordered by the governing body or under its authority a detailed estimate of the costs of such improvements shall be made under oath by the city engineer or some other competent person appointed for such purpose by the governing body and said estimate shall be submitted to the governing body for its action thereon  in all cases where the estimated cost of the contemplated building facility or other public improvements enumerated above amounts to more than ten thousand dollars $1000000 sealed proposals for the building or construction thereof shall be invited by advertisement published by the city clerk in the official city newspaper for at least three consecutive days and the governing body shall let all such work by contract to the lowest responsible bidder if there be any such whose bid does not exceed the estimate if no responsible person shall propose to enter into the contract at a price not exceeding the estimated cost all bids shall be rejected and the city shall then have authority to enter into negotiations with the lowest bidder and to enter into a contract with such lowest bidder upon reaching mutually agreeable conditions for both the city and such lowest bidder in addition if no responsible person shall propose to enter into the contract at a price not exceeding the estimated cost the governing body shall have the power to make said improvement within the estimated cost thereof and shall further have the power to purchase the necessary tools machinery apparatus materials employ the necessary labor construct the necessary plants for the purpose of carrying into effect the provisions of this ordinance in no case shall the city be liable for anything beyond the estimated cost or the original contract price for doing such work or making such improvements before any type of public improvements shall be commenced under this ordinance the money to pay for the same must be available in the city treasury as provided by law  or provision may be made for the issuance of internal improvement bonds to pay for any such improvement as provided by law this ordinance shall not be construed to include any repair or maintenance work not amounting to substantial alteration addition or change in any street or facility  and public improvement as used herein shall not include the making of repairs or the maintenance of any building street sidewalk or other public facility or the making of any expenditures from the city budget for such purposes this ordinance shall not be construed to include any improvements which are constructed on or to real estate owned by the city of manhattan and leased to a tenant industry under the authority of ksa 121740 to 121749 as amended and the tenant industry shall be responsible for contracting for such improvements  provided however that all the provisions of the lease industry shall be applicable as to such improvements and all city codes shall also be applicable this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum hold on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c 3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof this pawnbrokers and precious metal dealers a charter ordinance repealing charter ordinance no 17 of the city of manhattan kansas and exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of k s a 16707c as amended be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas that charter of the city of manhattan kansas be and the same is hereby repealed the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it c of the kansas statutes annotated which is not applicable uniformly to all cities in place of k s a 16707c the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas hereby enacts the following the license application shall be in a form approved by the attorney general each application shall be accompanied by a fee of $2500 for a precious metal dealers license or $10000 for a pawnbrokers license or $10000 for a combination precious metal dealers and pawnbrokers license which shall be paid annually upon renewal of the license the full amount of the license fee shall be paid regardless of the time of year the application is made and the licensee shall only operate under the license for the remainder of the calendar year for which the license is issued all such fees received by the city clerk shall be deposited in the city general fund that of the ordinances of the city of manhattan is hereby amended to read as follows pawnbrokers and precious dealers the annual license fee for pawnbrokers and a combination pawnbrokerprecious metal dealer shall be $10000 the annual license fee for precious metal dealers shall be $2500 this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less that than twothirds of the members voting in favor thereof on the 1st day of november 1983 city of manhattan kansas s by wanda l fateley mayor seal attest s gregg w gibson city clerk no 20 tax levies a charter ordinance repealing charter ordinance no 14 of the city of manhattan kansas and exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of k s a 791951 regarding mill levy limitation for library purposes and providing a substitute and additional provision on the same subject be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas that charter of the city of manhattan kansas be and the same is herby repealed the city of manhattan kansas a city of the first class of less than 50000 population by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and exempts itself from and makes inapplicable to it that portion of k s a 791951 regarding a mill levey limitation for library purposes said statute not being applicable uniformly to all cities of the first class and the legislature not having established classes of cities for the purpose of imposing tax limitations and prohibitions the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas hereby provides the following substitute and additional provisions to that portion of k s a 791951 regarding mill levy limitation for library purposes the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas is hereby authorized and empowered to levy taxes each year of for library purposes at a rate not in excess of six 600 mills on each dollar of assessed tangible valuation of the said city the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas does not exempt itself from the remaining provisions of said k s a 791951 this be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city paper the manhattan mercury this is a charter shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor thereof on the fifteenth day of may 1984 s _____ david j fiser mayor seal attest s gregg w gibson city clerk no 21 cereal malt beverage retailers license  a charter ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of k s a 412702 as amended be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it of the kansas statutes annotated which is not applicable uniformly to all cities of the first class charter of the city of manhattan kansas is hereby repealed in place of k s a 412702 the governing body of the city of manhattan hereby enacts the following ordinance a no retailer shall sell any cereal malt beverage within the city of manhattan without having first secured a license for each place of business as herein provided the application for said license shall be made to the city clerk and shall be approved by the governing body b an application for a retailers license shall be verified and upon a form prepared by the attorney general of the state and shall contain 1 the name and residence of the applicant  2 the length of time that the applicant has resided within the state of kansas  3 the particular place of business for which a license is desired  4 the name of the owner of the premises upon which the place of business is located  5 a statement that the applicant is a citizen of the united states and not less than twentyone 21 years of age and that the applicant has not within two years immediately preceding the date of making application been convicted of a felony any crime involving moral turpitude drunkenness driving a motor vehicle while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or violation of any other intoxicating liquor law of any state or of the united states c each application for a retailers license shall be accompanied by a fee as follows 1 for licensure of a place of business to sell cereal malt beverage for consumption on the premises $25000 2 for licensure to sell only cereal malt beverages in original and unopened containers and not for consumption on the premises $10000 3 the full amount of the license fee shall be paid regardless of the time of the year the application is made and the licensee shall only operate under the license for the remainder of the calendar year for which the license is issued no rebate or return of any portion of the license fee shall be made in case the license is revoked for any cause provided for by law the city clerk may upon presentation of a regular and complete application for a cereal malt beverage license by a fully qualified applicant and payment of the license fee issue a temporary license to the applicant said temporary license being valid as a regular license until the completion of the next regularly scheduled meeting of the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas or twentyone 21 days whichever period is shorter said temporary license shall only be issued by the city clerk if all codes of the city of manhattan concerning the proposed licensed premises have been complied with all ordinances of the city of manhattan governing the issuance suspension or revocation of cereal malt beverage licenses except those in conflict with this ordinance shall remain in full force and effect this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper the manhattan mercury this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the members elect voting in favor of manhattan kansas from certain portions of ksa 121697 be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it that portion of ksa 121697 which authorizes the levy of a transient guest tax at not to exceed the rate of two percent 2% upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient guests for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental services or facilities in any hotel motel or tourist court said statute not being uniformly applicable to all cities in kansas in place of that portion of ksa 121697 referred to above the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas is hereby authorized to levy a transient guest tax at not to exceed the rate of three percent 3% upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient guests for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental services or facilities in any hotel motel or tourist court all other provisions of k s a 121697 shall remain the same this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a lindamood mayor seal attest s ___________ heide clark city clerk no 25 court costs in municipal court a charter ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from the provisions of ksa 124112 concerning court costs in municipal court and providing alternatives therefor be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it the provisions of ksa 124112 whenever a defendant in a case before the municipal court of the city of manhattan kansas is either convicted of a violation of a municipal ordinance or ordinances or enters into a diversion agreement concerning a violation thereof said defendant shall be assessed court costs in the sum of twentyeight dollars $2800 said sum shall be in addition to any fine that is imposed by the court for said violations the provisions of section 2 of this ordinance shall not apply to convictions for the violation of any ordinance prohibiting or restricting the parking of motor vehicles within the city this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof on the 2nd day of september 1986 s _____ j eric rick mann mayor seal attest s ___________ heide clark city clerk no 26 public building commission a charter ordinance exempting the city of manhattan kansas from various sections of the public building commission act be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it certain sections of the public building commission act ksa 121757 et seq hereinafter referred to as the act said act not being applicable uniformly to all cities of the first class that the city does hereby exempt itself from the following sections of said act ksa 121758  ksa 121759  ksa 121760  ksa 121763  ksa 121764  and ksa 121767 the balance of the act shall remain in full force and effect as to the city of manhattan except that when the word act is used in the statute it shall also mean and refer to this ordinance where applicable in place of ksa 121758  ksa 121759  ksa 121760  ksa 121763  ksa 121764  and ksa 121767 the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas hereby enacts the following ordinance a the city by ordinance may create a public building commission as defined in the act said building commission shall be for the purposes of acquiring a site or sites for and constructing reconstructing equipping and furnishing a building or buildings or other facilities of a revenueproducing character including parking facilities or for purchasing or otherwise acquiring said building or buildings or facilities such building or buildings or facilities shall be maintained and operated for city offices a county courthouse county correctional facilities or jails the housing and accommodation of county offices or county businesses or such other purposes as are commonly carried on in connection with such facilities or in county courthouses or general city buildings including administrative offices for school districts and housing accommodations and parking facilities for offices of state and federal agencies in addition to the above the public building commission may acquire land and facilities including leasehold interests therein adjacent to or near kansas state university and may construct reconstruct equip and furnish such facilities on such land and lease or sublease such land and facilities to any board of trustees of kansas state university or to the official governing body of said university b the ordinance creating the building commission shall specify the purposes and functions of said public building commission and shall specify the number of members for the governing body of such commission which shall not be fewer than three nor more than nine c the public building commission created by the city shall have the power to do all things necessary or incidental to the purpose of constructing or acquiring or enlarging furnishing and equipping and operating and maintaining buildings to be made available for use by governmental agencies in addition the public building commission shall have authority to transfer fee simple title to the real estate once all bonds issued pursuant to the act have been retired to the city or such other governmental entity that requested construction of the facility in the first place d the public building commission created by the city shall have the authority to rent all or any part of its buildings or other facilities to any federal state or county governmental agency or any municipal corporation quasi municipal corporation political subdivision or body politic or agency thereof doing business maintaining an office or rendering a public service in the county seat or county in which the commission was organized and to rent any space as may be needed by such governmental agencies for such service facilities as such public building commission may determine will primarily service the comfort and convenience of the occupants of its buildings or other facilities in addition if the city of manhattan kansas is a tenant of any building or facility owned by the public building commission the city shall have the authority to sublease all or any portion of such building or facility to any other governmental agency or to any private entity however if the city of manhattan kansas chooses to sublease all or any part of such building to a private entity the governing body of the city shall determine that the portion so subleased to a private entity is not needed for any public purpose of the city the public building commission established by the city shall have the power to acquire the fee simple title to real property or a leasehold interest in real property including easements and reversionary interest in the streets alleys and other public places and personal property required for its purposes by purchase gift devise or by exercise of the power of eminent domain of the state and the title thereto shall be taken in the corporate name of the commission the corporate name of the commission so created shall be the manhattan public building commission e any revenue bonds authorized by the act shall be issued as provided in ksa 101201 et seq and amendments thereto except to the extent that such statutes are in conflict with the act this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after the final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by the majority of the electors voting thereon passed by the governing body not less than twothirds of the memberselect voting in favor thereof on the 20th portions of ksa 121697 and from ksa 121698d be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the city of manhattan kansas is a city of the first class and by the power vested in it by of the constitution of the state of kansas hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it that portion of ksa 121697 which authorizes the levy of a transient guest tax at not to exceed the rate of two percent upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient guests for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental services or facilities in any hotel motel or tourist court the city of manhattan kansas also hereby elects to exempt and does hereby exempt itself from and makes inapplicable to it ksa 121698d said statutes not being uniformly applicable to all cities in kansas in place of that portion of ksa 121697 referred to above the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas is hereby authorized to levy a transient guest tax at not to exceed the rate of five percent upon the gross receipts derived from or paid by transient guests for sleeping accommodations exclusive of charges for incidental services or facilities in hotel motel or tourist court in place of ksa 121698d the following shall apply to the city of manhattan kansas all such monies received by the city treasurer from disbursements from the city transient guest tax fund shall be credited to the tourism and convention promotion fund of the city and shall be used for all or any portion of programs projects activities municipal services or public improvements which the governing body of the city has determined are related to the promotion enhancement advancement or retention of tourism and conventions to the city of manhattan kansas including the payments of principal and interest on bonds issued for such purposes all other provisions of ksa 121697 and ksa 121698 shall remain the same this ordinance shall be published once each week for two consecutive weeks in the official city newspaper this is a charter ordinance and shall take effect sixtyone 61 days after its final publication unless a sufficient petition for a referendum is filed and a referendum held on the ordinance as provided in subdivision c3 of the constitution of the state of kansas in which case the ordinance shall become effective if approved by a
