construction and safety standards 42 usc  has a permanent chassis and is transportable in one or more sections modular home a structure designed to be used as a dwelling which is constructed in accordance with the uniform building adopted by the city of manhattan which is transportable in one or more sections but is not constructed on a permanent chassis and which is placed on a permanent foundation motor vehicle a self propelled vehicle article xvi construction and definitions xvi12 nonconformity any property or use which does not comply with all applicable provisions of these flexible and unified pattern of development which can more easily address unique constraints and conditions on a specific tract of land principal structure a structure in which is conducted the principal use of the lot on which it is located principal use the primary or predominant use of a lot as distinguished from an accessory use private vocationaltechnical institution any privately owned streets alleys or offstreet parking or loading areas rear lot line see lot line rear rear yard see yard rear recycling center a facility in which recoverable resources such as paper glass and aluminum cans are collected stored flattened crushed or bundled for the purpose of shipping and reusing such resource at another location in addition such facility may also include the collection of household hazardous waste following accepted procedures for identification cataloging and storage as per applicable local state and federal regulations recycling collection point an accessory use that serves as a neighborhood dropoff point for temporary storage of small recoverable resources such as plastic and glass containers and newspapers in a container or small structure recycling plant a facility in which recoverable resources and other materials including household hazardous waste and business and agricultural wastes are recycled reprocessed and treated to return such products to a condition to which they may again be used for production or in the case of nonrecyclable materials are properly stored for shipment to a disposal facility the collection identification cataloging and storage of hazardous materials shall follow applicable local state and federal regulations remodeling any change in a structure other than incidental repairs and normal maintenance which may prolong its useful lowest level to the sky except for structures permitted by these regulations yard front a yard extending along the full length of a front lot line and back to a line drawn parallel to the front lot line at a distance therefrom equal to the depth of the minimum front yard on a corner lot each yard that abuts a front lot line shall be considered a front yard except that on corner lots having frontages on three 3 public rightsofway the rightofway from which access is prohibited by plat covenant or easement shall be considered a rear lot line yard rear a yard extending along the full length of the rear lot line and back to a line drawn parallel to the rear lot line at a distance therefrom equal to the depth of the minimum rear yard in the case of a corner lot there shall be no rear yard as defined and in such case the sides opposite the street sides shall be considered as side yards for setback purposes except that on corner lots having frontages on three 3 public rightsofway the rightofway from which access is prohibited by plat covenant or easement shall be considered a rear lot line article xvi construction and definitions xvi17 in the case of a with one side abutting an arterial street the yard abutting the street that does not give access to the lot shall be considered the rear yard yard side a yard extending along a side lot line and back to a line drawn parallel to the side lot line at a distance therefrom equal to the width of the minimum side yard but excluding any area encompassed within a front yard or rear yard dimensions of minimum side yards specified in the district regulations of these regulations refer to the required width of each side yard rather than to the width of both side yards unless otherwise specified xvii1 article xvii effective date 17101 amendment that the manhattan zoning regulations as adopted by are hereby amended and replaced in their entirety as of the effective date of these regulations 17102 effective date these regulations shall take effect and be in force from and after the adoption of the incorporating its publication in the manhattan mercury approved by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas this 17th day of december 2019 certification of clerk i brenda k wolf the duly appointed qualified and city clerk of manhattan kansas do hereby certify that the foregoing duly adopted at a meeting of the city of manhattan kansas held on the 17th day of december 201 and that said been compared by me with the original thereof on file and of record in my office is a true copy of the whole of said original in witness whereof i have hereunto set my hand and the seal of the city of manhattan kansas 18th day of december 2019 ________________________________ brenda k wolf cmc city clerk ordinance no 7470 an ordinance reestablishing and amending zoning regulations within the corporate limits of the city of manhattan kansas by incorporating by reference that certain revised publication titled manhattan zoning regulations whereas the governing body based upon recommendations of the manhattan urban area planning board has by the adoption of adopted by reference the thirtyforth revised publication known as manhattan zoning regulations  and whereas the manhattan urban area planning board on the 18th day of november 201 has recommended further amendments to the revised manhattan zoning regulations consisting of revising c5 highway service commercial district to allow for group day care centers as a permitted use in the commercial district  and whereas the governing body desires to revise the manhattan zoning regulations by revising c5 highway service commercial district to allow for group day care centers as a permitted use in the commercial district  and whereas all actions of the manhattan urban area planning board and the governing body have been pursuant to and in compliance with ksa 12741 et seq and specifically ksa 12757 now therefore be it ordained by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas the revised publication known as manhattan zoning regulations as approved by the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas on the 17th day of december 201 is hereby adopted and incorporated herein by reference one copy of such publication shall be marked or stamped official copy as incorporated by shall be attached to a copy of this ordinance and filed with the city clerk and open for inspection and available to the public at all reasonable hours all administrative departments of the city charged with enforcement of the zoning regulations shall be supplied at the cost of the city such a number of official copies similarly marked as may be deemed expedient that is hereby repealed this ordinance shall take effect and be in force from and after its publication in the official city newspaper manhattan urban area subdivision regulations official copy as adopted by ordinance no 6357 article i general provisions part 1 title 1101 this document shall be known cited and referred to as the manhattan urban area subdivision regulations for the city of manhattan kansas and that portion of the manhattan urban area located in riley county kansas part 2 authority 1201 these regulations are adopted by the manhattan urban area planning board muapb and approved by the board of county commissioners of riley county kansas and the governing body of the city of manhattan kansas pursuant to the interlocal agreement between the city of manhattan and riley county dated  and also pursuant to ksa 12741 et seq 1202 manhattan urban area planning board under the authority cited in the muapb shall exercise the power and the authority to review approve or disapprove plats for the subdivision of land within the jurisdiction specified in pursuant to kansas statutes and pursuant to these regulations part 3 jurisdiction 1301 from and after their approval by the governing body of the city of manhattan these regulations shall apply to the subdivision of any land located within the city from and after their approval by the board of county commissioners of riley county these regulations shall apply to the subdivision of any land located within the manhattan urban area outside the city part 4 policy and purposes 1401 a the policies and purposes as set forth herein may be used in support of and in the interpretation of the provisions of these regulations  however such statement of policies and purposes are not to be deemed as regulations themselves b it is hereby declared to be the policy of the muapb and the governing i1 bodies of the city and county that 1 the subdivision of land and the subsequent development of the subdivided tract is subject to the control of the muapb and the governing bodies pursuant to kansas statutes the interlocal agreement between the city and county and the respective rules regulations ordinances and resolutions of the city and county in order to promote the orderly planned economic and efficient development of the manhattan urban area  2 land to be subdivided shall be of such character that it can be used safely for building purposes without danger to health or peril from fire flood or other menace  3 land to be subdivided will have public facilities and improvements available when needed and proper provision has been made for drainage water sewage and capital improvements such as schools parks recreation facilities and transportation facilities  and 4 these regulations shall be administered to ensure orderly and well planned growth in conformance with the adopted comprehensive plan and the capital improvements program of the manhattan urban area when applicable and to supplement and facilitate the enforcement of the provisions and standards contained in building and housing codes fire and life safety codes and zoning regulations c these regulations are adopted for the following purposes 1 to protect and provide for the public health safety and general welfare of the manhattan urban area  2 to guide the future growth and development of the manhattan urban area in conformance with the adopted comprehensive plan and grwoth policies  3 to provide for adequate light air and privacy to secure safety from fire flood and other danger and to prevent overcrowding of the land and undue congestion of population  4 to require that each subdivision provides building sites that are reasonably safe from damage from any flood source i2 whether the source is the 100 year base flood or any other source  5 to coordinate the development of each parcel of land with the existing community and to facilitate the proper development of adjoining land  6 to provide for sustainable development that protects the character and the social economic and environmental stability of all parts of the manhattan urban area and to encourage land use and development practices that promote the orderly and contiguous growth of the manhattan urban area  7 to provide for the consideration of the effect of zoning and subdivision on the value of land throughout the manhattan urban area and the value of buildings and improvements upon the land and to minimize the conflicts among the uses of land and buildings so as to encourage the most appropriate use of each parcel of land application of site analysis and subdivision layout standards  8 to guide public and private policy and action in order to provide adequate and efficient transportation water sewage schools parks playgrounds recreation emergency services and other public requirements and facilities for the proposed subdivision and the community  9 to provide for a reasonable relationship between the uses of land and buildings and the circulation of pedestrians bicyclists and motor vehicles throughout the manhattan urban area having particular regard to the avoidance of congestion on streets and highways and safe and efficient pedestrian and bicycle traffic movements appropriate to the various uses of land and buildings and to provide for the proper location and width of streets and building lines  10 to establish reasonable standards of subdivision layout and procedures for subdivisions and resubdivisions to provide adequate and accurate records of all land subdivision and to ensure proper legal descriptions and monumenting of subdivided land  11 to encourage the wise use and management of natural resources and features thoughout the manhattan urban area in order to preserve the integrity stability and beauty of the i3 community and the value of land development practices that prevent pollution of air streams and ponds that assure adequate drainage facilities and that safeguard the water table  12 to provide for open spaces most efficient design and layout of the land including the use of average density in providing for minimum width and area of lots while preserving the density of land as established in the applicable zoning regulations of the manhattan urban area  and 13 to provide that the cost of improvements which primarily benefit the tract of land being developed be borne by the owners or subdividers of the tract and that the cost of improvements which primarily benefit the whole community be shared by the subdivider and the community part 5 applicability 1501 subdivision of land shall be made in accordance with these regulations and shall require a plat or replat whichever is applicable to be made in accordance with these regulations unless otherwise exempted by below whenever the owners of any land within the jurisdiction of these regulations desires to a divide or further divide land into two or more lots or parcels  or b otherwise alter the boundaries of lots or parcels of land 1502 the adoption of these regulations shall not affect the validity of a final plat that has previously been approved under prior regulations whether or not such final plat has actually been filed of record any subdivision of land that has not been completed by the approval of a final plat prior to the effective date of these regulations shall comply with these regulations even if such subdivision has received preliminary approval under prior regulations part 6 exemptions 1601 these regulations shall not apply in the following instances or i4 transactions a the division of land in either the urban area or urban service area into parcels or tracts when said land is used exclusively for agricultural purposes and no residence is located or proposed to be located on the property and no new streets are to be dedicated to be considered an agricultural purpose the land must be zoned agricultural and must be determined to be consistent with the requirements of any applicable zoning regulations or administrative policies b the subdivision of burial lots in cemeteries i5 article ii administrative provisions part 1 interpretation and construction 2101 where the requirements of these regulations impose restrictions that differ from those requirements imposed by any other provision of these regulations or any other statute ordinance regulation resolution or other provision of law then the provision which imposes the higher or more restrictive standard shall apply 2102 the provisions of these regulations are not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or other private agreement provided that where the requirements of these regulations are more restrictive or impose higher standards of regulations than such easement covenant or other private agreement the requirements of these regulations shall govern 2103 a subdivision of the land which was not lawfully existing at the time of the adoption of these regulations shall not become or be made lawful solely by reason of the adoption of these regulations 2104 the provisions of these regulations are additional limitations upon all other laws and ordinances heretofore passed or which may be passed hereafter governing any subject matter set forth in the provisions of these regulations part 2 separability 2201 if any part or provision of these regulations or application therefore to any person or circumstances is adjudicated invalid by any competent jurisdiction such judgement shall be confined in its operation to the part provision or application directly involved in the controversy in which such judgement shall have been rendered and shall not affect or impair the validity of the remainder of these regulations or the application thereof to other persons or circumstances the governing bodies hereby declare that they would have enacted the remainder of these regulations even without any such part provision or application part 3 saving provision ii1 2301 these regulations shall not be construed as abating any action now pending under or by virtue of prior existing subdivision regulations or as discontinuing abating modifying or altering any penalty accruing or about to accrue or as affecting the liability of any person firm or corporation or as waiving any right of the city or the county under any section or provision existing at the time of adoption of these regulations or as vacating or annulling any rights obtained by any person by lawful action of the city or county except as shall be expressly provided for in these regulations part 4 amendment process 2401 these regulations may be amended at any time the muapb shall hold a public hearing on any proposed addition or amendment a notice of such public hearing shall be published in the official city and county newspaper as provided by kansas statute at or after such public hearing has been held the muapb may adopt such amendments but such amendments shall not become effective until approved by the governing bodies part 5 variations 2501 a the muapb may grant variations from the requirements of subdivision layout standards as provided for herein if the muapb makes the findings set forth in c no variation shall violate any policy or purpose of these regulations or vary any zoning regulation no variation shall be granted with lot splits or boundary line adjustments b a request for a variation shall be made at the time of filing an application for a preliminary or final plat on forms provided by the city or county variation requests shall contain all information requested on the form as well as any additional information as may be requested by the responsible planning staff or the muapb c the muapb shall not approve a variation unless the muapb shall make findings based on evidence presented to it in each specific case that 1 granting of the variation will not be detrimental to the public health safety or general welfare or be injurious to adjacent property  2 there are unique physical characteristics of the property ii2 for which the variation is sought and not generally applicable to other property  and 3 due to the unique physical characteristics of the property its shape or topography an unnecessary hardship to the subdivider would result as distinguished from a mere inconvenience and such hardship is not based solely on economics  and 4 no provision of any zoning regulations other regulation ordinance or the comprehensive plan would be varied d the muapb may place any reasonable condition of approval as a part of the granting of a variation part6 governing body not obligated to expend funds 2601 the responsible governing body shall not be obligated for the expenditure of any funds whatsoever under and pursuant to the terms of these subdivision regulations unless and until the responsible governing body shall have approved such expenditure by a majority vote all costs connected with rezoning preparation of engineering studies and plans surveying preparation of petitions etc required as a part of these regulations shall be paid for by the owner and in no case shall any part or requirement of these regulations imply any obligation of the responsible governing body to expend any funds ii3 article iii fees part 1 method of payment 3101 all application fees to be paid in the subdivision process shall be submitted with the application as required by these regulations to the responsible planning department part 2 sequence 3201 all applicable fees at any step in the review process must be paid and recorded as such before the subdivision request is placed on the muapb agenda part 3 costs 3301 application and recording fees shall be assessed based on the fee schedule as established by the governing bodies of the city and the county iiiiii1 article iv enforcementviolations and penalties part 1 enforcementviolatons 4101 it shall be the duty of the city manager or his designee to enforce activities related to these regulations that fall under the jurisdiction of the city it shall be the duty of the position or positions as designated by the board of county commissioners to enforce activities related to these regulations that fall under the jurisdiction of the county 4102 no person shall construct any building or structure upon a lot or plat subdivided or sold in violation of the provisions of these regulations any building permit issued for the construction of any building or structure on a lot or plat subdivided or sold in violation of these regulations shall be invalid 4103 no owner or agent of the owner shall sell or otherwise transfer any parcel of land within the jurisdiction of these regulations if such sale or transfer results in the division or further division of a larger parcel until such time as a plat of such parcel has been approved by the muapb in accordance with these regulations and filed with the county register of deeds unless such sale or transfer is exempt pursuant to the of these regulations part 2 penalties 4201 any person who fails to comply with or violates any provision of these regulations shall be subject to a fine of not more than $500 for each offense each day of such violations or failure to comply shall constitute a separate offense part 3 civil enforcement 4301 appropriate actions and proceedings may be taken at law or in equity to prevent any violations of these regulations to prevent unlawful construction to recover damages to restrain correct or abate a violation to prevent illegal occupancy of a building structure or premises and these remedies shall be in addition to the penalties described above iv1 article v administrative duties part 1 division of responsibility 5101 subdivision review responsibilities shall be divided among the applicable governmental branches agencies or departments as listed herein a administrative bodies 1 governing bodies of the county and of the city  2 manhattan urban area planning board  3 city planning and engineering departments  4 county planning and engineering departments  5 riley county health department  6 local township boards  and 7 other local or state agencies as deemed appropriate b responsible departments for the purpose of these regulations and for all land within the manhattan urban area the following divisions of review responsibilities shall be in effect at the time of submittal of a subdivision application 1 any subdivision proposed within the city shall be the responsibility of the city planning and engineering departments 2 any subdivision proposed within the urban service area as established by resolutionordinance and as may be amended from time to time shall be the responsibility of both the county and the city planning and engineering departments prior to application the responsible planning departments shall coordinate with one another and determine which department shall be the lead agency in the processing and review of the proposed subdivision v1 3 any subdivision proposed within the urban area shall be the responsibility of the county planning and engineering departments and the riley county health department part 2 responsibilities of the muapb 5201 the muapb shall a conduct public hearings and review and approve or deny all preliminary and final plats as presented to it in accordance with the provisions in these regulations  b sign and transmit all final plats upon approval to the responsible governing body  c make such decisions and actions as shall be necessary to insure the integrity of and adherence to these regulations  d compile a list with the reasons for disapproval of any plat reviewed by it and shall provide the subdivider with one 1 copy of such list along with the plat the muapb shall also forward one 1 copy to the responsible planning department for its records  and e conduct public hearings review and adopt any amendments to these regulations and their respective subdivision layout standards that shall be brought before it part 3 responsibilities of the governing body 5301 the governing body shall a accept or refuse the dedications of land for public purposes and the financing methods for public purposes part 4 responsibilities of the planning departments 5401 the planning department shall a maintain permanent and current records with respect to these regulations  v2 b provide adequate information and assistance in the preapplication development conference as needed by the subdivider to prepare a proper preliminary plat and final plat  c publish notice of the time date and subject of public hearings in the official citycounty newspaper at least twenty 20 days prior to the date of said public hearing  d receive and file on behalf of the muapb all applications for sketch plats concept plats preliminary plats and final plats together with other necessary information  e review all sketch plats concept plats preliminary plats final plats lot splits and boundary line adjustments and other supporting data for compliance with these regulations and distribute copies of the plats to other appropriate governmental departments  f notify all property owners within the specified distance of the proposed subdivision prior to scheduled muapb public hearings  g review final plats for compliance with the approved or approved with conditions preliminary plat and with the final plat provisions of these regulations  h forward preliminary and final plats to the muapb with staff recommendations  and i make such other determinations and decisions concerning these regulations as may be required by other departments by the muapb or by the responsible governing body part 5 responsibilities of the subdivider 5501 the subdivider shall a be familiar with these regulations and the requirements thereof  b adhere to all procedures and requirements set out within these regulations  and c submit to the responsible planning department an application v3 article vi application procedure and approval process for the subdivision of land part 1 general 6101 except as otherwise provided for herein no land within the manhattan urban area shall be subdivided until all applicable provisions of these regulations have been met the procedure and approval process for the subdivision of land shall include where applicable and as set forth herein after a a preapplication development conference including submittal of a sketch plat  and b the submittal of an application for the review and approval of a preliminary plat which includes a concept plat where applicable  and c a public hearing before the muapb on the application for a preliminary plat  and d approval of the preliminary plat by the muapb  and e the submittal of an application for approval of a final plat  and f approval of the final plat by the muapb  and g acceptance of the dedications to the public contained on the final plat by the appropriate governing body  and h the filing of the final plat with the appropriate register of deeds 6102 information packets information packets concerning the subdivision process meeting schedules and application forms are available at the responsible planning department part 2 preapplication development conference 6201 prior to submitting an application for the review and approval of a preliminary plat the subdivider shall contact the responsible planning department to arrange for a preapplication development conference and such planning department shall schedule same subject to b 13 vi1 the preapplication development conference is the beginning step in the review of any subdivision and shall be mandatory for any proposal the conference shall include but is not limited to the subdivider or an appointed designee and representatives of the responsible planning and engineering departments and other appropriate departments the preapplication development conference shall be an informal review of the proposal and the subdivider shall bring to the preapplication development conference a sketch plat prepared in accordance with when applicable a concept plat as required by b 2 herein the subdivider shall also bring to the preapplication development conference information in the form of drawings andor legal descriptions which identifies all unplatted land contiguous to the proposed subdivision and which is in the same ownership as the proposed subdivision the subdivider shall also bring information regarding any benefit districts to which the proposed tract is subject and which have been created by the city of manhattan such information shall include a rough draft of the plan regarding special assessments required by the purpose of the conference is to acquaint the subdivider with the application submittal process  to identify any accompanying studies documents or reports that should be submitted  to provide an exchange of information regarding the proposed development  and to advise the subdivider about policies and regulations that create opportunities or pose constraints on the proposed development no official approval or disapproval of a proposal occurs with this step a development conference shall have effect for only six 6 months if no preliminary plat lot split or boundary line adjustment action has been filed within six 6 months of the conference the subdivider shall hold another conference unless an extension is granted by the responsible planning department 6202 in the event any factor of the proposed subdivision which in the judgement of the responsible planning department necessitates review and comment by an advisory board other than the muapb such review and comment shall occur prior to the submittal of an application for a preliminary plat the subdivider shall submit all necessary information to such board for such review and comment part 3 application review and approval of preliminary and concept plats 6301 a the subdivider shall submit an application on forms provided by the responsible planning department for the review and approval of a preliminary plat the responsible planning department may administratively provide for submission deadlines for materials required in support of an application provided for in these regulations vi2 1 if the tract of land proposed to be subdivided is located within the corporate limits of the city the application shall be submitted to the responsible planning department 2 if the tract of land proposed to be subdivided is located within the urban service area the application shall be submitted to the departments of both the city and county responsible for planning and zoning such departments shall coordinate between themselves the primary responsibility for reviewing such applications 3 if the tract of land proposed to be subdivided is located in the urban area the application shall be submitted to the responsible planning department b the following documents where applicable shall be attached to the application 1 the proposed preliminary plat and information as set forth in of these regulations 2 a concept plat when required as follows a upon submittal of a preliminary plat the subdivider shall submit a concept plat addressing land contiguous to the proposed subdivision and in the same ownership as the proposed subdivision the responsible planning department subsequent to the preapplication development conference shall determine the scope and extent of such contiguous land that is required to be addressed by the concept plat in determining such scope and extent the responsible planning department may consider such factors as the size of the area contiguous to the proposed subdivision the topography of such area the manhattan urban area boundaries the time within which such area is likely to develop and such other factors as the responsible planning department deems reasonable the responsible planning department shall notify the subdivider of such scope and extent as soon as possible after the preapplication development conference a concept plat shall be submitted even if a prior concept plat covering some or all of the same area has been previously submitted with a prior preliminary plat a concept plat shall be considered an informal review of contiguous land the purpose of the concept plat is solely to allow the muapb to receive and exchange information vi3 from the subdivider about future development of the contiguous land during its formative stages b the concept plat shall be prepared in accordance with the requirements of 113 c the muapb shall not be entitled to base any decision about the preliminary plat upon information contained in the concept plat and neither the muapb nor the subdivider shall be bound by any information on the concept plat as to the future development of the area which it represents 6302 a upon receipt of a complete application for the review and approval of a preliminary plat the responsible planning department shall schedule the application for public hearing before the muapb such hearing shall not be scheduled sooner than thirty 30 days subsequent to the receipt of the complete application after such hearing date has been established the responsible planning department shall proceed with the publication of a public notice for a public hearing before the muapb as prescribed herein b if the tract of land proposed to be subdivided is subject to special assessments imposed by the city of manhattan no application for a preliminary plat regarding such tract shall be deemed complete until the subdivider has submitted a plan and said plan has been approved by the citys planning department which sets forth the manner in which such special assessments are to be reapportioned upon the tract as platted such plan as submitted for approval shall include the written approval of all owners of the tract and shall be consistent with the original resolution creating the benefit district and the ordinance levying the special assessments if after such plan has been approved the proposed preliminary plat is modified such preliminary plat shall not be approved until the plan has been resubmitted and approved by the citys planning department 6303 public hearing the muapb shall conduct a public hearing on any application for a preliminary plat a notice of public hearing shall be advertised once in the official citycounty newspaper and at least twenty 20 days shall elapse between the date of publication and the date set for the public hearing such notice shall state the date time and place of the public hearing and a general description of the proposed subdivision 6304 area of notification notice of the public hearing shall be mailed at least twenty 20 days before the hearing to all owners of record of land within two hundred 200 feet of the area proposed to be platted if the area to be platted is located adjacent to or outside the citys limits the area of vi4 notification shall extend to one thousand 1000 feet in the unincorporated area 6305 posting of signs for public hearings involving specific property afor parcels in the city and urban service area the subdivider shall place a sign on the property informing the general public that a public hearing will be held concerning the proposed change the sign shall be furnished by the city and the subdivider shall maintain the sign for at least twenty 20 days immediately preceding the date of the public hearing the sign shall be firmly attached to a stake and placed within 5 feet of the street rightofway line in a central position on the lot tract or parcel of land so that the sign is free of any visual obstructions surrounding the sign if a lot tract or parcel of land is located on a corner one sign shall be placed so as to face each of the streets abutting thereto if the lot tract or parcel of land does not have a yard in which to place a sign a sign may be posted in the window of the building in such a manner that it is free of visual obstructions the responsible planning department may waive the requirement to post a sign in cases where a lot tract or parcel of land is not accessible to the publics view b the subdivider shall file an affidavit with the responsible planning department on the day of the public hearing verifying that the sign has been maintained and posted as required by this paragraph the sign may be removed at the conclusion of the public hearing and must be removed by the applicant at the end of all proceedings on the application or upon withdrawal of the application failure to post the signs in accordance with these procedures or failure to submit the affidavit prior to the hearing may result in a delay of the public hearing 6306 consideration of preliminary plats athe muapb shall approve the preliminary plat if 1 the proposed preliminary plat conforms with the requirements of these regulations  and 2 there is no indication from providers of public facilities or services that their facilities or services will not be available to the platted area within a reasonable period of time for the purposes of this public facilities and services shall include but are not limited to sanitary sewer water streets storm sewer fire protection police protection schools electricity and phone service  and vi5 3 the plat conforms to all requirements established by the muapb pursuant to b  and 4 the proposed plat presents an overall development pattern that is consistent with the comprehensive plan and policies adopted by the responsible governing body and 5 the plat contains a sound wellconceived parcel and land subdivision layout that is consistent with good land planning site engineering design principles and the requirements of subdivision layout standards and 6 the spacing and layout of proposed streets curb cuts intersection locations medians and the number and location of ingress and egress points to the land covered by the plat are consistent with good traffic engineering design and public safety considerations and 7 the subdivider has made every reasonable effort to mitigate the impact of the proposed subdivision on the public health safety and general welfare including offsite impacts caused by increased traffic volume and altered traffic flow b in the event the muapb determines that there are physical characteristics of the parcel proposed to be platted which create circumstances that significantly and adversely impact the general health safety and welfare of the future users of the site or other areas and such circumstances are not adequately addressed by these regulations but reasonably would have been if they had been known or considered at the time of adoption of these regulations then the muapb may either impose conditions upon the plat approval or deny the plat whichever is reasonably necessary to address such circumstances c prior to the approval of a preliminary plat the muapb may require the subdivider to submit an engineering study of the impact of a flood on any flood prone area not delineated as a floodway or floodway fringe district floodprone areas are those that include but are not necessarily limited to those that have a history of flooding due to natural storm events andor manmade conditions or any combination thereof the muapb shall review the plat to determine if the subdivision proposal will be reasonably safe from flooding and may impose construction standards consistent with the need to protect those floodprone areas identified in the study in order to be reasonably safe residential development shall be constructed on nonsettling fill so that the lowest enclosed floor including a basement of the dwelling would be at least vi6 one 1 foot above the flood elevation determined by the concurrent engineering study in order to be reasonably safe commercial or industrial development may be constructed on nonsettling fill so that the lowest enclosed floor is at least one 1 foot above the determined flood elevation or flood proofed to at least one 1 foot above the determined flood elevation the muapb shall review the plat to assure that 1 the proposed plat is consistent with the need to minimize flood damage within the floodprone area  and 2 all public utilities and facilities such as sewer gas electrical water and streets are located and constructed to minimize or eliminate flood damage  and 3 adequate drainage easements are provided to reduce exposure to flood hazards d the muapb may deny a plat in unique circumstances where the facts indicate that due to frequency or severity of flooding flood depths or flood velocities the proposed plat cannot provide lots that are safe from the effects of flooding e 1 if the muapb disapproves or approves conditionally the preliminary plat the reasons for such shall be stated in writing and shall refer specifically to those parts of these regulations with which the preliminary plat does not conform a copy of such writing signed by the secretary of the muapb shall be delivered to the applicant 2 if the muapb fails to take action to approve disapprove or conditionally approve the preliminary plat within ninety 90 days after the date of the first public hearing on said preliminary plat the preliminary plat shall be deemed approved as submitted unless the muapb for good reasons stated extends such time frame for a period not to exceed an additional ninety 90 days if the muapb fails to take such action within the extended period the preliminary plat shall be deemed approved as submitted 3 when a preliminary plat is approved with conditions the subdivider shall provide the responsible planning department with a revised preliminary plat consistent with the conditions set forth by the muapb prior to the submission of the final plat to the muapb vi7 4 once approved a preliminary plat shall be marked indicating it has been approved by the muapb if the preliminary plat has been revised pursuant to 3 the responsible planning department shall determine if it is in compliance with the requirements of the muapb and shall mark the revised preliminary plat accordingly 5 approval of the preliminary plat by the muapb does not constitute final acceptance of the subdivision but is merely an authorization to proceed to the preparation of the final plat 6307 effective period of preliminary approval a the approval of a preliminary plat shall be effective for a period of two 2 years upon written request by the subdivider made before the expiration of the period the muapb may extend the period of effectiveness for another period of two 2 years b the subdivider shall submit an application for approval of a final plat within the period of effectiveness including any authorized extensions thereof for the preliminary plat if no such application is filed within the period of effectiveness the approval of the preliminary plat shall be automatically deemed to have been withdrawn for good cause shown the muapb may allow the reinstatement of such approval in the event such approval is withdrawn and not reinstated the proposed subdivision in order to be approved must be reprocessed as a preliminary plat pursuant to these regulations in the event an application requests approval of a final plat for only a portion of the area covered by the preliminary plat and such request is approved the original preliminary plat shall be deemed to be considered in phases upon approval of such a final plat the approved portion shall be phase 1 and the balance of the preliminary plat shall be considered phase 2 the period of effectiveness for the approval of phase 2 shall be a period of two 2 years commencing on the date of approval of the final plat of phase 1 the process for the approval of a final plat for phase 2 shall be the same as for the original preliminary plat including but not limited to any request for an extension of the period of effectiveness and including the continued phasing of phase 2 into more phases c notwithstanding the period of effectiveness established in subparagraph a or b of this every plat shall conform to existing zoning regulations and subdivision regulations applicable at the time of final plat approval except that any such plat shall be exempt from any subsequent amendments to the zoning regulations rendering the preliminary plat as approved nonconforming as to bulk lot size or use regulations provided that the final plat approval is obtained within the vi8 period of effective approval of the preliminary plat part 4 application review and approval of final plats 6401 a following approval of a preliminary plat the subdivider may submit an application for review and approval of a final plat within the period of effectiveness as described in a and b on forms provided by the responsible planning department following approval of a final plat a subdivider may at any time submit an application for a replat of all or a portion of the parcel controlled by said final plat an application for a replat shall be treated in the same manner as a final plat except no application for a replat shall be deemed complete if all or any portion of the tract proposed to be replatted is subject to special assessments imposed by the city of manhattan until the subdivider submits the plan and said plan is approved by the citys planning department as required by b the following documents where applicable shall be attached to the application 1 the final plat and included information all as set forth in of these regulations 6402 review of application for final plat by responsible planning department a upon receipt of an application for approval of a final plat the responsible planning department shall review such application to determine if in the opinion of such planning department the final plat substantially conforms with the preliminary plat as approved by the muapb including conformance with any conditions and requirements imposed by the muapb  and that the final plat complies with all requirements of these regulations currently in effect if the responsible planning department determines the final plat so conforms and complies the planning department shall place approval of such final plat on the agenda of a meeting of the muapb in compliance with these regulations if the responsible planning department determines that the final plat does not conform or does not comply the planning department shall notify the subdivider of the discrepancies and of the action necessary to obtain conformance and compliance upon receipt of such notification the subdivider may 1 undertake to take the action suggested by the planning department and resubmit the application for approval of the final plat when such action is complete  or 2 if the planning department has found that the final plat vi9 does not substantially comply with the preliminary plat but that it is in compliance with these regulations currently in effect the subdivider may request that the application for appproval be scheduled with the muapb in order that the board can determine such conformance the subdivider may also request that the application for approval of the final plat be considered in the alternative as an application for approval of a preliminaryfinal plat in one action if the subdivider makes such a request the requirements of public hearing and notice as set forth in  shall apply b the final plat shall be deemed submitted to the secretary of the muapb when the responsible planning department determines that it is in substantial conformance with the preliminary plat and it complies with these regulations or when the subdivider makes a written request pursuant to a2 above 6403 review of final plat athe muapb shall approve the final plat if it is in substantial conformance with the preliminary plat as approved including all requirements and conditions placed upon such preliminary plat by the muapb  and the final plat complies with all requirements of these regulations as of the date of such final approval b the muapb shall determine if the final plat substantially conforms with the preliminary plat and if it complies with these regulations within sixty 60 days after the first meeting of the muapb following the date of submission of such final plat to the secretary of the muapb pursuant to b if such determination is not made within said period the final plat shall be deemed to have been approved unless the subdivider has agreed in writing to an extension of such period c if the muapb determines that the final plat is in substantial conformance to the preliminary plat and that it complies with these regulations there shall be endorsed on the final plat the fact that it has been submitted to and approved by the muapb if the final plat is deemed to be approved pursuant to b above a certificate indicating such approval shall be issued by the secretary upon demand dif events have occurred subsequent to the approval of the preliminary plat which raise issues that the muapb believes should be addressed pursuant to section 6306 b or 6306 c the muapb may make such requirements as are permitted by those prior to approval of the final plat vi10 e if the muapb determines that the final plat does not comply with these regulations or does not conform to the preliminary plat or both the muapb may deny approval of such final plat in such event the muapb shall set forth in writing its order of denial which shall also specifically set forth the factors the muapb relied upon in making such determination f if the muapb enters an order denying approval of a final plat it may also set a period of time within which the subdivider may resubmit the final plat with amendments thereto for reconsideration by the muapb 6404 governing body action abefore a final plat is recorded it shall be submitted to the responsible governing body for consideration of the acceptance of streets and other public ways service and utility easements and land dedicated for public use when within the corporate limits of the city acceptance of dedications shall be shown over the signature of the mayor or any other city official duly authorized to act during the absence or disability of the mayor and attested to by the city clerk when a final plat is located in the unincorporated areas ie urban service areas or urban area of the county it shall be submitted to the county commissioners for acceptance of dedications acceptance shall be shown over the signatures of the county commission and attested to by the county clerk bthe responsible governing body shall accept or refuse the dedication of land for public purposes within thirty 30 days after the first regularly scheduled meeting of said body following the date of official submission of the final plat to the said bodys clerk by the secretary of the muapb the responsible governing body may defer action for an additional thirty 30 days for the purpose of allowing for modifications to such dedications in order to comply with the requirements established by said body c if the governing body defers or refuses any such dedication it shall advise the subdivider and the muapb of the reasons therefore such reasons shall be solely related to the ownership improvement maintenance and use of such dedicated land d no final plat shall be filed of record or be effective if it contains dedications of land to the public that have not been accepted by the responsible governing body vi11 part 5 application review and approval of concurrent plat 6501 application requirements and approval procedure whenever a subdivision will consist of five 5 or fewer lots the subdivider may submit an application for the concurrent approval of a preliminary and final plat such application shall be on forms provided by the responsible planning department the application shall contain all the documents required for both preliminary plats and final plats and shall be reviewed simultaneously in the same manner required for preliminary and final plats part 6 recording of plat 6601 upon approval of a final plat and acceptance of all dedications by the appropriate governing body and upon submission of all documents required to be submitted with a final plat the responsible planning department shall file the final plat with the appropriate register of deeds if all documents required to be submitted with a final plat have not been submitted within one 1 year of the date upon which the appropriate governing body accepted the dedications or within one 1 year of the approval of the final plat whichever date is later the approval of such final plat shall be deemed to have been withdrawn and such final plat shall not be filed until it has been submitted again for approval part 7 application review and approval of lot splits and boundary line adjustments 6701 a the responsible planning department is hereby authorized to review and either approve or disapprove both lot splits and boundary line adjustments in accordance with these regulations b applications for either lot splits or boundary line adjustments shall be submitted to the responsible planning department on forms provided by the department such application shall include a survey prepared by land surveyor licensed in the state of kansas showing the lots involved the precise location of all structures and easements thereon the location of all streets and rightsofways and location and dimensions of all boundary lines as they currently exist and as they are proposed such application shall also identify any restrictive covenants that are applicable to the property involved 6702 consideration of lot splits a the responsible planning department shall approve an application for a lot split if the application requests the dividing of a lot into two 2 lots and the original lot has not been previously split and both new lots conform to the requirements of these regulations the vi12 responsible planning department may approve an application for a lot split that requests the dividing of a lot into more than two 2 lots if in the opinion of the responsible planning department the proposed split does not create lots that are out of character with the original subdivision and all new lots conform to the requirements of these regulations b no lot split shall be approved if 1 a vacation modification or addition of streets alleys setback lines access control or easement is required or proposed 2 an installation of a public facility is required or proposed 3 the lot split will result in a lot without access to a street or to adequate services or which cannot meet flood plain requirements 4 a substandard sized lot will be created according to applicable zoning regulations or sanitary code 5 a newly created lot will not comply with these regulations 6 any newly created lot will be in violation of any applicable restrictive covenants filed of record the responsible planning department shall be entitled to rely upon the information provided by the applicant regarding the existence of such restrictive covenants 7 any other factor which in the opinion of the responsible planning department fails to comply with the intent and purpose of existing land development regulations and governing body policies c no building permit shall be issued for a lot created by a lot split until the lot split has been approved by the responsible planning department d the director or their designee of the responsible planning department shall either approve approve with conditions or disapprove the lot split within 30 days after submittal of the application upon approval of a lot split the applicant shall prepare a lot split survey as described in of these regulations 6703 consideration of boundary line adjustments a the responsible planning department may approve a boundary line adjustment if in the opinion of the responsible planning department vi13 the boundary line adjustment does not create lots that are out of character with the original subdivision and all lots after the boundary line adjustment conform to the requirements of these regulations b no boundary line adjustment shall be approved if 1 the adjustment causes one or both lots to be substandard sized lots according to applicable zoning regulations or sanitary code 2 the adjustment causes one or both lots to not comply with these regulations 3 the adjustment causes one or both lots to be in violation of any applicable restrictive covenants filed of record the responsible planning department shall be entitled to rely upon the information provided by the applicant regarding the existence of such restrictive covenants 4 the adjustment causes any other factor which in the opinion of the responsible planning department fails to comply with the intent and purpose of existing land development regulations and governing body policies c the director or their designee of the responsible planning department shall either approve approve with conditions or disapprove the boundary line adjustment within 30 days after submittal of the application upon approval of a boundary line adjustment the applicant shall prepare a boundary line adjustment survey as described in of these regulations vi14 vii1 article vii contents and submission requirements for plats and plans part 1 sketch and concept plat 7101 a sketch and concept plats may be free hand pencil drawings that are drawn to a convenient scale no smaller than one inch to one hundred feet 1   100 three 3 copies of the sketch or concept plat shall be submitted when required sketch and concept plats shall show the following information 1 approximate topography or some indication of ridge lines and steep slope areas  2 location and direction of all water courses and areas subject to potential flooding  3 natural features such as rock outcroppings marshes lakes streams wetlands critical areas for habitats for endangered or threatened wildlife and native flora and fauna wooded areas riparian woodlands steep slopes isolated preservable trees and other community assets as set forth in   4 approximate location of existing structures ie buildings bridges or culverts utility lines or other aboveground structures on or adjacent to the tract  5 existing zoning proposed zoning and land uses of the site and adjacent areas  6 location of property lines existing easements or rightsofway on or adjacent to the tract and their width and purpose  7 approximate location and size of existing sewers water mains gas mains and other underground structures within the tract or adjacent thereto  8 location of existing and proposed public facilities such as schools parks playgrounds open space linear trails and other public areas or features on or adjacent to the tract  9 approximate location and widths of proposed streets fire department access easements pedestrian easements bike routes and preliminary proposals for connection with existing water supply and sanitary sewer  10 the layout of proposed residential lots commercial andor industrial lots  vii2 11 the name of the proposed subdivision  12 the name address and phone number of the owner of record subdivider of the subdivision and consultant that prepared the sketchconcept plat and 13 a brief written description of the nature and type of development that is envisioned to occur on the land covered by the concept plan shall accompany the concept plan part 2 preliminary plat 7201 a the preliminary plat shall be drawn to a scale no smaller than one inch to one hundred feet 1   100  however areas over 100 acres may be at a scale of one inch to two hundred feet 1   200 six 6 copies of the plat shall be submitted with the application the preliminary plat shall contain the following information 1 the proposed name of the subdivision this name shall not duplicate or resemble the name of any existing subdivision within the city or the county names of new subdivisions shall not be so similar in sound andor spelling to existing subdivisions as to cause confusion or misunderstanding subdivision names shall be subject to the review of the responsible planning and engineering departments  2 the true north point scale of drawing including a graphic scale and the date of preparation  3 an identification clearly stating that the plat is a preliminary plat  4 a vicinity map showing the location of the subdivision in relation to major streets  5 names of adjacent subdivisions or in the case of unplatted land the name of the owners of adjacent property  6 the name address and phone number of the owners of record the subdivider and the licensed professional engineer and other consultants that prepared the plat  7 the location widths and names of all proposed and existing public or private streets within or adjacent to the tract together with easements rightsofway and other important features such as section lines and corners city boundary lines and monuments  vii3 8 contour lines or spot elevations based on usgs datum with date of survey having the following intervals a two 2 foot contour intervals  or b spot elevations where the ground is too flat for contours  or c five 5 foot contour intervals when the average slope of the subdivision exceeds five 5% percent  or d any other contour intervals deemed necessary or appropriate by the responsible engineering department 9 the location and direction of all watercourses and areas subject to flooding including identification of the 100 year and 500 year flood plains and the flood plain zones ie floodway and floodway fringe including base flood elevations and other areas outside the 100 year and 500 year flood plains that are subject to or are known to have been subject to periodic flooding and if known recorded flood depths in flooded areas  10 natural features such as rock outcroppings marshes lakes streams wetlands critical areas for habitats for endangered or threatened wildlife and native flora and fauna wooded areas riparian woodlands steep slopes isolated preservable trees and other community assets as set forth in   11 existing use of the property including the location of all existing structures ie buildings bridges or culverts showing those that will be removed and those that will remain on the property after the final plat is recorded  12 the horizontal and vertical location direction of flow and size of all existing utilities and drainage improvements adjacent to and within the proposed subdivision  13 zoning on and adjacent to the tract  14 location elevation and description of the bench mark controlling the vertical survey  15 the legal description of the subdivision with distances and bearings along boundary lines and with distance and direction to the monuments used to locate the land described in the certificate of survey  vii4 16 the proposed use of the land whether for single family two family multiple family commercial or industrial schools parks or other uses and the proposed zoning classification  17 proposed streets showing the location names andor labels widths and approximate grades the preliminary plat shall show the relationship of all existing streets to any proposed streets or to any development plan adopted by the muapb and any dedications that have been accepted by the governing body  18 proposed easements showing width and purpose  19 proposed lots showing approximate dimensions square footage and proposed lot numbers numbering of lots shall be in a consecutive order in both a logical and physical sequence  20 proposed location size and type of utilities to be installed including direction of flow  21 proposed sites to be dedicated or reserved for park playground or other public purposes  22 proposed front building setback lines along all rightsofway and travel easements  23 proposed location layout elevation type and size of water mains fire hydrants sanitary sewer mains and laterals storm sewers culverts and street improvements including sidewalks bike routes and street lights and how they connect to the existing or proposed systems  24 in the case of residential subdivisions the proposed net density of the development shall be noted on the plat and shall be expressed in terms of numbers of dwelling units per net acre  and 25 proposed phasing boundaries and final plat schedule b additional data and information to be submitted with an application for preliminary plat include the following statements andor plans which shall accompany the preliminary plat and when convenient may be shown on the preliminary plat 1 a drainage report and plan shall be submitted unless such submittal is waived by the responsible city or county engineer subject to the requirements of the stormwater management master plan or if vii5 within the urban area then a drainage report shall be submitted subject to the riley county storm drainage design criteria for platted areas 2 proposed deed restrictions if any in outline form 3 a listing if applicable of all offsite improvements to be incorporated in the proposed subdivision 4 any additional reports studies or documents such as percolation tests grading plans for steep slopes or as may be required by the responsible planning department or the muapb in order to completely review the proposed subdivision 5 requests for variations 6 utility release forms of appropriate utility shall be submitted 7 a transportation impact study shall be submitted unless such submittal is waived by the responsible city or county engineer based on the development triggers and minimum study requirements listed in the manhattan area transportation strategy connecting to 2020 minimum study requirements include a identify the specific development plan under study and any existing development on the site land use types and intensities and the arrangement of buildings parking and access b identify the functional classification of the public streets to be accessed c document current public street characteristics number and types of lanes speed limits or 85th percentile speeds and sight distances along the public street from proposed access d compare proposed access with established design criteria typically driveway spacing alignment with other streets and driveways width of driveway and minimum sight distances e determine number of trips generated by the existing and proposed development  daily and peak hours  using the latest edition of trip generation published by the institute of transportation engineers local trip generation characteristics may be used if deemed to be properly collected and consistent with the subject development application calculate the net difference in trips between existing and proposed uses vii6 f document the current peak hour traffic volumes at each proposed access driveway on a typical weekday tuesday wednesday thursday traffic volumes should be measured on the public streets and at any existing site driveways the time periods in which existing traffic is counted should generally coincide with the highest combination of existing traffic plus traffic expected to be generated by the proposed development g distribute and assign the net development trips site driveways h conduct volumecapacity analyses for peak hours at site driveway intersections using methodologies outlined in the latest edition of the highway capacity manual published by the transportation research board the analyses should be conducted for both existing conditions and existing plus development conditions i compare existing plus development conditions with established guidelinespolicies for acceptable levels of service and turn lanes j identify geometric and traffic control improvements to mitigate deficiencies andor comply with established guidelinespolicies k prepare a typewritten report outlining the findings and conclusions of the study including exhibits illustrating the site plan traffic volumes and existing street conditions l possible additional requirements 1 extend the study to other street segments andor intersections on the public street system 2 compare the traffic impacts of the proposed land use with the traffic impacts of the land use in the comprehensive land use plan 3 evaluate future 20year conditions 4 extend the study to include peak periods outside the typical weekday commuter periods ie am ad pm peak periods for example saturday in areas with significant retail development vii7 8 notwithstanding that the responsible city or county engineer may waive the requirement for submittal of a drainage report and plan andor a transportation impact study the muapb may require submittal of a drainage report and plan andor transportation impact study prior to taking action on an application any decision by the muapb to require such submittal shall be final part 3  final plat 7301 the final plat shall be prepared by an engineer or land surveyor licensed to do work in the state of kansas it shall be drawn in waterproof black ink on  inch mylar cronoflex engineering photographic film or its equivalent as may be approved by the muapb the permitted sheet sizes shall be twentyfour 24 inches by thirtysix 36 inches larger sizes will not be accepted the scale shall be no smaller than one inch to one hundred feet 1   100 except that a variation in scale may be allowed where the responsible planning department determines it is necessary for a proper exhibit of the subdivision when more than one 1 sheet is used for any plat each such sheet shall be numbered consecutively and each sheet shall contain a notation showing the whole number of sheets eg sheet 1 of 3 sheets linear dimensions shall be given in feet and decimals of a foot to the nearest one hundredth of a foot information shall be provided on the final plat necessary for the reproduction of the plat on the ground six 6 copies of the final plat shall be submitted with the application 7302 a final plats shall be prepared with the accuracy required for traverse data the following sheets or drawings shall be submitted with the final plat 1 traverse data for the plat with the error of closure not more than one 1 in ten thousand 10000  and 2 the location of all stakes monuments or other evidence found or set on the ground used to determine the boundaries of the plat b the final plat shall contain the following information 1 the name of the subdivision adjacent subdivisions or landowners identification clearly stating that the plat is a final plat  2 the date scale of drawing including graphic scale true north point legend and controlling physical features such as water courses highways and railroads  vii8 3 a vicinity map with current zoning identified on and adjacent to the tract  4 square footage of each proposed lot for city plats square footage or acreage of each proposed lot for county plats  5 a legal description of the tract boundaries and any dedicated rightsofway and the total acreage of the tract listed in the legal description  6 all monuments tract boundaries block boundaries streets or other rightsofway lines with distances and bearings referenced to section corners where these lines follow a curve the central angle the radius points of curvature length of curve and length of intermediate tangents shall be shown in addition using dotted lines the lines of all adjacent lands and streets and alleys with their widths and names  except that in the case of a replat of a platted subdivision if it can be determined that the requirements for the location of the subdivision and ties to section corners have been sufficiently referenced then the distances and bearings to section corners need not be shown on the replat  7 lot lines with dimensions and bearings  8 lot numbers beginning with the number one 1 and numbered consecutively phases or units of a subdivision  9 the width of the portion of the rightofway being dedicated and the width of any existing rightofway  10 all easements shall be denoted by fine dashed lines clearly identified and if already on record the recorded reference of such easements if an easement is not definitely located of record a statement of such easement shall be included the width of the easement with sufficient ties to locate it definitely with respect to the subdivision must be shown if the easement is being dedicated plat map it shall be properly referenced in the owners certificate  11 identification of the 100 and 500 year flood plain and the floodway and floodway fringe boundaries on the final plat including elevations of these lines  12 identification of the riley county n1 airport noise hazard district and airport overlay district when applicable  vii9 13 land parcels to be dedicated for any purpose public or private to be distinguished from lots or tracts intended for sale  14 front building setback lines along all rightsofway and travel easements  15 the name of each street shown on the subdivision plat  16 location and elevation of permanent bench mark if required  17 no access shall be designated by perpendicular dashed lines along rightofway lines access points shall be designated as a break in the no access and labeled as access access points shall conform with the subdivision layout standards  18 any variations of the subdivision layout standards granted by the muapb shall be noted on the final plat  19 letters as required by e from each of such companies or persons supplying electrical or communications service indicating that said arrangements have been made shall be submitted to the applicable planning department at the time that application is made for a final plat  and 20 any additional reports studies or documents as may be required by the responsible planning department or the muapb in order to completely review the final plat c the following additional documents and other information shall accompany the final plat 1 a check payable to the county register of deeds in an amount to be determined by the county register of deeds to pay for the recording of the final plat and any other documents to be filed with the county register of deeds  and 2 the original of a certificate of title issued by an approved title company showing the ownership for all parts of the subdivision for the final plat the final plat will not be approved unless the owners reflected thereon are confirmed by the certificate of title the muapb and the responsible planning department shall be entitled to assume that the owners reflected on the certificate of title are the lawful owners of the subject property  and vii10 3 a county treasurers receipt that all taxes are paid in full for all parts of the proposed subdivision  and 4 a complete application on the forms provided by the responsible planning department d upon acceptance of dedications by the responsible governing body the final plat shall be submitted in digital format approved by the responsible planning department the digital version shall contain at a minimum the information required in a12 and b117 any final plat not submitted in digital format will be converted by the city or county and the cost will be billed and shall be paid by the applicant prior to recording of the plat 7303 the following certification shall appear on a final plat a at the time the final plat is submitted to the muapb it shall contain 1 a certification of ownership and a dedication of the public rightsofway and easements by the owner duly acknowledged in front of a notary public and in a form approved by the responsible planning department  and 2 a surveyors certification indicating that such person is duly licensed by the applicable authority and that the property was surveyed by such person in accordance with all applicable rules and laws duly acknowledged by a notary public and in a form approved by the responsible planning department b subsequent to approval of the final plat by the muapb it shall contain a certification by the chairperson of the muapb that such final plat has been submitted to and approved by or deemed approved by the muapb in a form approved by the responsible planning department c subsequent to acceptance of the dedicated public rightsofway and easements the final plat shall contain a certification by the applicable governing body or the appropriate representative thereof indicating such acceptance in a form approved by the responsible planning department d the responsible planning department may require additional certifications such as 1 a certificate by the applicable planning department as to the applicability of a planned unit development pud  or 2 an approval as to form by the applicable attorney vii11 part 4 lot splits and boundary line adjustments 7401 lot splits a upon approval of a lot split by the responsible planning department the applicant shall prepare a lot split survey the lot split survey shall be prepared in accordance with the approval of the application the lot split survey shall indicate as a title that it is a lot split of lot ___ of ______ subdivision the lot split survey shall be prepared in the same manner with all of the same information where applicable as a final plat in addition all documents required to be submitted with a final plat shall also be submitted with a lot split survey the lot split survey shall contain the following 1 a surveyors certification indicating that such person is duly licensed by the applicable authority and that the property was surveyed by such person in accordance with all applicable rules and laws duly acknowledged by a notary public and in a form approved by the responsible planning department 2 a certification by the director or designee of the responsible planning department indicating that it has been submitted to and approved by such responsible planning department pursuant to these regulations in a form approved by the responsible planning department b the responsible planning department shall file the lot split with the appropriate register of deeds when all requirements of this been met if such requirements have not been met within one 1 year of the approval of the lot split the approval shall have been deemed to have been withdrawn and the lot split survey shall not be filed without a reapproval by the responsible planning department 7402 boundary line adjustments a upon approval of a boundary line adjustment by the responsible planning department the applicant shall prepare a boundary line adjustment survey the boundary line adjustment survey shall be prepared in accordance with the approval of the application the boundary line adjustment survey shall indicate as a title that it is a boundary line adjustment of lot ___ and lot ____of ______ subdivision the boundary line adjustment survey shall be prepared in the same manner with all of the same information where applicable as a final plat in addition all documents required to be submitted with a final plat shall also be submitted with a lot split survey the boundary line adjustment survey shall vii12 contain the following 1 a surveyors certification indicating that such person is duly licensed by the applicable authority and that the property was surveyed by such person in accordance with all applicable rules and laws duly
